Abendego's Squall (1-2).name: Abendego's Squall (1-2)
Abendego's Squall (1-2).descriptionHazard: A massive orca known as Abendego's Squall leaps from the water. Its mouth opens to snap against any part of the ship that it can reach.
Abendego's Squall (1-2).disable: @Check[medicine|dc:20] (trained) to remove the harpoon, @Check[nature|dc:17] (trained) to calm the orca, or @Check[intimidation|dc:20] (trained) to scare the orca away; two total successes are required to subdue the orca
Abendego's Squall (1-2).reset: The orca returns to hunt down the Snapdragon after 8 hours.
Abendego's Squall (1-2).routine:
d Abendego's Squall Leaps over the Snapdragon with each action. When it lands, it deals @Damage[1] damage to the Snapdragon. All creatures on the deck take @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} until the end of its next turn.

Speed 30 feet

action->Thar She Blows.name: Thar She Blows
action->Thar She Blows.description:
Trigger Abendego's Squall matches speed with the Snapdragon

Effect The orca leaps across the Snapdragon and tears its main mast from the deck in the process. This deals @Damage[30] damage to the Snapdragon. All creatures on deck take @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning]] damage from the shrapnel and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|showDC:gm|basic] save. Abendego's Squall rolls initiative.

Abendego's Squall (3-4).name: Abendego's Squall (3-4)
Abendego's Squall (3-4).descriptionHazard: A massive orca known as Abendego's Squall leaps from the water. Its mouth opens to snap against any part of the ship that it can reach.
Abendego's Squall (3-4).disable: @Check[medicine|dc:23] (trained) to remove the harpoon, @Check[nature|dc:21] (trained) to calm the orca, or @Check[intimidation|dc:23] (trained) to scare the orca away; two total successes are required to subdue the orca
Abendego's Squall (3-4).routine:
d Abendego's Squall thrashes against the hull of the Snapdragon. With each action, it makes a flipper Strike against a PC adjacent to the railing. Whenever it makes a flipper Strike, it also deals its Strike damage to the ship whether or not the Strike was successful.

Speed 30 feet

action->Thar She Blows.name: Thar She Blows
action->Thar She Blows.description:
Trigger Abendego's Squall matches speed with the Snapdragon

All creatures on deck take @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]] damage from the shrapnel and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|showDC:gm|basic] save. Abendego's Squall rolls initiative.

Abendego's Squall (5-6).descriptionHazard: Abendego's Squall leaps from the water. Its mouth opens to snap against any part of the ship that it can reach.
Abendego's Squall (5-6).disable: @Check[medicine|dc:23] (expert) to remove the harpoon, @Check[nature|dc:25] (trained) to calm the orca, or @Check[intimidation|dc:27] (expert) to scare the orca away; two total successes are required to subdue the orca
Abendego's Squall (5-6).routine:
d Abendego's Squall thrashes against the hull of the Snapdragon. With each action, it makes a flipper Strike against a PC adjacent to the railing. Whenever it makes a flipper Strike, it also deals its Strike damage to the ship whether or not the Strike was successful.

Speed 30 feet

action->Thar She Blows.name: Thar She Blows
action->Thar She Blows.description:
Trigger Abendego's Squall matches speed with the Snapdragon

Effect The orca leaps across the Snapdragon and tears its main mast from the deck in the process. This deals @Damage[30] damage to the Snapdragon. All creatures on deck take @Damage[(4d8+4)[bludgeoning]] damage from the shrapnel and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25|showDC:gm|basic] save. Abendego's Squall rolls initiative.

Abendego's Squall (7-8).name: Abendego's Squall (7-8)
Abendego's Squall (7-8).descriptionHazard: Abendego's Squall leaps from the water. Its mouth opens to snap against any part of the ship that it can reach.
Abendego's Squall (7-8).disable: @Check[medicine|dc:23] (expert) to remove the harpoon, @Check[nature|dc:23] (trained), or @Check[intimidation|dc:23] (expert) to scare the orca away; two total successes are required to subdue the orca
Abendego's Squall (7-8).reset: The Abendego's Squall returns to hunt down the Snapdragon after 8 hours.
Abendego's Squall (7-8).routine:
d The Abendego's Squall Leaps over the Snapdragon with each action. When it lands, it deals @Damage[4] damage to the Snapdragon. All creatures on the deck take @Damage[(3d10+40)[bludgeoning]] and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} until the end of its next turn.

Speed 30 feet

action->Thar She Blows.name: Thar She Blows
action->Thar She Blows.description:
Trigger Abendego's Squall matches speed with the Snapdragon

Effect The orca leaps across the Snapdragon and tears its main mast from the deck in the process. This deals @Damage[30] damage to the Snapdragon. All creatures on deck take @Damage[(3d12+4)[bludgeoning]] damage from the shrapnel and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:28|showDC:gm|basic] save. Abendego's Squall rolls initiative.

Accursed Cargo (1-2).name: Accursed Cargo (1-2)
Accursed Cargo (1-2).descriptionHazard: A wooden crate bearing a chthonic sigil glows with a power contained within it.
Accursed Cargo (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18] (trained) to open the crate with gradual release of its magical energy, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 15) to dispel the rune

action->Planar Depressurization.name: Planar Depressurization
action->Planar Depressurization.description:
Trigger A creature touches the sigil on the crate

Effect The incomplete demonic pact causes the crate to explode. Bits of wood and energy from the Outer Rifts deal @Damage[(1d6+2)[bludgeoning],(1d6+2)[spirit]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} of it (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic]).

Accursed Cargo (3-4).name: Accursed Cargo (3-4)
Accursed Cargo (3-4).descriptionHazard: A wooden crate bearing a chthonic sigil glows with a power contained within it.
Accursed Cargo (3-4).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:22] (trained) to open the crate with gradual release of its magical energy, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18) to dispel the rune

action->Planar Depressurization.name: Planar Depressurization
action->Planar Depressurization.description:
Trigger A creature touches the sigil on the crate

Effect The incomplete demonic pact causes the crate to explode. Bits of wood and energy from the Outer Rifts deal @Damage[(2d8+5)[bludgeoning],(2d8+5)[spirit]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} of it (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic]).

Accursed Cargo (5-6).name: Accursed Cargo (5-6)
Accursed Cargo (5-6).descriptionHazard: A wooden crate bearing a chthonic sigil glows with a power contained within it.
Accursed Cargo (5-6).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25] (trained) to open the crate with gradual release of its magical energy, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 21) to dispel the rune

action->Planar Depressurization.name: Planar Depressurization
action->Planar Depressurization.description:
Trigger A creature touches the sigil on the crate

Effect The incomplete demonic pact causes the crate to explode. Bits of wood and energy from the Outer Rifts deal @Damage[(2d8+9)[bludgeoning],(2d8+9)[spirit]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} of it (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic]).

Accursed Cargo (7-8).name: Accursed Cargo (7-8)
Accursed Cargo (7-8).descriptionHazard: A wooden crate bearing a chthonic sigil glows with a power contained within it.
Accursed Cargo (7-8).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28] (trained) to open the crate with gradual release of its magical energy, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 24) to dispel the rune

action->Planar Depressurization.name: Planar Depressurization
action->Planar Depressurization.description:
Trigger A creature touches the sigil on the crate

Effect The incomplete demonic pact causes the crate to explode. Bits of wood and energy from the Outer Rifts deal @Damage[(2d10+11)[bludgeoning],(2d10+11)[spirit]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} of it (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]).

action->Acid Spurt.name: Acid Spurt
action->Acid Spurt.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The acid ooze spurts a blast of acid at a target (range 10 feet) dealing @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save.

Adolescent Kirin.name: Adolescent Kirin
Adolescent Kirin.publicNotes:
Symbols of grace and purity, unicorns resemble proud and noble horses. They typically have pure white coats, but they are best known for the single, delicate horn that extends from the center of their forehead. While unicorns often serve as protectors of unspoiled wilderness and sacred places, they are themselves highly sought after for their horns, which are said to possess potent magical properties. To many, the mere idea of hunting such a magnificent creature in the hopes of severing its horn is utterly reprehensible. Indeed, a dehorned unicorn is a sorry sight, and few such unicorns survive much longer in the wild.

Unicorns are found almost exclusively in remote, unsullied areas of wilderness. Sometimes associated with good-aligned deities, other times associated with nature and the fey, unicorns are always known for their righteousness and nobility. They are wary, at best, of most humanoid creatures, due in large part to poachers' tendency to hunt them for their horns, but unicorns are often rumored to have a weakness for those who are pure of both heart and spirit. Despite some tales, unicorns are equally likely to recognize purity in people of all genders.

action->Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
action->Animal Empathy.description: The kirin has a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows them to communicate with animals. They can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

action->Ghost Touch.name: Ghost Touch
action->Ghost Touch.description: A kirin's Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.

action->Powerful Charge.name: Powerful Charge
action->Powerful Charge.description: The kirin Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn Strike. If the kirin moved at least 20 feet, it deals an additional @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage on a hit.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: An amalgam ooze can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Body Spout.name: Body Spout
action->Body Spout.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The amalgam ooze spews liquid from its body at a creature, roll [[/gmr 1d6]] to determine the effect using the table below. Each is resisted with a successful @Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save:

1: @Damage[(1d6+2)[acid]] damage

2–3: @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage

4–5: @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage

6: restore @Damage[1d6[healing]] hit points

action->Dazzling Surface.name: Dazzling Surface
action->Dazzling Surface.description:
Requirements The amalgam ooze is targeted by an attack

Effect The multicolored surface of the amalgam ooze shifts rapidly. The attacking creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of its next turn unless it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

armor->Cultist Robes (Functioning as Lea.name: Cultist Robes (Functioning as Leather Armor)
armor->Cultist Robes (Functioning as Lea.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Bog Rot.name: Bog Rot
action->Bog Rot.description:
This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

action->Deskari's Rage.name: Deskari's Rage
action->Deskari's Rage.description: Amriya tightens hir group on Rotcarver and attempts a powerful Strike against hir enemy. On a success, ze deals an additional 1d10 piercing damage.

action->Rot and Ruin.name: Rot and Ruin
action->Rot and Ruin.description: Amriya's mouth opens, spewing forth a vapor that triggers rot and decay. All creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] must attempt a basic @Check[fortitude|dc:25|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:sickened] saving throw or take @Damage[3d12[void]|options:area-damage] damage. On a critical failure, creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} for 1 minute.

consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).name: Healing Potion (Minor)
consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[1d8[healing]] Hit Points.

action->I'll Make You Regret This!.name: I'll Make You Regret This!
action->I'll Make You Regret This!.description: The Chelaxian adjutant threatens their foes. All foes within 30 feet of the adjutant are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. They cannot reduce their frightened value so long as the adjutant maintains this ability. The adjutant must spend an action each round to maintain it.

Angry Mordant Spire Plunderer.name: Angry Mordant Spire Plunderer
Angry Mordant Spire Plunderer.publicNotes:
A ship's boatswain, or bosun, leads the deckhands who maintain the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

weapon->Naval Pike.name: Naval Pike
weapon->Naval Pike.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

action->Pike and Strike.name: Pike and Strike
action->Pike and Strike.description: The plunderer makes a melee Strike with their naval pike. If this Strike hits, the plunderer can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a fist Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the first Strike.

action->Plunderer's Command.name: Plunderer's Command
action->Plunderer's Command.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The plunderer orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the plunderer's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WfiaKdXNSxC3POcs]{Effect: Bosun's Command}

Angry Victims.name: Angry Victims
Angry Victims.descriptionHazard: The souls of the ghouls' recent meals cry out from their pile of bones in the nearby tunnel, lamenting their fate.
Angry Victims.disable: @Check[religion|dc:12] (trained) sets the spirits at ease, or @Check[deception|dc:15], @Check[diplomacy|dc:15], or @Check[intimidation|dc:15] to convince the spirits to not interfere right now. A single success disables the haunt. PCs may accrue additional successes beyond the first—each one convinces the haunt to use telekinetic interference once against ghouls in the haunt's range instead of the living creatures.
Angry Victims.routine: (two actions) The haunt uses one action to activate its gurgling gasp and then uses telekinetic interference for all of its other actions until it can use gurgling gasp again.

action->Remember Us!.name: Remember Us!
action->Remember Us!.description:
Trigger Combat begins

Effect The haunt rolls initiative.

action->Gurgling Gasp.name: Gurgling Gasp
action->Gurgling Gasp.description: The haunt emits a cacophony of the ghoul victims' death rattles, forcing all living creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:80]{80 feet} to attempt a @Check[will|dc:16|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to gurgling gasp for 1 hour. The haunt cannot use gurgling gasp again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Gurgling Gasp]]{1d6 rounds}.

action->Telekinetic Interference.name: Telekinetic Interference
action->Telekinetic Interference.description: The haunt attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} a living creature within 60 feet with a bonus of [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8}.

Animated Flame.name: Animated Flame
Animated Flame.publicNotes:
Although arguably quite friendly, fire scamps are considered far more dangerous than their kin. They delight in fire and playing pranks on everyone they befriend. Even given time to understand others' dislike of fire, most fire scamps enjoy the feel of flames enough to constantly test their limits.

Compared to the nations of other scamps, the nations on the Plane of Fire are by far the strongest. This backing inspires fire scamps to challenge authority more quickly than the others.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

action->Panic of Failure Foreseen.name: Panic of Failure Foreseen
action->Panic of Failure Foreseen.description: If the animated flame leaves the village, willingly or otherwise, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} for 2 rounds.

action->Price of Failure.name: Price of Failure
action->Price of Failure.description: If the animated flame starts its turn outside the village after it arrives, it dissipates.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The animated flame ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

action->Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath
action->Flame Breath.description:
The animated flame breathes flames in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d4[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

The animated flame can't use Flame Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Flame Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Elemental Draw.name: Elemental Draw
action->Elemental Draw.description: The baby scamp swarm can sense creatures with a connection to the elements. It is drawn to creatures that have cast an elemental spell or used an elemental ability within the last round.

action->Elemental Conduit.name: Elemental Conduit
action->Elemental Conduit.description: A creature within the swarm's space that casts an elemental spell or uses an elemental ability does not need to make a flat check. Additionally, the baby scamps empower their spell causing the save DC to be 1 higher.

action->We're Helping!.name: We're Helping!
action->We're Helping!.description:
The Young scamps all try to help the creatures in their space at the same time. Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The creature is affected as if @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance} had been cast on them.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} until the end of their next turn.

action->Wing Buffet.name: Wing Buffet
action->Wing Buffet.description: Each creature within the baby scamp swarm's space takes @Damage[3d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

Apple Turnover.name: Apple Turnover
Apple Turnover.descriptionHazard: A fruit merchant's cart has been poorly secured. The slightest careless bump on the way past is enough to knock it over and topple the fruit it carries all over the street.
Apple Turnover.disable: If all the PCs succeed on a Perception check against the Stealth DC to spot the hazard, they're able to pass by that cart without triggering it. There's not enough time for PCs who succeed on this check to warn PCs who fail.

action->Topple.name: Topple
action->Topple.description:
Trigger A PC passes by the cart without succeeding on the Perception check against its Stealth DC

Effect The cart tips, causing an avalanche of apples that pour over the PCs and onto the street. PCs who failed the Perception check against the hazard's Stealth DC are caught in the hazard must make their choice of a Reflex or Fortitude save, DC 19. On a successful save, they dodge the worst of the applefall and come away unscathed; on a failed save, they're battered by the falling apples and walk away @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for the rest of the adventure.

Triggering this hazard also accrues 1 AP for the party.

Arrogant Foroxicks.name: Arrogant Foroxicks
Arrogant Foroxicks.publicNotes:
Wargs hunt in packs like wolves, but their penchant for taunting victims makes them easy to distinguish from their cousins. Orcs and hobgoblins frequently recruit wargs. Most wargs are amenable to this arrangement, but if food should run out, wargs are more than willing to integrate goblinoid flesh into their diet.

The warg is an intelligent and malevolent wolf that dwells among goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, and violent humanoids.

action->Do Your Job!.name: Do Your Job!
action->Do Your Job!.description: Foroxicks commands an ally to aid him. One ally uses a reaction to move up to their Speed into an open space to flank with Foroxicks.

action->Avenging Bite.name: Avenging Bite
action->Avenging Bite.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the Foroxicks's jaws attacks one of the warg's allies.

Effect Foroxicks makes a jaws Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: Foroxicks's Strikes deals an extra 1d6 damage to any creature within reach of at least two of his allies.

action->Pompous Rage.name: Pompous Rage
action->Pompous Rage.description:
Foroxicks becomes enraged if his silks, golden mirrors, or throne are damaged. He takes a –2 circumstance penalty to his jaws attack, but each hit deals 3 additional points of piercing damage for three rounds as he attacks with uncontrolled fury.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.campaign-effects.Item.ALYd08DB00ZeoHAp]{Effect: Pompous Rage}

action->Winter Breath.name: Winter Breath
action->Winter Breath.description: Foroxicks breathes a cloud of frost in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] dealing @Damage[(5d8 - 4)[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). He can't use Winter Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Winter Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Ascending Xalreonshin.name: Ascending Xalreonshin
Ascending Xalreonshin.publicNotes:
Imugi (ee-moo-ghee) are dragon-like serpents with great mystic potential, including that of ascension into another form. While some imperial dragons are born to their birthright, many that currently roam Tian Xia are ascended imugi—though they would strike down anyone who claimed such.

To become an imperial dragon, imugi must care for a koi egg for a thousand years. The power from the nurtured egg hatching is enough to power a draconic ascension ritual, and whatever power lingers transforms the koi into an imugi to continue the cycle. The kind of imperial dragon that the imugi becomes depends on where it chooses to nurture the koi egg. Imugi strongly prefer long-finned koi, and Tian koi farmers have learned to keep a separate pool of these butterfly koi away from the others they tend, as imugi tend to displace quite a bit of water—and koi—when swooping down to snatch an egg they want.

Though imugi have some power over rain and storms, most aren't powerful enough to exact a true sense of weather control. Many are known for their benevolence, and some villages even rely on imugi's forays out of streams or lakes, bringing rains during the growing season. Imugi have as wide a range of temperaments as the dragons they become, and some are notorious for how their impatience twists into a foul temper or an arrogance that flicks people aside as if they were bugs. While some might consider mean-spirited imugi corrupted and claim they can be purified somehow, imugi simply hold themselves higher than the average creature and see no reason to conceal their true nature from someone they see as beneath them.
Ascending Xalreonshin.privateNotes:
Imperial Ascension

The ritual an imugi undergoes to become a true dragon releases a burst of overwhelming magic. Characters exposed to this burst might find their minds filled with lost techniques or abilities that the imugi has encountered over its long life, allowing them to gain access to uncommon or rare character options, suddenly understand formulas to craft items, or immediately retrain along a new path

action->Nesting.name: Nesting
action->Nesting.description: By coiling around a butterfly koi egg for 1 minute, the imugi designates it as their chosen heir, which grants the imugi the effects of a constant status spell on that egg. If the egg is destroyed or otherwise made nonviable, the imugi can choose a new koi egg with this ability after 1 week.

action->Parental Wrath.name: Parental Wrath
action->Parental Wrath.description:
Trigger A creature damages the imugi's chosen koi egg or ends its turn within 40 feet of the egg

Effect The imugi Strides or Swims toward the triggering creature. If they end their movement within reach of the creature, they can attempt a melee Strike against it.

action->Floodwaters.name: Floodwaters
action->Floodwaters.description: Waters rush forth in a @Template[type:line|distance:60], dealing @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save and aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the imugi are pushed 10 feet away.

action->Storm Veil.name: Storm Veil
action->Storm Veil.description: The imugi twists any nearby precipitation into a swirling veil of sleet and wind. They gain concealment when in any form of mist or rain.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 8).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 8)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 8).description: The automatic greeter has Hardness. Once the automatic greeter is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 18.

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
action->Consume Flesh.description: Averill devours his raw fish and regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Grave Tidings.name: Grave Tidings
action->Grave Tidings.description:
Requirement A grabbed, paralyzed, restrained, or unconscious creature is within Averill's reach

Effect Averill whispers into the creature's ears, compelling them to join him. The creature is unable to attack Averill Quint for the duration, unless Averill uses a hostile action against them, and any undead Pathfinder can treat the creature as an ally for purposes of flanking. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The curse lasts 1 round.

Critical Failure The curse lasts 2 rounds.

action->Swift Stroke.name: Swift Stroke
action->Swift Stroke.description: Averill swims up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Averill's Orders.name: Averill's Orders
action->Averill's Orders.description:
