action->Elemental Draw.name: Elemental Draw
action->Elemental Draw.description: The baby scamp swarm can sense creatures with a connection to the elements. It is drawn to creatures that have cast an elemental spell or used an elemental ability within the last round.

action->Elemental Conduit.name: Elemental Conduit
action->Elemental Conduit.description: A creature within the swarm's space that casts an elemental spell or uses an elemental ability does not need to make a flat check. Additionally, the baby scamps empower their spell causing the save DC to be 1 higher.

action->We're Helping!.name: We're Helping!
action->We're Helping!.description:
The Young scamps all try to help the creatures in their space at the same time. Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:15] save.

Critical Success The creature is affected as if @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance} had been cast on them.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} until the end of their next turn.

action->Wing Buffet.name: Wing Buffet
action->Wing Buffet.description: Each creature within the baby scamp swarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:15|basic:true] save).

Barbed Stegosaurus.name: Barbed Stegosaurus
Barbed Stegosaurus.publicNotes:
The stegosaurus is easily recognized by its twin rows of diamond-shaped dorsal plates that run down its spine and thick tail adorned with four large spikes. This configuration protects the herbivore, the plates deflecting attacks while it gores predators with its tail.

The stegosaurus is generally even-tempered and gentle, despite its size. This combination makes it even more popular as a trained pet or guard, but even then one should take care to not annoy the dinosaur—an angry stegosaurus can lash out with little warning.

Remnants from the world's primeval era, these enormous reptilian animals still exist in large numbers in remote wildernesses or underground in magical Darklands caverns. Lizardfolk, orcs, giants, and other humanoids who live near dinosaurs use the animals as mounts, guards, or hunting beasts. Occasionally, rich nobles will collect dinosaurs to display them in menageries, which almost inevitably leads to cast-offs being nursed back to health by druids and other champions of nature. When dinosaurs establish themselves in regions outside their normal habitats, it's often the result of a large collection being released.

action->Dorsal Deflection.name: Dorsal Deflection
action->Dorsal Deflection.description:
Trigger The stegosaurus is targeted with a melee attack.

Effect The stegosaurus leans its dorsal plates into the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the stegosaurus Steps after the attack.

Big Carnival Bear.name: Big Carnival Bear
Big Carnival Bear.publicNotes:
This large and powerful omnivore inhabits forested hills. While it typically sustains itself on nuts, berries, fish, and small mammals, it's fiercely territorial and will chase off or kill any creature it views as competition. Grizzly bears are especially temperamental when their young are nearby. In combat, a grizzly bear often attempts to grab and maul its foe with surprising ferocity. It continues its assault until its foe seems like it is no longer a threat, though if the bear is hungry, it will not hesitate to feed.

Bears are ferocious predators typically found in cold or temperate woodlands and hills. Many species of bear exist in addition to the two presented below, such as the smaller black bear or the arctic-dwelling polar bear.

action->Somewhat Less Trained.name: Somewhat Less Trained
action->Somewhat Less Trained.description:
The big carnival bear isn't well trained yet, though it might occasionally respond to commands. Whatever its current attitude, use the following degrees of success instead of the usual check results for attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command an Animal} against the big carnival bear.

Critical Success The bear does as commanded on its next turn.

Success The bear acts normally (as determined by the GM) on its next turn.

Failure The bear attacks the creature attempting to command it on its next turn.

Critical Failure The bear attacks the creature attempting to command it on its next turn, and becomes immune to Command an Animal for 1 minute.

action->Not So Gentle Mauler.name: Not So Gentle Mauler
action->Not So Gentle Mauler.description: The big carnival bear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. After damaging a creature it has grabbed, it automatically releases it from its grip, but also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} unless the target succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save.

action->Rush.name: Rush
action->Rush.description: The big carnival bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, the bear gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

Big Katsu.name: Big Katsu
Big Katsu.publicNotes:
Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling. Stories of ogre gluttons being tricked into eating razor-edged shields or barrels filled with poisoned meat are common, but such tales are of little consolation to those who have been gobbled whole by these ravenous giants. In addition to their sadistic table manners, ogre gluttons have a disturbing knack for coming up with violent "games" that are little more than drawn-out torments, yet those who somehow manage to beat a glutton at the rules of their own game can often enrage the ogre enough that the resulting tantrum provides an opportunity for the captives to escape.

For many societies, ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and greedy cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are usually as strong as they are vicious. The worst ogres are sadists, enjoying remorseless murder, torture, and violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on other humanoids—the smaller the better—ogre captivity can end in a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp: becoming dinner. But for all their creativity in inflicting pain, ogres often forget that their playthings lack their own robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, and many of their captives die sooner than the ogres might prefer. Meanwhile, those who manage to survive captivity in an ogre's larder often emerge with lasting mental scars. A captive able to keep their wits about them, however, can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, more plentiful food sources, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's often-limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape or gain revenge.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"—usually the family's patriarch or matriarch—whom the other ogres in the family learn to quickly obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. Their lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity, along with assorted treasures stolen from past captives.

action->Glutton's Feast.name: Glutton's Feast
action->Glutton's Feast.description:
If the ogre glutton damages a living creature with their jaws Strike, they gain 1d4 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ww0Wu8majCej2tVF]{Effect: Glutton's Feast}

action->Glutton's Rush.name: Glutton's Rush
action->Glutton's Rush.description: The ogre glutton Strides twice and makes a jaws Strike. If they damage a living creature with this Strike, the temporary Hit Points they receive from Glutton's Feast is increased to 2d4.

action->Oni Form.name: Oni Form
action->Oni Form.description: Big Katsu takes on the size and form of an Oni (already reflected in the stat block).

action->Telepathy (100 feet).name: Telepathy (100 feet)
action->Telepathy (100 feet).description: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

action->Hope Vulnerability.name: Hope Vulnerability
action->Hope Vulnerability.description: The elegecide is fueled by the certainty of doom, which leaves it weakened by any hope. The first time each round that a creature critically fails at an attack or skill check against the elegecide, it experiences a burst of hope that leaves it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

action->Doom Aura.name: Doom Aura
action->Doom Aura.description:
30 feet

The elegecide constantly emits telepathic warnings about future dangers and harm. When a non-demon creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Dorsal Lash.name: Dorsal Lash
action->Dorsal Lash.description:
The elegecide lashes out with its trailing dorsal fins, looping them around a target within 15 feet. It sends a burst of telepathic information about all the possible ways the target can be injured in the next minute. The target takes @Damage[(5d4)[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the elegecide.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the elegecide.

Blood-Awakened Tree.name: Blood-Awakened Tree
Blood-Awakened Tree.publicNotes:
Arboreal regents and other wielders of powerful primal magic grant temporary sentience to trees in order to protect the forest. Invested with a workable set of instincts and the ability to mobilize and attack, these awakened trees follow the commands of their master and fight to protect their home. The statistics below work just as well for foliage that has become animate via other methods, such as a mystical influence from another dimension, a capricious fey spirit, or the like.

Arboreals are guardians of the forest and representatives of the trees. As long-lived as the woods they watch over, arboreals consider themselves parents and shepherds of trees rather than their gardeners. Consequently, while arboreals tend to be slow and methodical, they are terrifyingly swift when forced to fight in defense of the woods. Though they rarely seek out the companionship of short-lived folk—even elves are fugacious in the eyes of arboreals—and have an inherent distrust of change, arboreals have been known to tolerate those who seek to learn from their long-winded, rambling monologues, especially if such pupils also express a desire to protect the timberlands. Against those who threaten their realm, such as loggers eager to harvest lumber or settlers aiming to establish croplands or a town, arboreals' wrath is unwavering and devastating. Perhaps ironically, arboreals are gifted at tearing down what others build—a trait that serves vengeful members of their kind well.

action->Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
action->Drink Blood.description:
Requirements The blood-awakened tree's last action was a successful root Strike against a target currently taking persistent bleed damage.

Effect The tree drives its roots into the target's open wounds and drinks their blood. The roots Strike deals piercing damage with an additional 2d6 piercing, and the tree recovers hit points equal to half the additional damage dealt.

Blood-Soaked Flytrap.name: Blood-Soaked Flytrap
Blood-Soaked Flytrap.publicNotes:
Snapping flytraps typically have two sets of tooth-edged leaves, each measuring 3 feet wide, at the end of 10-foot-long stalks.

Flytraps eagerly feed on humanoids, monstrous insects, and larger prey.

action->Quick Capture.name: Quick Capture
action->Quick Capture.description:
Trigger A creature hits or touches the flytrap.

Effect The flytrap makes a leaf Strike against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in that leaf.

action->Bloody Focused Assault.name: Bloody Focused Assault
action->Bloody Focused Assault.description: The flytrap attacks a single target with both its two leaves, the fury of the red godsrain driving it to rip its prey to shreds. The flytrap makes one leaf Strike. On a success, it deals the damage from two leaf strikes plus 1d8 persistent bleed damage. On a failure, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf Strike and no persistent damage. It deals no damage on a critical failure. No matter the result, it cannot use Improved Grab on any of these Strikes. This counts as 2 attacks for purposes of the flytrap's multiple attack penalty.

action->Hungry Flurry.name: Hungry Flurry
action->Hungry Flurry.description: The flytrap makes two leaf Strikes at a -2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the flytrap's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all its attacks.

action->Bloodscent.name: Bloodscent
action->Bloodscent.description: When Searching or Seeking for creatures who have taken piercing or slashing damage in the last 24 hours, the wild dog's sense of smell is precise.

action->Gnash.name: Gnash
action->Gnash.description:
Requirements The wild dog's last action was a successful jaws Strike

Effect The wild dog gnashes its teeth to deal a particularly vicious wound; the Strike's target takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: The wild dog's Strikes deal 1d8 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wild dog's allies.

Bloodmoon.name: Bloodmoon
Bloodmoon.descriptionHazard: Bloodmoon is a naginata that can act on its own provided it is attuned to at least one creature.
Bloodmoon.disable: Two successful @Check[religion|dc:15|options:disable-bloodmoon] or @Check[occultism|dc:15|options:disable-bloodmoon] checks, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 13)
Bloodmoon.routine: (3 actions) Bloodmoon uses its first action to fly up to 20 feet towards an opponent. It then makes two naginata strikes, each against a different foe.

action->Float.name: Float
action->Float.description:
Trigger Combat begins with the creature it is attuned to

Effect The blade begins to float in the air, then rolls initiative.

action->Prone to Monologuing.name: Prone to Monologuing
action->Prone to Monologuing.description: If a PC uses an action to taunt Bloodmoon with a successful @Check[deception|dc:13], @Check[diplomacy|dc:13], or @Check[intimidation|dc:13] check, Bloodmoon must spend an action monologuing on the next turn.

action->Bloodscent.name: Bloodscent
action->Bloodscent.description: When Searching or Seeking for creatures who have taken piercing or slashing damage in the last 24 hours, the wild dog's sense of smell is precise.

action->Gnash.name: Gnash
action->Gnash.description:
Requirements The wild dog's last action was a successful jaws Strike

Effect The wild dog gnashes its teeth to deal a particularly vicious wound; the Strike's target takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: The wild dog's Strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wild dog's allies.

Bloodthirsty Apparitions.name: Bloodthirsty Apparitions
Bloodthirsty Apparitions.descriptionHazard: Deceased Puddles residents lash out at living creatures.
Bloodthirsty Apparitions.disable: @Check[religion|dc:15] (trained) three times to banish the apparitions with prayers, or @Check[occultism|dc:18] (trained) once to commune with the spirits and convince them to pass on
Bloodthirsty Apparitions.reset: The haunt re-forms after 1 hour. The haunt becomes disabled and doesn't reform 1 minute after the Puddles phantom is slain.
Bloodthirsty Apparitions.routine: (1 action) The haunt's screams send biting supernatural rain around the area, dealing @Damage[(2d6+2)[piercing]] damage to all living creatures within 90 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). Creatures who fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} by a red haze for 1 round.

action->Bloodthirsty Wails.name: Bloodthirsty Wails
action->Bloodthirsty Wails.description:
Trigger A living creature comes within 30 feet of the haunt

Effect The haunt wails, cursing the living for allowing the Puddles residents to wallow in misery while Absalom's elites prosper. Each living creature within 90 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to this bloodthirsty apparition's routine for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature shares the apparition's uncontrolled rage against the living. It makes a Strike against itself and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Bloodthirsty Apparitions (5-6).name: Bloodthirsty Apparitions (5-6)
Bloodthirsty Apparitions (5-6).descriptionHazard: Deceased Puddles residents lash out at living creatures.
Bloodthirsty Apparitions (5-6).disable: @Check[religion|dc:18] (trained) three times to banish the apparitions with prayers, or @Check[occultism|dc:22] (trained) once to commune with the spirits and convince them to pass on
Bloodthirsty Apparitions (5-6).reset: The haunt re-forms after 1 hour. The haunt becomes disabled and doesn't reform 1 minute after the Puddles phantom is slain.
Bloodthirsty Apparitions (5-6).routine: (1 action) The haunt's screams send biting supernatural rain around the area, dealing @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage to all living creatures within 90 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). Creatures who fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} by a red haze for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure).

action->Bloodthirsty Wails.name: Bloodthirsty Wails
action->Bloodthirsty Wails.description:
Trigger A living creature comes within 30 feet of the haunt

Effect The haunt wails, cursing the living for allowing the Puddles residents to wallow in misery while Absalom's elites prosper. Each living creature within 90 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to this bloodthirsty apparition's routine for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature shares the apparition's uncontrolled rage against the living. It makes a Strike against itself and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

action->Cybernetics.name: Cybernetics
action->Cybernetics.description: The cybernetics of a brain guzzler can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=22]] check. A brain guzzler's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A brain guzzler with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Guzzle.name: Guzzle
action->Guzzle.description:
Trigger The brain guzzler kills an enemy

Effect The brain guzzler breaks open its victim's skull and eats the brain. The brain guzzler gains knowledge of the victim's memories. The victim can no longer be raised from the dead by any method that requires an intact corpse and rises as a zombie shambler the next day at dawn.

action->Cybernetics.name: Cybernetics
action->Cybernetics.description: The cybernetics of a brain guzzler can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=22]] check. A brain guzzler's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A brain guzzler with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Guzzle.name: Guzzle
action->Guzzle.description:
Trigger The brain guzzler kills an enemy

Effect The brain guzzler breaks open its victim's skull and eats the brain. The brain guzzler gains knowledge of the victim's memories. The victim can no longer be raised from the dead by any method that requires an intact corpse and rises as a zombie shambler the next day at dawn.

action->Ulna Bow.name: Ulna Bow
action->Ulna Bow.description: The brain guzzler fires with the ulna bow, which rips the ulna out of its own forearm and fires it at one target within 120 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or take @Damage[(2d8+5)[piercing]] damage. The ulna explodes on impact, dealing @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage to adjacent creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). Once the ulna bow has been used once it can't be used again.

Burning Building.name: Burning Building
Burning Building.disable: @Check[survival|dc:19] to beat the flames with a stage curtain or similar cloth, @Check[acrobatics|dc:14] to splash liquids onto the fire, or 5 points of cold damage.

action->Conflagration.name: Conflagration
action->Conflagration.description:
Trigger A creature starts its turn in a burning building

Effect The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save or take @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage

action->Spread.name: Spread
action->Spread.description:
Trigger The round ends and no creature has attempted to Disable it this round

Effect A building within 15 feet becomes a burning building. The burning building can't use Spread next round.

action->Burning Strike.name: Burning Strike
action->Burning Strike.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his blades.

Effect Najid's blades ignite for just a moment. He can make two Strikes with his burning blades, each against the same target and Najid's current multiple attack penalty. If both attacks hit, combine their damage for the purposes of weakness and resistance. Both strikes deal fire damage regardless of the usual damage type. This counts as two attacks when calculating Najid's multiple attack penalty. Najid's focus leaves his blades.

action->Fennic Scream.name: Fennic Scream
action->Fennic Scream.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his voice.

Effect Najid screams at one creature within 20 feet, freezing their muscles with his rage. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is Stunned 2.

Failure the target is Stunned for one round.

Critical Failure the target is Stunned for one round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round thereafter.

Regardless of outcome, Najid's focus leaves his voice.

action->Roguish Smile.name: Roguish Smile
action->Roguish Smile.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his smile.

Effect Najid focuses on a creature within 30 feet while smiling confidently. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Success the target is unaffected.

Failure the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for one round. The condition ends if Najid uses a hostile action against the target, but not if Najid uses a hostile action against the target's allies.

Critical Failure the target is fascinated for one minute. The condition ends if Najid uses a hostile action against the target, but not if Najid uses a hostile action against the target's allies.

Regardless of outcome, Najid's focus leaves his smile.

action->Sliver of Divinity.name: Sliver of Divinity
action->Sliver of Divinity.description: Najid focuses his divine spark into his short swords, his voice, or his smile, allowing himself to use the associated exemplar ability.

Cackling Skull.name: Cackling Skull
Cackling Skull.publicNotes:
Some beheaded are raised with their mental faculties mostly intact. These clever undead often provoke their victims into foolishly giving chase or harming themselves.

Beheaded are disembodied floating heads transformed into undead. They are natural candidates for a necromancer's "project minion," due to the inexpensive cost of creation and endlessly customizable nature. In any lair occupied for long by practicing necromancers, it isn't uncommon to find a handful of floating heads roaming about, each exhibiting completely different characteristics and even degrees of expertise in their creation.

action->Bite Back.name: Bite Back
action->Bite Back.description:
Trigger The cackling skull is attacked by a creature within their reach

Effect The cackling skull makes a jaws Strike against that creature.

action->Incessant Goading.name: Incessant Goading
action->Incessant Goading.description:
The skull chooses one creature within 60 feet and antagonizes it mercilessly. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save to resist the effect.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. On its next turn, if the taunting skull is within the target's reach, the target wildly attacks the taunting skull as many times as possible.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target also immediately performs a Strike against itself; this Strike doesn't take any actions.

Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus.name: Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus
Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus.descriptionHazard: A metal lattice forged from warshards feeds into a dark purplish crystal that pulses with energy. If the configuration of the lattice changes, so does the energy the device emits.
Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus.disable: Three [[/act disable-device dc=27]] (see Disabling the Focus under Event 1 on page 18).
Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus.routine: (3 actions) The Nahyndrian Focus uses Select Condition to determine which condition it is going to inflict. It then uses Inflict twice, usually on two different targets. If the focus is broken, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and can only Inflict once per turn.

action->Offensive Configuration.name: Offensive Configuration
action->Offensive Configuration.description:
Trigger Yollen activates the Nahyndrian Focus

Effect The Nahyndrian Focus shifts into attack mode and rolls initiative. All creatures without the unholy trait in within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:35|basic] save against @Damage[(4d12+26)[spirit]] damage.

action->Select Condition.name: Select Condition
action->Select Condition.description: The Nahyndrian Focus rolls a [[/gmr 1d4 #Condition]] to randomly decide whether it is going cause the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} condition when it uses Inflict until the end of its turn. After the first round, it changes the random roll die to [[/gmr 1d6 #Condition]] as it does not pick the same condition it had in the previous round.

action->Inflict.name: Inflict
action->Inflict.description:
An unhealthy beam shoots out from the focus. One creature without the unholy trait within 60 feet of the Focus must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The target becomes immune to Inflict for 1 minute.

Success The targe gains the condition from Select Condition with a value of 1 for 1 minute. If the creature is sickened from the Focus' reaction, the sickened condition increase by 1, up to a maximum of 3.

Failure As success, but with a value of 2.

Critical Failure As success, but with a value of 3.

Captain Fraez.name: Captain Fraez
Captain Fraez.publicNotes:
The captain is the ultimate authority on a vessel, responsible for the livelihood and well-being of everyone on the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

action->Bravery.name: Bravery
action->Bravery.description: When Captain Fraez rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, anytime they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.

action->Dual Disarm.name: Dual Disarm
action->Dual Disarm.description:
The captain makes two Strikes, one with their rapier and one with their main-gauche (in either order). If both Strikes hit, the ship captain can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the target.

Their multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.

action->No Quarter!.name: No Quarter!
action->No Quarter!.description:
The captain orders their shipmates to fight without mercy. All allied creatures of equal or lower level within 20 feet of the ship captain gain a+1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the ship captain's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TjRZbd52qWPjTbNT]{Effect: No Quarter!}

Captain Pitros Nanaeil.name: Captain Pitros Nanaeil
Captain Pitros Nanaeil.allSavesBonus: +2 on all saves against divine magic

weapon->Bloodletting Kukri.name: Bloodletting Kukri
weapon->Bloodletting Kukri.description: This +1 striking kukri has a crimson blade that shimmers eerily in bright light. On a critical hit, the kukri deals 1d8 persistent bleed damage. If the target didn't already have persistent bleed damage when you scored the critical hit, you also gain [[/r 1d8]] temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

weapon->Scimitar.name: Scimitar
weapon->Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

strike-melee->Bloodletting Kukri.name: Bloodletting Kukri
strike-melee->Bloodletting Kukri.description: Plus 1d8 persistent bleed on crit. If the target of the critical hit didn't already have persistent bleed damage, Nanaeil also gains 1d8 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

action->+2 on All Saves Against Divine M.name: +2 on All Saves Against Divine Magic

action->Aura of Command.name: Aura of Command
action->Aura of Command.description: 30 feet. As captain of the Pure Legion, Nanaeil bolsters the lower-level legionnaires under his command, granting them a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and +2 status bonus to their will saves.

action->Dual-Weapon Warrior.name: Dual-Weapon Warrior
action->Dual-Weapon Warrior.description: Pitros Nanaeil is highly trained in the art of wielding two weapons at once, preferring to wield the +1 striking scimitar in his main hand and the bloodletting kukri in his off-hand.

action->May No Mortal Be Beholden.name: May No Mortal Be Beholden
action->May No Mortal Be Beholden.description: When Captain Nanaeil rolls a success on a save against an effect or spell from the divine tradition, they get a critical success instead.

action->Twin Riposte.name: Twin Riposte
action->Twin Riposte.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach critically fails to Strike you.

A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon. Make a melee Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against the triggering opponent.

action->Double Slice.name: Double Slice
action->Double Slice.description: Nanaeil lashes out at his foe with both weapons. He makes two Strikes, one with each melee weapon, each using his current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target. If both attacks hit, combine their damage, then add any other applicable effects from both weapons. Precision damage is added only once. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating his multiple attack penalty.

action->Smite Divine.name: Smite Divine
action->Smite Divine.description: The Pure Legion's scimitars have been enchanted specifically to take down divine spellcasters. Melee Strikes against clerics, champions, and other creatures capable of casting divine spells do an additional 2d6 mental damage.

Carnival Bear.name: Carnival Bear
Carnival Bear.publicNotes:
This large and powerful omnivore inhabits forested hills. While it typically sustains itself on nuts, berries, fish, and small mammals, it's fiercely territorial and will chase off or kill any creature it views as competition. Grizzly bears are especially temperamental when their young are nearby. In combat, a grizzly bear often attempts to grab and maul its foe with surprising ferocity. It continues its assault until its foe seems like it is no longer a threat, though if the bear is hungry, it will not hesitate to feed.

Bears are ferocious predators typically found in cold or temperate woodlands and hills. Many species of bear exist in addition to the two presented below, such as the smaller black bear or the arctic-dwelling polar bear.

action->Somewhat Trained.name: Somewhat Trained
action->Somewhat Trained.description:
The carnival bear might respond to commands even while hostile or unfriendly. If it's hostile or unfriendly, use the following degrees of success instead of the usual check results for attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command an Animal} against the bear.

Critical Success The bear does as commanded on its next turn.

Success The bear hesitates and does nothing on its next turn.

Failure The bear attacks the creature attempting to command it on its next turn.

Critical Failure The bear attacks the creature attempting to command it on its next turn, and becomes immune to Command an Animal for 1 minute.

action->Gentle Mauler.name: Gentle Mauler
action->Gentle Mauler.description: The carnival bear gains +1 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. After damaging a creature it has grabbed, it automatically releases the creature from its grip.

action->Selfish Shield.name: Selfish Shield
action->Selfish Shield.description:
Trigger An enemy in this creature's champion's aura damages them

Effect This creature gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, regardless of damage type. In addition, their Strikes against the triggering creature deal 1 extra spirit damage until the end of their next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.h6nyMp4dtPXBfCJc]{Effect: Selfish Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.2a6fuugiPpICe3Li]{Effect: Champion's Extra Damage}

action->Powerful Faith.name: Powerful Faith
action->Powerful Faith.description: When the champion of Deskari critically succeeds at a Strike against an enemy with their scythe, their enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and moved 5 feet in the direction of the champion's choice. This is forced movement.

consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).name: Healing Potion (Minor)
consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[1d8[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Do You Know Who I Am?!.name: Do You Know Who I Am?!
action->Do You Know Who I Am?!.description:
Frequency 1/day.

The Chelaxian adjutant shouts at all present. The adjutant makes an @Check[intimidation|defense:will] check and compares it to the Will DCs of all enemies within 30 feet. On a success, that foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. A critical success does not grant an additional effect.

equipment->+1 Striking Thrower's Bandoli.name: +1 Striking Thrower's Bandolier
equipment->+1 Striking Thrower's Bandoli.description:
This bandolier is covered in straps and pouches capable of holding up to 2 Bulk of one-handed thrown weapons. A thrower's bandolier has a +1 weapon potency rune etched into it, and it can be etched with runes as though it were a one-handed thrown weapon. When you invest the thrower's bandolier, you can attune it to all the weapons sheathed in it (this ends any previous attunements made with the bandolier). Whenever you draw a weapon from the bandolier, the bandolier's runes are replicated onto that weapon. Any runes already on the weapon are suppressed, and any runes previously replicated to a different weapon in this way are removed, returning it to normal.

Activate 2 envision, Interact

Effect All weapons attuned to the bandolier, not including any weapons you're currently wielding, return to the bandolier.

consumable->Elixir of Life (Lesser).name: Elixir of Life (Lesser)
consumable->Elixir of Life (Lesser).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain @Damage[(3d6+6)[healing]] Hit Points and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.lPRuIRbu0rHBkoKY]{Effect: Elixir of Life}

action->Unnoticeable Guile.name: Unnoticeable Guile
action->Unnoticeable Guile.description: The Chelaxian assassin is an expert at maintaining perfect stillness and blending into their surroundings. Each non-ally creature who has not been targeted by or subject to an attack or effect made by the Chelaxian assassin must, at the start of their turn, succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save (@Check[will|dc:28] in dungeon environments while the Chelaxian assassin is wearing their camouflage suit) or the Chelaxian assassin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them. This effect ends if the Chelaxian assassin moves without Sneaking or takes any hostile action against the non-ally creature. This does not prevent a creature from making Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, making the assassin Observed as normal on a success.

action->+2 to Perception to Detect Snare.name: +2 to Perception to Detect Snares and Hazards

action->Devilish Feint.name: Devilish Feint
action->Devilish Feint.description: When the Chelaxian assassin successfully Feints, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the Chelaxian assassin's weapon attacks until the end of the Chelaxian assassin's next turn. On a critical success, the target is off-guard against all weapon attacks for that time, not just the Chelaxian assassin's.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The Chelaxian assassin deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Strike of Terror.name: Strike of Terror
action->Strike of Terror.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian assassin is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from the target of this ability

Effect The Chelaxian assassin makes a Strike with a dagger. If they hit and deal damage, the damaged creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit).

stealth.label: in dungeons while wearing camouflage suit

equipment->Religious Symbol of Asmodeus.name: Religious Symbol of Asmodeus
equipment->Religious Symbol of Asmodeus.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol can be worn on the body on a chain or pin, or can be held.

action->Unholy Rebuke.name: Unholy Rebuke
action->Unholy Rebuke.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian cleric takes damage from a melee attack

Effect The Chelaxian cleric promises unholy retribution upon the attacker and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.

action->Divine Weapon.name: Divine Weapon
action->Divine Weapon.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger The Chelaxian cleric finishes Casting a Spell using one of their divine spell slots

Effect Until the end of their turn, the Chelaxian cleric's Strikes gain the unholy trait and deal an additional 1d4 spirit damage; this damage increases to 2d4 against creatures with the holy trait.

equipment->Infernal Magics of the Armies.name: Infernal Magics of the Armies of Dis
equipment->Infernal Magics of the Armies.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

action->Brimstone Defense.name: Brimstone Defense
action->Brimstone Defense.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian devilcaster takes fire damage

Effect The Chelaxian devilcaster gains resistance 8 to fire against the triggering attack. If this damage came from an unarmed attack, a non-reach melee weapon, or a spell with a range of touch, the creature who caused the damage takes @Damage[8[fire]] damage.

action->Brimstone Blessing.name: Brimstone Blessing
action->Brimstone Blessing.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian mage's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The Chelaxian mage siphons devilish energy drawn from pacts with a vordine devil into their trident. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage, gains the unholy trait, and gains the effects of a returning rune.

action->Devil Summoning.name: Devil Summoning
action->Devil Summoning.description: The Chelaxian devilcaster can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qvagIV8gqF0g3m3l]{Vordine} devil. To do so, they must sacrifice two 4th-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[fire]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented. If the Chelaxian devilcaster is unable to Sustain the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure. Regardless of whether the spell continues or not, the vordine devil attacks whatever creature is closest to it indiscriminately. If the Chelaxian devilcaster dies, the devil disappears.

action->Chastising Enforcement.name: Chastising Enforcement
action->Chastising Enforcement.description: The Chelaxian fighter exhorts a faltering comrade with a stern word. The Chelaxian fighter attempts an @Check[intimidation|defense:will] check against the Will DC of one ally within 30 feet. On a success, the target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition is reduced by 2, and the Chelaxian fighter can attempt to counteract one mental effect that ally is suffering from with a [[/r 1d20+15 #Counteract]]{+15} counteract modifier. On a critical success, the Chelaxian fighter also reduces the frightened condition of each other ally in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the target by 1.

action->Create Opening.name: Create Opening
action->Create Opening.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian fighter's last action was a Strike that hit an opponent

Effect The Chelaxian fighter twists their blade and pushes with their shield to create an opening in the required opponent's defenses. That opponent takes a –2 status penalty to their AC against the next Strike made against them before the start of the Chelaxian fighter's next turn. While this penalty lasts, the Chelaxian fighter gains an additional reaction they can only use to make a Reactive Strike against the penalized opponent.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.IPfr5O7bTwJhRB5v]{Effect: Create Opening}

equipment->Religious Symbol of Asmodeus.name: Religious Symbol of Asmodeus
equipment->Religious Symbol of Asmodeus.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol can be worn on the body on a chain or pin, or can be held.

action->Unholy Rebuke.name: Unholy Rebuke
action->Unholy Rebuke.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian hierophant takes damage from a melee attack

Effect The Chelaxian hierophant promises unholy retribution upon the attacker and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.

action->Divine Weapon.name: Divine Weapon
action->Divine Weapon.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger The Chelaxian hierophant finishes Casting a Spell using one of their divine spell slots

Effect Until the end of their turn, the Chelaxian hierophant's Strikes gain the unholy trait and deal an additional 1d4 spirit damage; this damage increases to 2d4 against creatures with the holy trait.

equipment->Infernal Magics of the Armies.name: Infernal Magics of the Armies of Dis
equipment->Infernal Magics of the Armies.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

action->Brimstone Defense.name: Brimstone Defense
action->Brimstone Defense.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian mage takes fire damage

Effect The Chelaxian mage gains resistance 6 to fire against the triggering attack. If this damage came from an unarmed attack, a non-reach melee weapon, or a spell with a range of touch, the creature who caused the damage takes @Damage[6[fire]] damage.

action->Brimstone Blessing.name: Brimstone Blessing
action->Brimstone Blessing.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian mage's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The Chelaxian mage siphons devilish energy drawn from pacts with a vordine devil into their trident. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage, gains the unholy trait, and gains the effects of a returning rune.

action->Devil Summoning.name: Devil Summoning
action->Devil Summoning.description: The Chelaxian mage can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qvagIV8gqF0g3m3l]{Vordine} devil. To do so, they must sacrifice three 3rd-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[fire]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented. If the Chelaxian mage is unable to Sustain the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure; regardless of whether the spell continues or not, the vordine devil attacks whatever creature is closest to it indiscriminately. If the Chelaxian mage dies, the devil disappears.

consumable->Elixir of Life (Lesser).name: Elixir of Life (Lesser)
consumable->Elixir of Life (Lesser).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain @Damage[(3d6+6)[healing]] Hit Points and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.lPRuIRbu0rHBkoKY]{Effect: Elixir of Life}

action->Unnoticeable Guile.name: Unnoticeable Guile
action->Unnoticeable Guile.description: The Chelaxian rogue is an expert at maintaining perfect stillness and blending into their surroundings. Each non-ally creature who has not been targeted by or subject to an attack or effect made by the Chelaxian rogue must, at the start of their turn, succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save (@Check[will|dc:27] in dungeon environments while the Chelaxian rogue is wearing their camouflage suit) or the Chelaxian rogue becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them. This effect ends if the Chelaxian rogue moves without Sneaking or takes any hostile action against the non-ally creature. This does not prevent a creature from making Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, making the rogue Observed as normal on a success.

action->+2 to Perception to Detect Snare.name: +2 to Perception to Detect Snares and Hazards

action->Devilish Feint.name: Devilish Feint
action->Devilish Feint.description: When the Chelaxian rogue successfully Feints, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the Chelaxian rogue's weapon attacks until the end of the Chelaxian rogue's next turn. On a critical success, the target is off-guard against all weapon attacks for that time, not just the Chelaxian rogue's.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The Chelaxian rogue deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Strike of Terror.name: Strike of Terror
action->Strike of Terror.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian rogue is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from the target of this ability

Effect The Chelaxian rogue makes a Strike with a dagger. If they hit and deal damage, the damaged creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit).

stealth.label: in dungeons while wearing camouflage suit

action->Chastising Enforcement.name: Chastising Enforcement
action->Chastising Enforcement.description: The Chelaxian fighter exhorts a faltering comrade with a stern word. The Chelaxian fighter attempts an @Check[intimidation|defense:will] check against the Will DC of one ally within 30 feet. On a success, the target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition is reduced by 2, and the Chelaxian fighter can attempt to counteract one mental effect that ally is suffering from with a [[/r 1d20+17 #Counteract]]{+17} counteract modifier. On a critical success, the Chelaxian fighter also reduces the frightened condition of each other ally in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the target by 1.

action->Create Opening.name: Create Opening
action->Create Opening.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian weaponmaster's last action was a Strike that hit an opponent

Effect The Chelaxian weaponmaster twists their blade and pushes with their shield to create an opening in the required opponent's defenses. That opponent takes a –2 status penalty to their AC against the next Strike made against them before the start of the Chelaxian weaponmaster's next turn. While this penalty lasts, the Chelaxian weaponmaster gains an additional reaction they can only use to make a Reactive Strike against the penalized opponent.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.IPfr5O7bTwJhRB5v]{Effect: Create Opening}

Cleansing Pool.name: Cleansing Pool
Cleansing Pool.descriptionHazard: The swirling water in this pool entices anyone who can see or hear it to wander into its depths, drowning its victims.
Cleansing Pool.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:24] to scratch out the runes creating the effect, @Check[occultism|dc:20] (expert) or @Check[Demon Lore|dc:20] (expert) to determine the password that identifies the party as believers, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd-rank; counteract DC 22); two total successes are required to deactivate the pool.
Cleansing Pool.routine:
(1 action; mental) The cleansing pool uses its first action to try and compel all creatures within 5 feet to enter into the pool. Creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:mental] save.

Critical Success The creature is immune to the pool's routine for 1 minute.

Success No effect.

Failure The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} condition and attempts to enter the pool.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature must also use all of their actions on their next turn to try and pull one of their allies into the pool with them.
Cleansing Pool.stealth: (expert) to notice the enticing effects of the pool

action->Echoing Spring.name: Echoing Spring
action->Echoing Spring.description:
Trigger a creature within 10 feet can see or hear the cleansing pool

Effect each creature within range must succeed a @Check[will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, using all of their available actions to move toward and into the pool. The hazard then rolls initiative.

action->Drown the Nonbelievers.name: Drown the Nonbelievers
action->Drown the Nonbelievers.description:
Trigger a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} creature enters the pool

Effect the waters rush up to encircle the creature, which must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or begin drowning.

Concentrated Congealed Magic.name: Concentrated Congealed Magic
Concentrated Congealed Magic.publicNotes:
Tomb jellies are animate masses of protoplasm with a sickly combination of yellow, gray, and black hues. Their acidic bodies dissolve flesh but leave other materials, including a victim's gear and bones, intact. Some ancient cultures entombed bodies in stone sarcophagi with tomb jellies to allow the ooze to break down the flesh and clean and polish the bones.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A tomb jelly can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Bound in Death.name: Bound in Death
action->Bound in Death.description: The concentrated congealed magic splatters some of its substance on a willing undead creature within its reach. The target regains @Damage[5[healing,void]|shortLabel] HP, and its melee Strikes get the benefits of shadow curse until the end of its next turn.

action->Flesh-dissolving Acid.name: Flesh-dissolving Acid
action->Flesh-dissolving Acid.description: A tomb jelly's acid damages only flesh.

action->Shadow Curse.name: Shadow Curse
action->Shadow Curse.description: A creature hit by concentrated congealed magic's pseudopod takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage. If the creature dies while it has this persistent damage, its corpse is affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Peaceful Rest}, except the concentrated congealed magic can still dissolve its flesh.

Congealed Magic.name: Congealed Magic
Congealed Magic.publicNotes:
Found underground or in dungeons, these quivering, slug-like ropes of slime continuously scour their domain for food. In addition to their shape, they are named for their ability to shoot out expanding ribbons of slime that resemble tangled strings.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: Congealed magic can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Split.name: Split
action->Split.description: Whenever a congealed magic would take slashing damage (if it weren't immune) and has at least 10 HP, it splits into two identical oozes with half the original's HP. One congealed magic is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, move smaller creatures and objects out of the way to make a space or the split is canceled at the GM's discretion.

action->Tag Team.name: Tag Team
action->Tag Team.description:
Requirements another congealed magic is within 30 feet

Effect The ooze arcs magical essence to the other congealed magic. Creatures in that line take @Damage[3d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save. A creature that fails its save is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Crushing Crowd (1-2).name: Crushing Crowd (1-2)
Crushing Crowd (1-2).descriptionHazard: The crowd rushes forward, risking a stampede as everyone tries to fnd a safe exit.
Crushing Crowd (1-2).disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:15] to calm the crowd, or @Check[intimidation|dc:18] or @Check[society|dc:18] to control the crowd's behavior
Crushing Crowd (1-2).routine:
(1 action) On its initiative, the crowd moves 5 feet toward the exit in area A1, then crushes any creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], dealing @Damage[(2d6+2)[bludgeoning]] damage. All targets must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save.

Failure The target takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, becomes prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

action->Crush.name: Crush
action->Crush.description:
Trigger Lady Embersplitter announces that the victim has died

Effect The crowd begins moving around the bailey and deals @Damage[(2d6+2)[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save), and then rolls initiative.

Crushing Crowd (3-4).name: Crushing Crowd (3-4)
Crushing Crowd (3-4).descriptionHazard: The crowd rushes forward, risking a stampede as everyone tries to fnd a safe exit.
Crushing Crowd (3-4).disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:18] to calm the crowd, or @Check[intimidation|dc:21] or @Check[society|dc:21] to control the crowd's behavior
Crushing Crowd (3-4).routine:
(1 action) On its initiative, the crowd moves 5 feet toward the exit in area A1, then crushes any creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], dealing @Damage[(4d6)[bludgeoning]] damage. All targets must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save.

Failure The target takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, becomes prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

action->Crush.name: Crush
action->Crush.description:
Trigger Lady Embersplitter announces that the victim has died

Effect The crowd begins moving around the bailey and deals @Damage[(4d6)[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save), and then rolls initiative.

action->Cybernetics.name: Cybernetics
action->Cybernetics.description: The cybernetics of a cybernetic zombie can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=15]] check. A zombie's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A cybernetic zombie with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions (including self-destruct).

action->Self Destruct.name: Self Destruct
action->Self Destruct.description:
A cybernetic zombie must use this reaction unless its cybernetics are disabled

Trigger The cybernetic zombie is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The zombie's damaged cybernetics explode, dealing @Damage[(2d8+2)[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10-foot radius} (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|options:area-effect] save). This ability destroys any technological items on the zombie.

action->Bravado Aversion.name: Bravado Aversion
action->Bravado Aversion.description: A gargarthezul can't stand to be shown up. The first time each round a creature successfully Demoralizes, Shoves, or Trips a gargarthezul, it takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.

action->Bully.name: Bully
action->Bully.description: The gargarthezul @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoves} a creature, and Strides after it into the nearest adjacent square if successful. It then makes a tentacle Strike against the creature, using the same multiple attack penalty.

action->Halyard Swing.name: Halyard Swing
action->Halyard Swing.description:
Requirements The gargarthezul is on the deck of a ship.

Effect The gargarthezul swings from a nearby rope, moving up to twice its Speed and ignoring any terrain or lack of surface beneath it. It can make a tentacle Strike at any point during this movement.

action->Mark of Avarice.name: Mark of Avarice
action->Mark of Avarice.description:
Requirements The gargarthezul's last action was a successful tentacle Strike.

Effect The gargarthezul places a brand on the creature it hit that fills the creature's mind with overwhelming urges towards piracy. The creature doesn't treat anyone as their ally and can't Delay or Ready. They must use all of their actions to attempt to Disarm, or Demoralize, targeting a creature randomly determined by the GM (they may use actions to facilitate their attempts, such as to move to the target or to drop an item so they have a free hand). The duration is based on a @Check[will|dc:19] save. If the creature successfully Disarms or Demoralizes their target, they can attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11] check to recover from Mark of Avarice. The gargarthezul may only have one mark of avarice in effect at any given time. An additional mark placed causes the previous one to fade.

Critical Success The creature becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The mark lasts for 1 round.

Critical Failure The mark lasts for 1 minute.

action->Vicious Bluster.name: Vicious Bluster
action->Vicious Bluster.description:
When a gargarthezul successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizes} a foe, it gains 1d6 temporary Hit Points (2d6 on a critical success) that last for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.P8LdA05tK20u98MF]{Effect: Vicious Bluster}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Ty2YFxv2EDBOSjxl]{Effect: Vicious Bluster (Critical Success)}

action->Bravado Aversion.description: A gargarthezul can't stand to be shown up. The first time each round a creature successfully Demoralizes, Shoves, or Trips a gargarthezul, it takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.

Damned Vescavor Swarm.name: Damned Vescavor Swarm
Damned Vescavor Swarm.publicNotes:
The most common and numerous vescavors are the raving swarms. If left alone and unchecked, many believe they would eventually consume themselves once everything else in the immediate vicinity was consumed. What is even more vexing than their hunger is their song. While it sounds like gibberish at first, once bitten, the song will drive people into chaos.

These gluttonous green vermin travel from the Outer Rifts in an endless search for food. Along the way, these acrid wasps devour everything in sight. Not even the ground itself is spared from their appetite. While any single vescavor is no problem, they travel in swarms to overwhelm anything trying to stop them. In a truly unfortunate situation, several swarms will be gathered and led by a vescavor queen. These queens, while fearsome on their own, can drive their brood into a feeding rage unlike any other. Swarms found without a queen are directionless, destroying anything around them indiscriminately.

Whenever a vescavor swarm is not eating, it gibbers mind-numbing songs from the fiends' dark world. Adapted to the shrieking jungles of their home plane, they issue a call that confuses and corrupts mortals.

Philosophers who ponder the Outer Rifts often conjecture as to what kind of soul forms a vescavor. The idea of insect souls being sent to the Outer Rifts is often laughed off but never entirely dismissed. Some assume that they are demons of gluttony, plain and simple. Some of the more creative explanations of vescavor origins posit that all the bits of soul eaten up by attacking demons are what coalesce into these endless swarms. Such an explanation would account for how these endlessly feeding demons also seem to be endless in number.

action->Devour All.name: Devour All
action->Devour All.description: The swarm eat away the very earth beneath their feet. The swarms Strides. All squares they occupy during their movement becomes difficult terrain. Any creatures they move through must succeed a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Maddening Gibbers.name: Maddening Gibbers
action->Maddening Gibbers.description:
Each stupefied creature in the swarm's space must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] saving throw as the swarm yammers the endless chorus of the Outer Rifts.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Maddening Gibbers for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected and is immune to Maddening Gibbers for 1 round.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target becomes confused for 1 round and can't target demons while confused in this way.

action->Ravenous Bites.name: Ravenous Bites
action->Ravenous Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[(3d6+2)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

action->Selfish Shield.name: Selfish Shield
action->Selfish Shield.description:
Trigger An enemy in this creature's champion's aura damages them

Effect This creature gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, regardless of damage type. In addition, their Strikes against the triggering creature deal 1 extra spirit damage until the end of their next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.h6nyMp4dtPXBfCJc]{Effect: Selfish Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.2a6fuugiPpICe3Li]{Effect: Champion's Extra Damage}

action->Powerful Faith.name: Powerful Faith
action->Powerful Faith.description: When the champion of Deskari critically succeeds at a Strike against an enemy with their scythe, their enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and moved 5 feet in the direction of the champion's choice. This is forced movement.

Decked-Out Appraiser.name: Decked-Out Appraiser
Decked-Out Appraiser.publicNotes:
Neither human nor beast yet resembling both, yeongno (yeong-no) are creatures that once were denizens of heaven but were cast out, down to the mortal Universe, due to their own greed. Yeongno claim to have once been celestial dragons and wear elongated dragon masks with full-body wraps decorated with scale patterns in honor of this claim—though no one has been able to confirm the veracity of this belief. As they wander, they hold a willow pipe in their mouths, producing a distinct "bibi" sound that often heralds their appearance.

Despite their reputation as monsters who eat people, yeongno are welcomed by the poor and oppressed, who see the creatures as wise and just. Yeongno believe that by eating 100 wealthy individuals who abuse their wealth or who accumulated their wealth by underhanded or exploitative means, they can atone for their own greed, allowing them to ascend back into heaven. A corrupt and greedy individual can escape their fate of being eaten by a yeongno by giving away all of their wealth and agreeing to be transformed into a pig for one year. If the person can endure one year living as a pig in the care of a household they once harmed, the yeongno will spare them.
Decked-Out Appraiser.privateNotes:
Glutton's Redemption

Yeongno eat the corrupt and wealthy as a symbolic means of consuming their own greed. While yeongno aspire to ascend from their current existence, they also actively sabotage other creatures hoping to do the same. They feel particularly threatened by imugi, whom the yeongno believe would take their spots in heaven.

action->Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet.name: Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet
action->Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet.description: The yeongno can detect the presence, location, and approximate value of gold within 120 feet.

action->Fortune's Favor.name: Fortune's Favor
action->Fortune's Favor.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect A target creature within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis}, being polymorphed into a pig whose girth is determined by the target's wealth. After 24 hours, the target can end this effect using a Dismiss action, at which point the yeongno becomes aware that the effect has ended. A yeongno can use Fortune's Favor only if no targets are currently under its effects.

action->Money is Pain.name: Money is Pain
action->Money is Pain.description:
Requirements The target is carrying at least 100 gp worth of precious metals

Effect The yeongno crushes a creature it can see with the weight of their wealth. Apparitions of gold coins approximating the wealth of the target materialize and pummel the target from all sides. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[3d8[persistent,mental]] damage and is slowed 1 as long as the damage continues. The effect immediately ends if they're carrying less than 100 gp worth of precious metals.

Critical Failure As failure, except any flat checks to remove the persistent damage automatically fail.

action->Cowardly Flight.name: Cowardly Flight
action->Cowardly Flight.description:
Trigger An enemy enters into melee range of Minister Jo

Frequency once per hour

Effect Minister Jo is not a fighter and would prefer to be safely behind his bodyguards. He flees, Striding up to his Speed, and he must end his movement closer to the Appraiser than when he started. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}, he can Reload his sukgung and then fire it backward over his shoulder in a panic, attempting a sukgung Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Expensive Reload.name: Expensive Reload
action->Expensive Reload.description:
Requirements Minister Jo has expensive bolts

Effect Minister Jo supplements his mediocre fighting ability with a variety of cheaply sourced magical items. He Reloads his sukgung with an expensive bolt and activates its magic, imbuing his next sukgung Strike with one of the following effects.

  • Shuffling Bolt (teleportation) If the bolt hits a target, the target and Minister Jo swap places. If the triggering hit was a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round after the teleportation.
  • Snare Bolt If the bolt hits a target, silk webbing wraps around them, imposing a –10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds for [[/gmr 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, or until they [[/act escape dc=23]] against a DC of 23. On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes.
  • Spark Bolt (electricity) The bolt deals an additional @Damage[(2d12[splash])[electricity]] damage.

action->Constrict Mind.name: Constrict Mind
action->Constrict Mind.description: The manifestation of nightmare deals @Damage[(2d6+9)[mental]] damage to any number of creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by it (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure.

action->Morphic Limb.name: Morphic Limb
action->Morphic Limb.description: A manifestation of nightmare can form up to 8 morphic limbs at the same time. These limbs are constantly shifting their features according to the manifestation's whims, becoming fists, claws, pincers, blades, and anything else that it can imagine.

action->Recurring Nightmare.name: Recurring Nightmare
action->Recurring Nightmare.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature that is being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by a manifestation of nightmare can't reduce the value of its frightened condition below 1 until it Escapes.

action->Unnerving Echo.name: Unnerving Echo
action->Unnerving Echo.description: If the manifestation of nightmare critically hits with a nightmare vision Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Demon Ark.name: Demon Ark
Demon Ark.descriptionHazard: A demonic presence animates the ship carrying demon pirates.
Demon Ark.disable: @Check[religion|dc:23] (trained) to ward against demonic presence, @Check[arcana|dc:23] (trained) or @Check[occultism|dc:23] (trained) to weaken the demonic possession, @Check[intimidation|dc:23] (trained) to scare it away, or @Check[sailing-lore|dc:21] (trained) to confuse it; two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Demon Ark.routine:
2 The demon ark uses its actions on one of the following options (GM's choice). It loses one action from its routine if a PC succeeds at an attempt to Disable it or it reaches its Broken Threshold.

  • Broadside Blast a The demon ark makes a Chthonian cannon Strike.
  • Demonic List d Effect The ship tosses and turns. Each creature in the hazard's area must make a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save. On a failure, it is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; on a critical failure it also takes @Damage[4d8[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Heads Will Roll a It makes a bowsprit Strike.
  • Sea Chantey a (auditory) All fiends within 60 feet gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects; all non-fiends within 60 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:auditory] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.GAuA1XLLO4vkF3OJ]{Effect: Sea Chantey}

action->No Prey, No Pay.name: No Prey, No Pay
action->No Prey, No Pay.description:
Trigger The demon ark hits another ship and Encounter A begins

Effect The demon ark fires grapples at the Snapdragon. Each PC must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} ([[/act escape dc=22]]); on a critical failure, they're also impaled and take @Damage[(2d8+7)[piercing]] damage. The demon ark then rolls initiative.

action->Sea Chantey.name: Sea Chantey
action->Sea Chantey.description:
All fiends within 60 feet gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects; all non-fiends within 60 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).
