Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin.name: Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin
Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin.publicNotes:
The bottlenose dolphin is the most common and widespread species of dolphin. They are social predators who hunt shallow seas and rivers in large family groups called pods. Sailors are fond of bottlenose dolphins and frequently tell of how they've saved drowning mariners or protected crew from sharks with blows from their powerful snouts.

Dolphins encompass a wide range of aquatic mammals, all of which are social, intelligent, and widespread throughout the world's oceans.

action->Aquatic Echolocation 120 feet.name: Aquatic Echolocation 120 feet
action->Aquatic Echolocation 120 feet.description: A bottlenose dolphin can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: A bottlenose dolphin can hold its breath for 2 hours.

action->Ramming Speed.name: Ramming Speed
action->Ramming Speed.description:
The bottlenose dolphin @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swims} twice and then makes a snout Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

A Large or smaller creature hit by this attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Demonic Ocean Drake.name: Demonic Ocean Drake
Demonic Ocean Drake.publicNotes:
Although the glistening scales and sleek, fin-like wings on these drakes give them an appearance reminiscent of river fish, they are actually distant relatives of the dragons that rule the oceans. While smaller than most drakes, river drakes are more than capable of plaguing river travelers and are equally at home above and below the water's surface. This flexibility allows them to catch a wide variety of prey, from fish and boggards to deer and the occasional ferry passenger.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

action->Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
action->Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the ocean drake's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

Effect The ocean drake attempts to Strike the triggering creature with its tail. If it hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

action->Chthonic Mucus.name: Chthonic Mucus
action->Chthonic Mucus.description:
The ocean drake spits a ball of chthonic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[4d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). Those that fail this save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,spirit]] and take a -5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent spirit damage.

The ocean drake can't use Chthonic Mucus again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Chthonic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.campaign-effects.Item.uZ2mAwpVz1bkw5GK]{Effect: Chthonic Mucus}

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The river drake makes one Fangs Strike and two Tail Strikes in any order.

action->Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
action->Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day;

Effect The river drake Strides or Flies twice.

action->Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day;

Effect The river drake Strides or Flies twice.

action->Abyssal Poison.name: Abyssal Poison
action->Abyssal Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)

action->Droning Flyby.name: Droning Flyby
action->Droning Flyby.description: The drone of the derakni's wings mesmerizes listeners. The derakni Flies. All creatures within 20 feet of the derakni at any point during this movement must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] saving throw. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (3 rounds on a critical failure); on a success, the target is immune for 1 minute.

action->Acidic Swarm.name: Acidic Swarm
action->Acidic Swarm.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing],2d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save). Any creature that failures its saving throw also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,acid]] damage.

Disillusioned Oloranvis Elvanna.name: Disillusioned Oloranvis Elvanna
Disillusioned Oloranvis Elvanna.privateNotes: In the adventure text, the cantrips aren't heightened but they have been in Foundry

action->Familiar.name: Familiar
action->Familiar.description: Oloranvis's familiar is a poppet elkhound named Ruditgar. His Speed is 40 feet. He has poppet immunities and weakness 4 to fire. When Oloranvis Casts or Sustains a hex, she can cause ice to form in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] centered on Ruditgar's square. Those squares are difficult terrain until the start of her next turn. Ruditgar and Oloranvis communicate telepathically through touch.

action->Eldritch Nails.name: Eldritch Nails
action->Eldritch Nails.description: Oloranvis's razor-sharp nails sparkle with the residue of her winter magic. Her unarmed nail strikes cause both cold and slashing damage.

action->Winter's Gift.name: Winter's Gift
action->Winter's Gift.description: Oloranvis has an unusually strong connection to winter magic even for a winter witch. When she casts a spell with the cold trait, she gains a +1 status bonus to the spell DC or spell attack.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Snagging Catch.name: Snagging Catch
action->Snagging Catch.description:
Requirements The disciple has their crimson cloak raised

Trigger The disciple is attacked by a melee weapon

Effect After the attack's result is resolved, the disciple attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the triggering weapon, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus. The cloak is destroyed after this action.

action->Cloak and Dagger.name: Cloak and Dagger
action->Cloak and Dagger.description: The disciple raises their heavy crimson cloak, providing them with a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC and also giving them access to the Snagging Catch reaction.

action->Pattern Attack.name: Pattern Attack
action->Pattern Attack.description: The disciple's strikes deal 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least one of the disciple's allies.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Cloak and Dagger.description: The disciple raises their heavy crimson cloak, providing them with a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC and also giving them access to the Snagging Catch reaction.

action->Pattern Attack.name: Pattern Attack
action->Pattern Attack.description: The disciple's strikes deal 2d6 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least one of the disciple's allies.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Snagging Catch.description:
Requirements The disciple has their crimson cloak raised

Trigger The disciple is attacked by a melee weapon

Effect After the attack's result is resolved, the disciple attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the triggering weapon, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus. The cloak is destroyed after this action.

action->Cloak and Dagger.name: Cloak and Dagger
action->Cloak and Dagger.description: The disciple raises their heavy crimson cloak, providing them with a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC and also giving them access to the Snagging Catch reaction.

action->Pattern Attack.name: Pattern Attack
action->Pattern Attack.description: The disciple's strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least one of the disciple's allies.

action->Armored Apotheosis.name: Armored Apotheosis
action->Armored Apotheosis.description: When it is first encountered, the divine oozeshard is in a lumpy, vaguely spherical ooze form. When it takes damage from any weapon attack, it suddenly reshapes, taking a form almost identical to the dead deity Gorum. The ooze hardens into armored plates (increasing its AC by +8) and its pseudopod transforms into a massive, acid-dripping greatsword. While in this form, it loses its pseudopod attack and its immunity to bludgeoning and precision damage. It cannot use its constrict or engulf abilities, and any creature currently engulfed by it is spat out into an adjacent random square, taking @Damage[1d8[acid],1d8[slashing]]{1d8 acid damage and 1d8 slashing} damage. It gains the Reactive Strike reaction. If it is critically hit by a Strike or critically fails a save against an effect that deals Hit Point damage to it, the divine oozeshard reverts back into its ooze form.

action->Gorumite Echoes.name: Gorumite Echoes
action->Gorumite Echoes.description: While in its armored apotheosis form, the divine oozeshard deals an additional 1d8 bleed damage and makes the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round whenever it critically hits with its greatsword.

action->Spawn Oozeshardling Node.name: Spawn Oozeshardling Node
action->Spawn Oozeshardling Node.description: Whenever the divine oozeshard takes 55 or more damage from a single attack, it spawns a sparking oozeshardling node in an adjacent square. The sparking oozeshardling node's electric pulse reaction immediately activates and then the sparking oozeshardling node enters initiative at the bottom of the current initiative count.

Divine Oozeshardling Node.name: Divine Oozeshardling Node
Divine Oozeshardling Node.descriptionHazard: A lump of bluish ooze shot through with what look like tiny silver shavings of metal. Once it has been activated, it glows with arcs of electricity that leap out at nearby targets.
Divine Oozeshardling Node.disable: Two successful @Check[arcana|dc:25] or @Check[occultism|dc:25] (trained) checks on the oozeshardling to disperse its power, or @Check[acrobatics|dc:27] or @Check[thievery|dc:27] (expert) to remove the flecks of empowering warshard from within the oozeshardling. A failed Acrobatics or Thievery check to disable an oozeshardling results in the creature attempting the check taking @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage (@Damage[2d6[acid]] on a critical failure).
Divine Oozeshardling Node.reset: The oozeshardling node collapses and melds back into the oozeshard after 1 minute, or disappears entirely if the oozeshard is slain.
Divine Oozeshardling Node.routine: (3 actions) The oozeshardling uses its first action to make an electric spark Strike against one random non-ooze creature within range, its second action is used to move straight in a random cardinal direction (roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Direction]] to determine the direction), and its third action to make a second electric spark Strike against a different random non-ooze creature within range. The oozeshardling doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Divine Oozeshardling Node.stealth: (trained) (or –10 and no minimum proficiency if the oozeshardling node's electric pulse reaction has been triggered)

action->Electric Pulse.name: Electric Pulse
action->Electric Pulse.description:
Trigger A creature enters a space within 10 feet of the divine oozeshardling node

Effect The divine oozeshardling unleashes a shocking blast that deals @Damage[5d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around it (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save).

Doldrums Bud Pile.name: Doldrums Bud Pile
Doldrums Bud Pile.descriptionHazard: Doldrum heaps that have only started to grow have no intelligence, but are incredibly tenacious and can reflexively grab onto nearby prey. They obtain nutrients by drowning prey in the water they grow in.
Doldrums Bud Pile.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:35] (expert) to rip the reflexive tendrils off the bud or @Check[thievery|dc:35] (expert) to trigger the tendrils beforehand and keep them occupied.
Doldrums Bud Pile.reset: 1 hour if the bud pile has something in its grasps. 1 round if the bud pile has nothing in its grasps.

action->Tendril Entanglement.name: Tendril Entanglement
action->Tendril Entanglement.description:
Trigger a creature moves into a square adjacent to the bud pile or into the square the bud pile occupies

Effect The doldrum bud pile whips out numerous tendrils, attempting to grab the creature. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The target dodges the tendril and is unaffected.

Success A couple of tendrils latches on to the target. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. The target can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} by attempting an Athletics or Acrobatics skill check of DC 31. The first time they fail to Escape each round, however, the bud pile constricts, dealing @Damage[(2d12+20)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Failure Several tendrils grab the target. The target becomes grabbed and must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the target cannot breathe in water, they begin to suffocate. The DC to Escape increases to 36.

Critical Failure As failure, except the DC to Escape increases to 38.

Dread Leshy Ghoul.name: Dread Leshy Ghoul
Dread Leshy Ghoul.publicNotes: Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

action->Rotten Burst.name: Rotten Burst
action->Rotten Burst.description: When a leshy ghoul dies, a burst of twisted primal void energy explodes from its body, restoring @Damage[2d8[healing,void]]{2d8} Hit Points to each undead fungi or plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] and killing all natural plants, though merely causing discomfort to creatures with the plant trait. This area is filled with rotten vegetation, becoming difficult terrain.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The leshy ghoul transforms into a Small giant mushroom or patch of fungi. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
action->Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[3d6[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Forbidden Cravings.name: Forbidden Cravings
action->Forbidden Cravings.description:
A creature can still eat and drink while sickened by this curse

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]|immutable] damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} until it consumes raw meat (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2

Stage 4 as stage 2 unless the target has consumed raw meat in the past 24 hours, then it takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} until it consumes raw meat

Stage 5 if the creature has eaten raw meat in the past 24 hours, it dies and rises as a ghoul, if not, it returns to stage 4

action->Ghoul Whispers.name: Ghoul Whispers
action->Ghoul Whispers.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed},@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature is within the ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul whispers dark thoughts and vile cravings into the creature's ears. The creature must save against the forbidden cravings curse.

action->Grave Knowledge.name: Grave Knowledge
action->Grave Knowledge.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The ghoul calls upon knowledge it retains from one creature it has consumed in the past 7 days. The ghoul attempts a skill check using a skill in which the consumed creature was trained (if it's unclear whether the creature was trained, the GM decides). The ghoul is treated as trained and uses the high skill modifier for the ghoul's level. This takes the same amount of actions or time as usual for the check.

The ghoul can instead automatically learn something specific known by a creature it consumed in the last 7 days, like the location of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} treasure or the name of a loved one. The ghoul can do this only once for a given creature, no matter how much of its flesh the ghoul consumed.

action->Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
action->Spore Cloud.description: A leshy ghoul can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungus creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage] damage. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet.

action->Spores.name: Spores
action->Spores.description: A creature that takes damage from a fungus leshy's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

action->Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
action->Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Dread Zombie Leshy.name: Dread Zombie Leshy
Dread Zombie Leshy.publicNotes:
Plague zombies are infested with horrible contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie leshy is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions

action->Rotten Burst.name: Rotten Burst
action->Rotten Burst.description: When a zombie leshy dies, a burst of twisted primal void energy explodes from its body, restoring @Damage[1d8[healing,void]]{1d8} Hit Points to each undead fungi or plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] and killing all natural plants, though merely causing discomfort to creatures with the plant trait. This area is filled with rotten vegetation, becoming difficult terrain.

action->Glide.name: Glide
action->Glide.description: The zombie leshy glides gently through the air, moving 5 feet toward the ground and up to 25 feet forward. As long as the leshy spends at least 1 action gliding each round, it remains in the air at the end of each turn. For the purpose of determining damage from falls, a leaf leshy always treats falls as if they were 20 feet shorter.

action->Zombie Rot.name: Zombie Rot
action->Zombie Rot.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes form zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately, or a zombie leshy if the creature had the leshy trait.

Dread Zombie Leshy Horde.name: Dread Zombie Leshy Horde
Dread Zombie Leshy Horde.publicNotes:
This shuffling mass of decaying flesh moves with dull but singular focus.

Necromancers most often create these mindless undead as obedient, expendable servitors. Left to its own devices, a zombie seeks only to consume the living, stopping only when its rotting body can no longer hold together.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie leshy horde is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions

action->Grave Tide.name: Grave Tide
action->Grave Tide.description: The zombie leshy horde is less organized than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to other creatures.

action->Shambling Onslaught.name: Shambling Onslaught
action->Shambling Onslaught.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The leshy zombies lash out at any enemies in their squares or within 5 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+5)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(1d12+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
action->Troop Movement.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

Earth Falls (1-2).name: Earth Falls (1-2)
Earth Falls (1-2).descriptionHazard: The area has become unstable as part of the swamp is pulled into another plane, causing sinkholes to spontaneously form.
Earth Falls (1-2).disable: @Check[type:arcana,nature,thievery|dc:15] (trained) two times to counter the planar energies.
Earth Falls (1-2).routine: (3 actions) On its turn each round, two new 10-foot-square sinkholes, 5 feet deep, randomly appear on the map. Until a creature of size Small or larger steps in the area of one, it looks no different than the surrounding area. If a creature takes an action to seek and succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:15] check, it notices the hazardous square.

action->A Pit!.name: A Pit!
action->A Pit!.description:
Trigger A creature of size Small or larger steps into an affected square or is standing on a square that becomes a sinkhole

Effect The ground beneath the creature gives way. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:15] Save.

Critical Success The creature is able to move to an adjacent square.

Success The creature grabs an edge.

Failure The creature falls into the pit and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. It takes @Damage[2[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage. Due to roots in the pit wall, it is easy to climb out of, requiring only a @Check[type:athletics|dc:10] check.

Earth Falls (3-4).name: Earth Falls (3-4)
Earth Falls (3-4).descriptionHazard: The area has become unstable as part of the swamp is pulled into another plane, causing sinkholes to spontaneously form.
Earth Falls (3-4).disable: @Check[type:arcana,nature,thievery|dc:18] (trained) three times to counter the planar energies.
Earth Falls (3-4).routine: (3 actions) On its turn each round, two new 10-foot-square sinkholes, 10 feet deep, randomly appear on the map. Until a creature of size Small or larger steps in the area of one, it looks no different than the surrounding area. If a creature takes an action to seek and succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:18] check, it notices the hazardous square.

action->A Pit!.name: A Pit!
action->A Pit!.description:
Trigger A creature of size Small or larger steps into an affected square or is standing on a square that becomes a sinkhole

Effect The ground beneath the creature gives way. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] Save.

Critical Success The creature is able to move to an adjacent square.

Success The creature grabs an edge.

Failure The creature falls into the pit and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. It takes @Damage[5[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage. Due to roots in the pit wall, it is easy to climb out of, requiring only a @Check[type:athletics|dc:13] check.

Earthquake.name: Earthquake
Earthquake.descriptionHazard: The earth shakes violently side to side, opening a fissure in the ground, partially collapsing builds, and scattering debris in all directions.

action->Quake.name: Quake
action->Quake.description: The ground shakes violently. All creatures in the area take @Damage[6d10[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save. On a critical failure, the creature falls into a 40-foot-deep fissure opened by the tremor. They can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} (DC 30 to prevent the fall, with a –2 circumstance penalty due to the moving ground). A creature that falls takes an additional @Damage[20[bludgeoning]]{20} falling damage, is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and must be rescued from their predicament by another PC taking one action to pull them free. If any creatures are still in fissures due to previous tremors, they automatically get a Failure on this save.

Earthquake (13-14).name: Earthquake (13-14)
Earthquake (13-14).descriptionHazard: The earth shakes violently side to side, opening a fissure in the ground, partially collapsing builds, and scattering debris in all directions.

action->Quake.name: Quake
action->Quake.description: The ground shakes violently. All creatures in the area take @Damage[8d10[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save. On a critical failure, the creature falls into a 60-foot-deep fissure opened by the tremor. They can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} (DC 30 to prevent the fall, with a –2 circumstance penalty due to the moving ground). A creature that falls takes an additional @Damage[30[bludgeoning]]{30} falling damage, is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and must be rescued from their predicament by another PC taking one action to pull them free. If any creatures are still in fissures due to previous tremors, they automatically get a Failure on this save.

action->Telepathy (100 feet).name: Telepathy (100 feet)
action->Telepathy (100 feet).description: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

action->Hope Vulnerability.name: Hope Vulnerability
action->Hope Vulnerability.description: The elegecide is fueled by the certainty of doom, which leaves it weakened by any hope. The first time each round that a creature critically fails at an attack or skill check against the elegecide, it experiences a burst of hope that leaves it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

action->Doom Aura.name: Doom Aura
action->Doom Aura.description:
30 feet

The elegecide constantly emits telepathic warnings about future dangers and harm. When a non-demon creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Dorsal Lash.name: Dorsal Lash
action->Dorsal Lash.description:
The elegecide lashes out with its trailing dorsal fins, looping them around a target within 15 feet. It sends a burst of telepathic information about all the possible ways the target can be injured in the next minute. The target takes @Damage[1d4[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the elegecide.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the elegecide.

Elite Air Scamp.name: Elite Air Scamp
Elite Air Scamp.publicNotes:
A pale blue head and paper-thin wings peek out from the cloud that clings to the air scamp. Air scamps are short-sighted and flighty, even relative to their kin; they are as likely to fly recklessly into battle as they are to whine in terror at a loud noise.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

action->Fog Vision.name: Fog Vision
action->Fog Vision.description: The air scamp ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

action->Sirocco Breath.name: Sirocco Breath
action->Sirocco Breath.description:
The air scamp creates cutting winds in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deal @Damage[(2d6+4)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is also pushed back 10 feet.

The air scamp can't use Sirocco Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sirocco Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Elite Animated Flame.name: Elite Animated Flame
Elite Animated Flame.publicNotes:
Although arguably quite friendly, fire scamps are considered far more dangerous than their kin. They delight in fire and playing pranks on everyone they befriend. Even given time to understand others' dislike of fire, most fire scamps enjoy the feel of flames enough to constantly test their limits.

Compared to the nations of other scamps, the nations on the Plane of Fire are by far the strongest. This backing inspires fire scamps to challenge authority more quickly than the others.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

action->Failed Task.name: Failed Task
action->Failed Task.description:
Trigger The animated flame starts its turn outside the village

Effect The animated flame dissipates.

action->Failing Task.name: Failing Task
action->Failing Task.description:
Trigger The animated flame leaves the village

Effect The animated flame becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The animated flame ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

action->Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath
action->Flame Breath.description:
The animated flame breathes flames in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[(2d4+4)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

The animated flame can't use Flame Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Flame Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic.name: Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic
Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic.publicNotes:
Tomb jellies are animate masses of protoplasm with a sickly combination of yellow, gray, and black hues. Their acidic bodies dissolve flesh but leave other materials, including a victim's gear and bones, intact. Some ancient cultures entombed bodies in stone sarcophagi with tomb jellies to allow the ooze to break down the flesh and clean and polish the bones.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A tomb jelly can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Bound in Death.name: Bound in Death
action->Bound in Death.description: The concentrated congealed magic splatters some of its substance on a willing undead creature within its reach. The target regains @Damage[3[healing,void]|shortLabel] HP, and its melee Strikes get the benefits of shadow curse until the end of its next turn.

action->Flesh-dissolving Acid.name: Flesh-dissolving Acid
action->Flesh-dissolving Acid.description: A tomb jelly's acid damages only flesh.

action->Shadow Curse.name: Shadow Curse
action->Shadow Curse.description: A creature hit by concentrated congealed magic's pseudopod takes @Damage[(1d6-2)[persistent,void]] damage. If the creature dies while it has this persistent damage, its corpse is affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Peaceful Rest}, except the concentrated congealed magic can still dissolve its flesh.

Elite Congealed Magic.name: Elite Congealed Magic
Elite Congealed Magic.publicNotes:
Found underground or in dungeons, these quivering, slug-like ropes of slime continuously scour their domain for food. In addition to their shape, they are named for their ability to shoot out expanding ribbons of slime that resemble tangled strings.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: Congealed magic can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Split.name: Split
action->Split.description: Whenever a congealed magic would take slashing damage (if it weren't immune) and has at least 10 HP, it splits into two identical oozes with half the original's HP. One congealed magic is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, move smaller creatures and objects out of the way to make a space or the split is canceled at the GM's discretion.

action->Tag Team.name: Tag Team
action->Tag Team.description:
Requirements another congealed magic is within 30 feet

Effect The ooze arcs magical essence to the other congealed magic. Creatures in that line take @Damage[(3d6-2)[void]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save. A creature that fails its save is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

armor->Leather Jacket.name: Leather Jacket
armor->Leather Jacket.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Gang Up.name: Gang Up
action->Gang Up.description: Silver Devil hooligans benefit from flanking a creature as long as at least two other Silver Devil hooligans are adjacent to that creature.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: A Silver Devil hooligan deals 1d6 additional damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} opponent.

Elite Wood Scamp.name: Elite Wood Scamp
Elite Wood Scamp.publicNotes:
These moss colonies coalesce over a century into the rough facsimile of a large sloth, right down to mimicking the unique structure of the animal's fur that attracts additional fungi and pollinating insects. Unless summoned or attacked, they rarely leave the trees upon which they first formed.

At first glance, wood elementals might not seem to have the same destructive potential as their cousins from the Planes of Fire, Water, or Air, but don't be fooled. The woods can be a dangerous place.

Though some resemble animals, the elemental beasts presented here are still plants, and their life cycles reflect it. Vegetable lambs grow on rooted stalks, from which they can't be removed until they've matured (or perhaps ripened), leaving them dependent on their immediate surroundings for food. Moss sloths are little more than lumps of green fluff for the first century of their existence, only gaining limited mobility once they can grow their defensive wooden claws.

Wild But Unwild

Many wood elementals are created by kizidhars and other powerful creatures on the Plane of Wood and placed in rote roles. Populating nature preserves and sprawling estates, they can be unsure how to behave if released into the wild. They're essentially born domesticated and will likely act far differently than the wild creatures they mimic, even in natural environments. Their natural predators are few, putting the elementals at less risk, although they're still sometimes eaten by giant termites or captured by some as pets.

A Brain By Any Other Name

Even if Lady Shumunue taught the wood elementals' ancestors to mimic animals, a wood elemental's consciousness is contained not in a brain but in its root system. Entities like nursery crawlers, living groves, and carved beasts use this to their advantage. That an elemental's wooden body can be carved and crafted, apparently without lasting harm, implies that they might not feel pain so long as their roots remain undamaged.

action->Breathe Pollen.name: Breathe Pollen
action->Breathe Pollen.description: The wood scamp breathes choking pollen in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[(2d6+4)[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save; creatures who don't need to breathe are immune). The wood scamp can't Breathe Pollen again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Pollen]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Thorn Puncture.name: Thorn Puncture
action->Thorn Puncture.description: The wood scamp breaks off one of its thorn-like claws in the target's skin, dealing 1 persistent bleed damage until the thorn is removed, which requires an Interact action. This damage is cumulative with each thorn caught in a creature's skin.

Empowered Bloodmoon.name: Empowered Bloodmoon
Empowered Bloodmoon.descriptionHazard: Bloodmoon is a naginata that can act on its own provided it is attuned to at least one creature.
Empowered Bloodmoon.disable: Two successful @Check[religion|dc:17|options:disable-bloodmoon] or @Check[occultism|dc:17|options:disable-bloodmoon] checks, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 15)
Empowered Bloodmoon.routine: (3 actions) Bloodmoon uses its first action to fly up to 20 feet towards an opponent. It then makes two naginata strikes, each against a different foe.

action->Float.name: Float
action->Float.description:
Trigger Combat begins with the creature it is attuned to

Effect The blade begins to float in the air, then rolls initiative.

action->Prone to Monologuing.name: Prone to Monologuing
action->Prone to Monologuing.description: If a PC uses an action to taunt Bloodmoon with a successful @Check[deception|dc:15], @Check[diplomacy|dc:15], or @Check[intimidation|dc:15] check, Bloodmoon must spend an action monologuing on the next turn.

Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4).name: Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4)
Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4).descriptionHazard: Bloodmoon is a naginata that can act on its own provided it is attuned to at least one creature.
Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4).disable: Two successful @Check[religion|dc:20|options:disable-bloodmoon] or @Check[occultism|dc:20|options:disable-bloodmoon] checks, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18)
Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4).routine: (3 actions) Bloodmoon uses its first action to fly up to 20 feet towards an opponent. It then makes two naginata strikes, each against a different foe.

action->Float.name: Float
action->Float.description:
Trigger Combat begins with the creature it is attuned to

Effect The blade begins to float in the air, then rolls initiative.

action->Prone to Monologuing.name: Prone to Monologuing
action->Prone to Monologuing.description: If a PC uses an action to taunt Bloodmoon with a successful @Check[deception|dc:18], @Check[diplomacy|dc:18], or @Check[intimidation|dc:18] check, Bloodmoon must spend an action monologuing on the next turn.

action->Tiny.name: Tiny
action->Tiny.description: Bloodmoon is treated as a tiny creature with reach.

Empowered Oozeshardling Node.name: Empowered Oozeshardling Node
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.descriptionHazard: A lump of bluish ooze shot through with what look like tiny silver shavings of metal. Once it has been activated, it glows with arcs of electricity that leap out at nearby targets.
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.disable: Two successful @Check[arcana|dc:22] or @Check[occultism|dc:22] (trained) checks on the oozeshardling to disperse its power, or @Check[acrobatics|dc:24] or @Check[thievery|dc:24] (expert) to remove the flecks of empowering warshard from within the oozeshardling. A failed Acrobatics or Thievery check to disable an oozeshardling results in the creature attempting the check taking @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage (@Damage[2d6[acid]] on a critical failure).
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.reset: The oozeshardling node collapses and melds back into the oozeshard after 1 minute, or disappears entirely if the oozeshard is slain.
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.routine: (3 actions) The oozeshardling uses its first action to make an electric spark Strike against one random non-ooze creature within range, its second action is used to move straight in a random cardinal direction (roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Direction]] to determine the direction), and its third action to make a second electric spark Strike against a different random non-ooze creature within range. The oozeshardling doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.stealth: (trained) (or –10 and no minimum proficiency if the oozeshardling node's electric pulse reaction has been triggered)

action->Electric Pulse.name: Electric Pulse
action->Electric Pulse.description:
Trigger A creature enters a space within 10 feet of the oozeshardling or the oozeshardling is created by the oozeshard's Spawn Oozeshardling Node ability

Effect The oozeshardling unleashes a shocking blast that deals @Damage[3d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around it (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save).

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Serpent Dagger.name: Serpent Dagger
weapon->Serpent Dagger.description:
The serrated blade of this +1 striking dagger has a greenish tinge, and the hilt is sculpted to look like the head of a serpent about to strike.

When you critically succeed at an attack roll with the serpent dagger, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. This is a poison effect.

In addition, you can activate the dagger to poison a creature with a more potent poison.

Activate—Drip Poison F (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Trigger You damage a creature with the serpent dagger

Effect You poison the creature you hit with dagger venom.

Dagger Venom (poison)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}

weapon->+1 Striking Handwraps of Mighty.name: +1 Striking Handwraps of Mighty Blows
weapon->+1 Striking Handwraps of Mighty.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Tether Pull.name: Tether Pull
action->Tether Pull.description:
Trigger Rowan has thrown her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ZvIEJCY60fHqzl6r]{Serpent Dagger} at a target

Frequency once per turn

Effect After the attack's result is resolved, Rowan yanks on the cord attached to the weapon's hilt, returning it to her hand. If she throws the weapon to a distance of 20 feet or beyond, this ability becomes 1-action and gains the manipulate trait.

action->Flash Attack.name: Flash Attack
action->Flash Attack.description: Rowan's strikes deal 2d6 extra damage to creatures who are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to her, or who are within reach of at least one of her allies.

action->Mirror Step.name: Mirror Step
action->Mirror Step.description:
Requirements Rowan is within 30 feet of one of the circular mirrors in the southern two rooms of the laboratory

Effect Rowan uses her connection to the aiudara fragments to translocate. She Strides once into one of the circular mirrors, teleporting to any other such mirror of her choice. When she does this, she leaves behind a mirrored image of herself until the start of her next turn. This image acts as an ally for all purposes, but has an AC of 0, 1 HP, and cannot take actions.

action->Blades of Shade.name: Blades of Shade
action->Blades of Shade.description: Shadow Lesolethe causes the shadows cast by those around her to transform into a mesh of blades which erupt upwards at her foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Enemy creatures in this area take @Damage[5d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save).

action->Boiling Darkness.name: Boiling Darkness
action->Boiling Darkness.description: Shadow-Lesolethe utters a scream which causes shadows to churn and boil. Each living enemy within 30 feet to attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to Boiling Darkness for 1 minute.

Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.name: Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg
Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.descriptionHazard: A raging storm covers the mountain lake as spring water levitates from the lake to fall back down in a driving spiral of steaming rain. In the depths of the storm, barely visible, is a tiny koi egg surrounded by three bands of water.
Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:28], @Check[religion|dc:28], @Check[nature|dc:28], or @Check[occultism|dc:28] to purify the magic corrupting the ascension ritual, or @Check[diplomacy|dc:31] or @Check[performance|dc:31] to soothe the spirit within the koi egg and give it the strength to fight off the corruption itself; four total successes are required to purify the ritual, each of the first three successes purifying one ring of water and the final one halting the ritual itself. If the cursed comb has not been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check merely halts the ritual; if the cursed comb has been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check completes the ascension ritual.
Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.reset: The turbulent koi egg can attempt to hatch again, restarting the ascension ritual, after 1000 years of Xalreonshin's care.
Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.routine: (1 action) Torrential water descends from the sky, taking the shape of a dragon that smashes into one creature within 60 feet of the egg. The dragon always targets the creature that is closest to the egg, dealing @Damage[(2d10+2)[bludgeoning],2d10[fire]]{2d10+2 bludgeoning damage and 2d10 fire} damage in a spray of boiling water (@Check[fortitude|dc:28] save). Creatures that fail the save are pushed 10 feet away. Creatures that have the earth trait, are carrying an item with the earth trait, or are otherwise strongly tied to elemental earth (such as an earth elemental sorcerer or kineticist) get the result one degree of success better than the outcome of their save, as the power of elemental earth overcomes water.

action->Immune to All Damage (Until Fina.name: Immune to All Damage (Until Final Ring is Purified)

action->Raise the Storm.name: Raise the Storm
action->Raise the Storm.description:
Trigger Xalreonshin rolls initiative, three rounds pass after the PCs begin speaking with Xalreonshin, or a creature other than Xalreonshin comes within 40 feet of the egg

Effect The turbulent koi egg churns the lake surface, ejecting water into the sky. A 1-mile-radius area centered on the egg becomes filled with heavy rain and strong wind imposing a -2 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and requiring flying creatures to [[/act maneuver-in-flight dc=24]].

action->Hellish Spellstrike.name: Hellish Spellstrike
action->Hellish Spellstrike.description: Yollen's signature spellstrike channels the ill will of Hell. He casts ignition, then makes a melee attack strike with his greataxe. If he successfully hits, he deals an additional 3d6 damage (6d6 on a critical hit) on top of the damage from ignition and the greataxe. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not apply until after Yollen completes this ability. Yollen cannot use Hellish Spellstrike again until he has recharge it using a single action with the concentrate trait, or cast his conflux spell.

action->Voice of the Nessari.name: Voice of the Nessari
action->Voice of the Nessari.description:
Through his Nahyndrian-warshard concoction, Yollen voice becomes infused with the menacing weight of a tyrant devil. All non-allied creatures within 20 feet who can hear Yollen must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save against @Damage[7d10[spirit]] damage.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute. The creature must also attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute. The creature must also attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Enava.name: Enava
Enava.publicNotes:
Succubi are manifestations of the sin of destructive lust, and they are the most attractive of all demons—as befits their role in seducing mortals to fall to sin. The concept of gender is fluid to a succubus, as they can adopt countless humanoid forms of any gender to aid in their goals. Most succubi have a feminine true form (incubi, which usually have a masculine true form, are a different kind of demon), but regardless of gender, a lust demon is supernaturally beautiful or handsome, but with curving horns, bat wings, sharp claws, and a sinuous tail.

When disguised as a mortal humanoid in the Universe, a succubus whispers into the ears of mortals, urging them to pursue their darkest and most destructive desires and pushing them into depravity, using magic only if persuasion fails. While mortals often fixate on succubi's application of sexual lust, these demons are can easily exploit lust for power, knowledge, fame, or any other desire as easily as more carnal appetites. Their ability to infiltrate societies makes them excellent spies, assassins, and political saboteurs as well. Ultimately, the succubus enjoys all means of upending mortal culture.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.
Enava.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Rejection Vulnerability.name: Rejection Vulnerability
action->Rejection Vulnerability.description:
As succubi are beings of pure lust, creatures that reject their lust can metaphysically harm them. When a succubus fails a Diplomacy check to Embrace or Request, or when a creature succeeds at its save against a succubus's mental spell or ability, the succubus takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage.

For 1 hour after causing mental damage to a succubus in this way, a creature can deal @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage to the succubus with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action incorporating its rejection.

action->Seductive Presence.name: Seductive Presence
action->Seductive Presence.description:
10 feet.

Any creature in the aura that could be sexually attracted to a succubus takes a –2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to oppose the succubus's mental spells, Deception, and Diplomacy.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The succubus can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Embrace.name: Embrace
action->Embrace.description: The succubus attempts to [[/act grapple skill=diplomacy]]{Grapple} a creature using their Diplomacy bonus instead of Athletics. If the creature is willing, the succubus automatically succeeds.

action->Passionate Kiss.name: Passionate Kiss
action->Passionate Kiss.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The succubus engages a creature they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in an embrace or other act of passion to drain its vital essence.

The kiss makes the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increases its drained value by 1, to a maximum of 4. The creature takes @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and the succubus regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} to submit to more actions of passion rather than trying to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

action->Profane Gift.name: Profane Gift
action->Profane Gift.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The succubus gives a willing humanoid a profane gift. That creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, and saving throws. As long as the gift persists, the succubus can communicate telepathically with the target at any distance, see through the creature's senses, and target the creature with suggestion through the telepathic link. In addition, the creature uses an outcome one degree of success worse than it rolls on saving throws against the succubus's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} spells.

A humanoid can't have more than one profane gift at a time, and a succubus can't grant more than one profane gift at a time. Removing the gift requires an atone ritual. The succubus can remove the gift as a free action to give the recipient a curse, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} with an unlimited duration.

A summoned succubus can't grant a profane gift.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.g5Yen1FhEMCzCJkv]{Effect: Profane Gift}

action->Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7).name: Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7)
action->Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7).description: The brain guzzler has integrated nanites that swarm over damage, healing it.

action->Cybernetics.name: Cybernetics
action->Cybernetics.description: The cybernetics of a brain guzzler can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=22]] check. A brain guzzler's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A brain guzzler with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Guzzle.name: Guzzle
action->Guzzle.description:
Trigger The brain guzzler kills an enemy

Effect The brain guzzler breaks open its victim's skull and eats the brain. The brain guzzler gains knowledge of the victim's memories, and its Intelligence increases by +1. The victim can no longer be raised from the dead by any method that requires an intact corpse and rises as a zombie shambler the next day at dawn.

action->Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7).name: Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7)
action->Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7).description: The brain guzzler has integrated nanites that swarm over damage, healing it.

action->Cybernetics.name: Cybernetics
action->Cybernetics.description: The cybernetics of a brain guzzler can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=22]] check. A brain guzzler's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A brain guzzler with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Guzzle.name: Guzzle
action->Guzzle.description:
Trigger The brain guzzler kills an enemy

Effect The brain guzzler breaks open its victim's skull and eats the brain. The brain guzzler gains knowledge of the victim's memories, and its Intelligence increases by +1. The victim can no longer be raised from the dead by any method that requires an intact corpse and rises as a zombie shambler the next day at dawn.

action->Ulna Bow.name: Ulna Bow
action->Ulna Bow.description: The brain guzzler fires with the ulna bow, which rips the ulna out of its own forearm and fires it at one target within 120 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:25] save or take @Damage[(3d8+5)[piercing]] damage. The ulna explodes on impact, dealing @Damage[4d8[piercing]] damage to adjacent creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). Once the ulna bow has been used once it can't be used again.

Enraged Bun the Black.name: Enraged Bun the Black
Enraged Bun the Black.publicNotes:
Although the glistening scales and sleek, fin-like wings on these drakes give them an appearance reminiscent of river fish, they are actually distant relatives of the dragons that rule the oceans. While smaller than most drakes, river drakes are more than capable of plaguing river travelers and are equally at home above and below the water's surface. This flexibility allows them to catch a wide variety of prey, from fish and boggards to deer and the occasional ferry passenger.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

action->Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
action->Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of Bun the Black's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check

Effect Bun the Black attempts to Strike the triggering creature with their tail. If it hits, the target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

action->Caustic Mucus.name: Caustic Mucus
action->Caustic Mucus.description:
Bun the Black spits a ball of caustic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[4d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). Those that fail this save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,acid]] damage and take a –5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent acid damage. Bun the Black can't use Caustic Mucus again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Caustic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TbmkcfpKIs558skY]{Effect: Caustic Mucus}

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: Bun the Black makes one fangs Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

action->Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
action->Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect Bun the Black Strides or Flies twice.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Serpent Dagger.name: Serpent Dagger
weapon->Serpent Dagger.description:
The serrated blade of this +1 striking dagger has a greenish tinge, and the hilt is sculpted to look like the head of a serpent about to strike.

When you critically succeed at an attack roll with the serpent dagger, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. This is a poison effect.

In addition, you can activate the dagger to poison a creature with a more potent poison.

Activate—Drip Poison F (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Trigger You damage a creature with the serpent dagger

Effect You poison the creature you hit with dagger venom.

Dagger Venom (poison)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Tether Pull.name: Tether Pull
action->Tether Pull.description:
Trigger Rowan has thrown her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ZvIEJCY60fHqzl6r]{Serpent Dagger} at a target

Frequency once per turn

Effect After the attack's result is resolved, Rowan yanks on the cord attached to the weapon's hilt, returning it to her hand. If she throws the weapon to a distance of 20 feet or beyond, this ability becomes 1-action and gains the manipulate trait.

action->Flash Attack.name: Flash Attack
action->Flash Attack.description: Rowan's strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures who are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to her, or who are within reach of at least one of her allies.

action->Mirror Step.name: Mirror Step
action->Mirror Step.description:
Requirements Rowan is within 30 feet of one of the circular mirrors in the southern two rooms of the laboratory

Effect Rowan uses her connection to the aiudara fragments to translocate. She Strides once into one of the circular mirrors, teleporting to any other such mirror of her choice. When she does this, she leaves behind a mirrored image of herself until the start of her next turn. This image acts as an ally for all purposes, but has an AC of 0, 1 HP, and cannot take actions.

Enraged The Heartwood Rots.name: Enraged The Heartwood Rots
Enraged The Heartwood Rots.publicNotes:
Vampires use their servitor pawns for infiltration and reconnaissance.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Enraged The Heartwood Rots.hpDetails: coffin restoration, fast healing 7, void healing

action->Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
action->Children of the Night.description: The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include rat swarms, bat swarms, and wolves but can include other creatures. The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they're within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

action->Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
action->Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

action->Mist Escape.name: Mist Escape
action->Mist Escape.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. They can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

They automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if they reaches their coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

action->Rotten Burst.name: Rotten Burst
action->Rotten Burst.description: When The Heartwood Rots dies, a burst of primal void energy explodes from her body, restoring @Damage[2d8[healing,void]]{2d8} Hit Points to each undead fungi or plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] and killing all natural plants, though merely causing discomfort to creatures with the plant trait. This area is filled with rotten vegetation, becoming difficult terrain.

action->Vampire Vulnerabilities.name: Vampire Vulnerabilities
action->Vampire Vulnerabilities.description:
All vampires possess the following vulnerabilities.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures with strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless they're transported while they hide within their coffin, nor can they enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions—a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome their compulsion just as they do their revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a deity with a holy sanctification option. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so, and it remains brandished for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of their revulsion, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of their revulsion until they end an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of their revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents them from healing above 0 HP, even in their coffin. Staking a vampire requires 3 actions and works only if the vampire is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if they're in their coffin, the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with holy water while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends their turn in sunlight, and the condition ends when they're no longer in sunlight. If the vampire loses all their actions in this way, they're destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors

action->Create Servitor.name: Create Servitor
action->Create Servitor.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire servitor by donating some of their own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

A vampiric servitor is compelled to obey its creator, but if a vampire controls too many vampiric servitors at once (as determined by the GM), or if the servitor is a higher level than the vampire that created it, strong-willed servitors can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|defense:will] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

action->Dominate.name: Dominate
action->Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait (@Check[will|dc:22]). The save DC uses the high spell DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

action->Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
