action->Lover's Devotion.name: Lover's Devotion
action->Lover's Devotion.description:
Trigger Luxia would be hit by a melee attack

Effect One of the floating skulls of Luxia's previous lovers interferes with the attack, granting Luxia a +2 circumstance bonus to her AC. The skull is then destroyed. Once all three skulls are destroyed in this way, Luxia can no longer use this reaction.

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Luxia hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect Luxia expends the power stored in her +1 staff. This gives her the ability to cast one prepared spell she had already previously cast today without spending a spell slot. Luxia must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Luxia's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Major Unstable Furniture Archway.name: Major Unstable Furniture Archway
Major Unstable Furniture Archway.descriptionHazard: This unsteady pile of furniture is piled to the top of this usually high-ceilinged room. There looks to be some space to squeeze through to the other side, but even the slightest touch causes the stack to destabilize, and there's so much that once it begins to fall, it's difficult to stop.
Major Unstable Furniture Archway.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:25] to knock the pile over in a safe direction or @Check[thievery|dc:23] (trained) to carefully rearrange the furniture to a more stable configuration.
Major Unstable Furniture Archway.routine: On its initiative, the pile expands into an adjacent space, dealing creatures in that space @Damage[(2d8+5)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save, pushing them into an adjacent empty space, and making that space impassable until cleared. If no adjacent empty space is available, the pile buries the creature, suffocating it. Clearing a space or pulling a creature out requires a @Check[athletics|dc:18] check.

action->Tumbling Down.name: Tumbling Down
action->Tumbling Down.description:
Trigger A creature moves into a space adjacent to the furniture pile

Effect Part of the pile slides into a space the creature occupies, causing @Damage[(2d8+5)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save. The furniture pile rolls initiative.

action->Constrict Mind.name: Constrict Mind
action->Constrict Mind.description: The manifestation of nightmare deals @Damage[(2d6+6)[mental]] damage to any number of creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by it (@Check[will|dc:25|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure.

action->Morphic Limb.name: Morphic Limb
action->Morphic Limb.description: A manifestation of nightmare can form up to 8 morphic limbs at the same time. These limbs are constantly shifting their features according to the manifestation's whims, becoming fists, claws, pincers, blades, and anything else that it can imagine.

action->Recurring Nightmare.name: Recurring Nightmare
action->Recurring Nightmare.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature that is being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by a manifestation of nightmare can't reduce the value of its frightened condition below 1 until it Escapes.

action->Unnerving Echo.name: Unnerving Echo
action->Unnerving Echo.description: If the manifestation of nightmare critically hits with a nightmare vision Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

action->Brimstone Blink.name: Brimstone Blink
action->Brimstone Blink.description: Marius makes a quick hop through the Pit to reappear close to an enemy in a cloud of brimstone and ash. Marius teleports to any square within 15 feet that is within reach of another creature, then makes a melee Strike against one creature within his reach. This movement does not provoke reactions.

action->Spellstrip Strike.name: Spellstrip Strike
action->Spellstrip Strike.description: Marius specializes in using a spellcaster's own spells against them. He makes a melee attack against an enemy, dealing damage as normal. If the melee attack succeeds, he can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action to attempt to take one of the enemy's prepared spells or unused spontaneous spell slots. If successful, Marius gains a temporary spontaneous spell slot for the stolen spell until the end of his next turn. Determine the stolen spell at random from the target's spells that are 1st-rank. Innate spells, focus spells, and cantrips cannot be stolen in this manner.

action->Brimstone Blink.name: Brimstone Blink
action->Brimstone Blink.description: Marius makes a quick hop through the Pit to reappear close to an enemy in a cloud of brimstone and ash. Marius teleports to any square within 15 feet that is within reach of another creature, then makes a melee Strike against one creature within his reach. This movement does not provoke reactions.

action->Spellstrip Strike.name: Spellstrip Strike
action->Spellstrip Strike.description: Marius specializes in using a spellcaster's own spells against them. He makes a melee attack against an enemy, dealing damage as normal. If the melee attack succeeds, he can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action to attempt to take one of the enemy's prepared spells or unused spontaneous spell slots. If successful, Marius gains a temporary spontaneous spell slot for the stolen spell until the end of his next turn. Determine the stolen spell at random from the target's spells that are 1st-rank. Innate spells, focus spells, and cantrips cannot be stolen in this manner.

action->Rally.name: Rally
action->Rally.description:
Trigger A named ally of Petra's flees combat

Effect When spirits flag, Petra barks a rallying cry to her troops. When a named ally like Marius flees the field of battle, each Hellknight or agent of Thrune ally who hears this cry becomes bolstered by Petra's presence. They gain a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC and saving throws until the end of Petra's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TrCwynU02vy5rdJr]{Effect: Rally}

action->Commander's Orders.name: Commander's Orders
action->Commander's Orders.description: Petra issues a command to hasten her direct reports. Each Hellknight or agent of Thrune ally who hears and understands this command becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of that ally's next turn but can use the extra action only to Step or Stride.

action->Experienced Swordsmith.name: Experienced Swordsmith
action->Experienced Swordsmith.description: Petra has spent years training with a longsword in hand. When she critically succeeds at a Strike with her longsword, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of her next turn.

action->Rally.name: Rally
action->Rally.description:
Trigger A named ally of Petra's flees combat

Effect When spirits flag, Petra barks a rallying cry to her troops. When a named ally like Marius flees the field of battle, each Hellknight or agent of Thrune ally who hears this cry becomes bolstered by Petra's presence. They gain a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC and saving throws until the end of Petra's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TrCwynU02vy5rdJr]{Effect: Rally}

action->Commander's Orders.name: Commander's Orders
action->Commander's Orders.description: Petra issues a command to hasten her direct reports. Each Hellknight or agent of Thrune ally who hears and understands this command becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of that ally's next turn but can use the extra action only to Step or Stride.

action->Experienced Swordsmith.name: Experienced Swordsmith
action->Experienced Swordsmith.description: Petra has spent years training with a longsword in hand. When she critically succeeds at a Strike with her longsword, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of her next turn.

Master Bodyguard.name: Master Bodyguard
Master Bodyguard.publicNotes:
Hired to protect someone famous or powerful, bodyguards use intimidation, quick wits, and martial skill to keep their charges safe. Such mercenaries might be auxiliaries to a noble's personal guards, but with special directives to safeguard their patrons.

Whether they're hired to wage war, protect a caravan, or infiltrate an impenetrable fortress, there's ample work for mercenaries all over Golarion.

weapon->Greatclub.name: Greatclub
weapon->Greatclub.description: While many greatclubs are intricately carved, others are little more than a sturdy tree branch. These massive clubs are too heavy to wield with only one hand.

weapon->Sap.name: Sap
weapon->Sap.description: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon's purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

weapon->Sling.name: Sling
weapon->Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

action->Bodyguard's Reprisal.name: Bodyguard's Reprisal
action->Bodyguard's Reprisal.description:
Trigger A creature attacks the subject of bodyguard's defense

Effect The bodyguard makes a Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Bodyguard's Defense.name: Bodyguard's Defense
action->Bodyguard's Defense.description:
The bodyguard grants an adjacent ally a +2 circumstance bonus to AC. This lasts until the start of the bodyguard's next turn or until the ally is no longer adjacent, whichever comes first.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.IfUod2VxNmZMGGPq]{Effect: Bodyguard's Defense}

action->Winter's Bite.name: Winter's Bite
action->Winter's Bite.description:
30 feet, @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save. Hostile creatures within this aura gain weakness 3 to cold. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.AxdLeZcz2VVdfvRo]{Effect: Winter's Bite}

action->Icy Protection.name: Icy Protection
action->Icy Protection.description:
Whenever Szvetneera Casts a Spell with the cold trait, she can choose to grant one of her bodyguards resistance to cold 3 until the beginning of Szvetneera's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MwKc08dMPAFlAwrw]{Effect: Icy Protection}

action->Shackling Cold.name: Shackling Cold
action->Shackling Cold.description:
Matriarch Szvetneera uses her mastery of ice magic to hobble a target. If her next action is to Cast a Spell with the cold trait, that spell also gives the target a –10 circumstance penalty to their Speed until the beginning of Szvetneera's next turn if they are affected.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.josVmrDMWcTinHFK]{Effect: Shackling Cold}

Metal Scamp (Quest 22).name: Metal Scamp (Quest 22)
Metal Scamp (Quest 22).publicNotes: The capricious and destructive metal scamps are self-appointed forces of entropy, taking great pleasure in indiscriminately wrecking everything around them, sometimes even to their own detriment. Metal scamps have a severe appearance, with pointed facial features and angular limbs, and their skin can be the color of any metal, often heavily oxidized as if by years of exposure to the elements.

action->Breathe Shrapnel.name: Breathe Shrapnel
action->Breathe Shrapnel.description:
The metal scamp breathes a @Template[cone|distance:15] of jagged metal flakes that deals @Damage[(2d4)[slashing],(1d4)[bleed]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The metal scamp can't Breathe Shrapnel again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Shrapnel]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Cowardly Flight.name: Cowardly Flight
action->Cowardly Flight.description:
Trigger An enemy enters into melee range of Minister Jo

Frequency once per hour

Effect Minister Jo is not a fighter and would prefer to be safely behind his bodyguards. He flees, Striding up to his Speed, and he must end his movement closer to the Appraiser than when he started. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}, he can Reload his sukgung and then fire it backward over his shoulder in a panic, attempting a sukgung Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Expensive Reload.name: Expensive Reload
action->Expensive Reload.description:
Requirements Minister Jo has expensive bolts

Effect Minister Jo supplements his mediocre fighting ability with a variety of cheaply sourced magical items. He Reloads his sukgung with an expensive bolt and activates its magic, imbuing his next sukgung Strike with one of the following effects.

  • Shuffling Bolt (teleportation) If the bolt hits a target, the target and Minister Jo swap places. If the triggering hit was a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round after the teleportation.
  • Snare Bolt If the bolt hits a target, silk webbing wraps around them, imposing a –10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds for [[/gmr 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, or until they [[/act escape dc=21]] against a DC of 21. On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes.
  • Spark Bolt (electricity) The bolt deals an additional @Damage[(1d12[splash])[electricity]] damage.

Mischievous Plaguetooth.name: Mischievous Plaguetooth
Mischievous Plaguetooth.publicNotes:
Lone fairies usually need several minutes of elbow grease and a sleeping or restrained subject to extract a tooth.

Tooth fairies spawn when a child's tooth (or, less commonly, an entire child) is buried in terrain rife with fey energies. Hatching from the buried teeth like larvae from an egg, tooth fairies build crude pliers from whatever they can find, then go hunting for more teeth—regardless of the owners' willingness.

action->Plaque Burst.name: Plaque Burst
action->Plaque Burst.description: When killed, a tooth fairy bursts into sticky, foul-smelling white dust. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:5] must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Tooth Tug.name: Tooth Tug
action->Tooth Tug.description:
Requirements The tooth fairy's last action was a successful pliers Strike against a creature with teeth

Effect The tooth fairy attempts a @Check[thievery|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC, dealing @Damage[2[bleed]] damage on any result but a critical failure. On a critical success, it also pulls out one of the target's teeth.

If the creature loses a tooth, it takes a –1 status penalty to Charisma-based skill checks and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] to Cast a Spell unless that spell has the subtle trait. These effects last for 1 day, or until the stolen tooth is returned and the target regains at least 1 Hit Point.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4q8Of8NM9DC8kWyK]{Effect: Tooth Tug}

Mischievous Umberweed.name: Mischievous Umberweed
Mischievous Umberweed.publicNotes:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

action->Draxie Dust.name: Draxie Dust
action->Draxie Dust.description:
The draxie breathes magical dust in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the effect. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save or be affected.

The draxie can't use Draxie Dust again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Draxie Dust]]{1d4 rounds}.

  1. The target takes the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.
  2. The target loses its last 5 minutes of memory.
  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Mordant Spire Plunderer.name: Mordant Spire Plunderer
Mordant Spire Plunderer.publicNotes:
A ship's boatswain, or bosun, leads the deckhands who maintain the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

weapon->Naval Pike.name: Naval Pike
weapon->Naval Pike.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

action->Pike and Strike.name: Pike and Strike
action->Pike and Strike.description: The plunderer makes a melee Strike with their naval pike. If this Strike hits, the plunderer can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a fist Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the first Strike.

action->Plunderer's Command.name: Plunderer's Command
action->Plunderer's Command.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The plunderer orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the plunderer's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WfiaKdXNSxC3POcs]{Effect: Bosun's Command}

Nahyndrian Focus.name: Nahyndrian Focus
Nahyndrian Focus.descriptionHazard: A metal lattice forged from warshards feeds into a dark purplish crystal that pulses with energy. If the configuration of the lattice changes, so does the energy the device emits.
Nahyndrian Focus.disable: Three [[/act disable-device dc=27]] (see Disabling the Focus under Event 1 on page 18).
Nahyndrian Focus.routine: (3 actions) The Nahyndrian Focus uses Select Condition to determine which condition it is going to inflict. It then uses Inflict twice, usually on two different targets. If the focus is broken, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and can only Inflict once per turn.

action->Offensive Configuration.name: Offensive Configuration
action->Offensive Configuration.description:
Trigger Yollen activates the Nahyndrian Focus

Effect The Nahyndrian Focus shifts into attack mode and rolls initiative. All creatures without the unholy trait in within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:31|basic] save against @Damage[(4d10+22)[spirit]] damage.

action->Select Condition.name: Select Condition
action->Select Condition.description: The Nahyndrian Focus rolls a [[/gmr 1d4 #Condition]] to randomly decide whether it is going cause the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} condition when it uses Inflict until the end of its turn. After the first round, it changes the random roll die to [[/gmr 1d6 #Condition]] as it does not pick the same condition it had in the previous round.

action->Inflict.name: Inflict
action->Inflict.description:
An unhealthy beam shoots out from the focus. One creature without the unholy trait within 60 feet of the Focus must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The target becomes immune to Inflict for 1 minute.

Success The targe gains the condition from Select Condition with a value of 1 for 1 minute.

Failure As success, but with a value of 2.

Critical Failure As success, but with a value of 3.

action->Burning Strike.name: Burning Strike
action->Burning Strike.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his blades.

Effect Najid's blades ignite for just a moment. He can make two Strikes with his burning blades, each against the same target and Najid's current multiple attack penalty. If both attacks hit, combine their damage for the purposes of weakness and resistance. Both strikes deal fire damage regardless of the usual damage type. This counts as two attacks when calculating Najid's multiple attack penalty. Najid's focus leaves his blades.

action->Fennic Scream.name: Fennic Scream
action->Fennic Scream.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his voice.

Effect Najid screams at one creature within 20 feet, freezing their muscles with his rage. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is Stunned 2.

Failure the target is Stunned for one round.

Critical Failure the target is Stunned for one round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round thereafter.

Regardless of outcome, Najid's focus leaves his voice.

action->Roguish Smile.name: Roguish Smile
action->Roguish Smile.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his smile.

Effect Najid focuses on a creature within 30 feet while smiling confidently. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

Success the target is unaffected.

Failure the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for one round. The condition ends if Najid uses a hostile action against the target, but not if Najid uses a hostile action against the target's allies.

Critical Failure the target is fascinated for one minute. The condition ends if Najid uses a hostile action against the target, but not if Najid uses a hostile action against the target's allies.

Regardless of outcome, Najid's focus leaves his smile.

action->Sliver of Divinity.name: Sliver of Divinity
action->Sliver of Divinity.description: Najid focuses his divine spark into his short swords, his voice, or his smile, allowing himself to use the associated exemplar ability.

weapon->Locust Dagger.name: Locust Dagger
weapon->Locust Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

consumable->Scroll of Dispel Magic (Rank.name: Scroll of Dispel Magic (Rank 2)
consumable->Scroll of Dispel Magic (Rank.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

The spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack modifier and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when casting from a scroll. If the spell requires a locus, you must have that locus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Unleashed Familiar.name: Unleashed Familiar
action->Unleashed Familiar.description: Norvix's familiar is a giant rat named Squelch. She can take her actions independently of Norvix's commands and has her statistics presented separately. She has the familiar of restored spirit ability, so when Norvix Casts or Sustains a hex, one willing creature within 15 feet of Squelch gains 2 temporary Hit Points until the start of his next turn.

weapon->Locust Dagger.name: Locust Dagger
weapon->Locust Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

consumable->Scroll of Dispel Magic (Rank.name: Scroll of Dispel Magic (Rank 3)
consumable->Scroll of Dispel Magic (Rank.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

The spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack modifier and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when casting from a scroll. If the spell requires a locus, you must have that locus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Unleashed Familiar.name: Unleashed Familiar
action->Unleashed Familiar.description: Norvix's familiar is a giant rat named Squelch. She can take her actions independently of Norvix's commands and has her statistics presented separately. She has the familiar of restored spirit ability, so when Norvix Casts or Sustains a hex, one willing creature within 15 feet of Squelch gains 2 temporary Hit Points until the start of his next turn.

action->Familiar.name: Familiar
action->Familiar.description: Oloranvis's familiar is a poppet elkhound named Ruditgar. His Speed is 40 feet. He has poppet immunities and weakness 2 to fire. When Oloranvis Casts or Sustains a hex, she can cause ice to form in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] centered on Ruditgar's square. Those squares are difficult terrain until the start of her next turn. Ruditgar and Oloranvis communicate telepathically through touch.

action->Eldritch Nails.name: Eldritch Nails
action->Eldritch Nails.description: Oloranvis's razor-sharp nails sparkle with the residue of her winter magic. Her unarmed nail strikes cause both cold and slashing damage.

action->Winter's Gift.name: Winter's Gift
action->Winter's Gift.description: Oloranvis has an unusually strong connection to winter magic even for a winter witch. When she casts a spell with the cold trait, she gains a +1 status bonus to the spell DC or spell attack.

action->Armored Apotheosis.name: Armored Apotheosis
action->Armored Apotheosis.description: When it is first encountered, the oozeshard is in a lumpy, vaguely spherical ooze form. When it takes damage from any weapon attack, it suddenly reshapes, taking a form almost identical to the dead deity Gorum. The ooze hardens into armored plates (increasing its AC by +8) and its pseudopod transforms into a massive, acid-dripping greatsword. While in this form, it loses its pseudopod attack and its immunity to bludgeoning and precision damage. It cannot use its constrict or engulf abilities, and any creature currently engulfed by it is spat out into an adjacent random square, taking @Damage[1d4[acid],1d4[slashing]]{1d4 acid damage and 1d4 slashing} damage. It gains the Reactive Strike reaction. If it is critically hit by a Strike or critically fails a save against an effect that deals Hit Point damage to it, the oozeshard reverts back into its ooze form.

action->Gorumite Echoes.name: Gorumite Echoes
action->Gorumite Echoes.description: While in its armored apotheosis form, the oozeshard deals an additional 1d6 bleed damage and makes the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round when it critically hits with its greatsword.

action->Spawn Oozeshardling Node.name: Spawn Oozeshardling Node
action->Spawn Oozeshardling Node.description: Whenever the oozeshard takes 45 or more damage from a single attack, it spawns an oozeshardling node in an adjacent square. The oozeshardling node's electric pulse reaction immediately activates, and then the oozeshardling node enters initiative at the bottom of the current initiative count.

Oozeshardling Node.name: Oozeshardling Node
Oozeshardling Node.descriptionHazard: A lump of bluish ooze shot through with what look like tiny silver shavings of metal. Once it has been activated, it glows with arcs of electricity that leap out at nearby targets.
Oozeshardling Node.disable: Two successful @Check[arcana|dc:21] or @Check[occultism|dc:21] (trained) checks on the oozeshardling to disperse its power, or @Check[acrobatics|dc:23] or @Check[thievery|dc:23] (expert) to remove the flecks of empowering warshard from within the oozeshardling. A failed Acrobatics or Thievery check to disable an oozeshardling results in the creature attempting the check taking @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage (@Damage[2d6[acid]] on a critical failure).
Oozeshardling Node.reset: The oozeshardling node collapses and melds back into the oozeshard after 1 minute, or disappears entirely if the oozeshard is slain.
Oozeshardling Node.routine: (3 actions) The oozeshardling uses its first action to make an electric spark Strike against one random non-ooze creature within range, its second action is used to move straight in a random cardinal direction (roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Direction]] to determine the direction), and its third action to make a second electric spark Strike against a different random non-ooze creature within range. The oozeshardling doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Oozeshardling Node.stealth: (trained) (or –10 and no minimum proficiency if the oozeshardling node's electric pulse reaction has been triggered)

action->Electric Pulse.name: Electric Pulse
action->Electric Pulse.description:
Trigger A creature enters a space within 10 feet of the oozeshardling or the oozeshardling is created by the oozeshard's Spawn Oozeshardling Node ability

Effect The oozeshardling unleashes a shocking blast that deals @Damage[3d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around it (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save).

action->Skitter.name: Skitter
action->Skitter.description: The origami cockroach flies up to its speed toward a creature. If the creature is larger than it, the origami cockroach enters its space and gains cover, skittering about the target. This cover lasts until it or the target moves, causing them to cease sharing a space.

action->Flutter.name: Flutter
action->Flutter.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The paper mite flies up to its speed, and then enters the space of a hostile creature, flitting about its face. The target must make a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round (dazzled for 1 minute on a critical failure).

Pathfinder Defender.name: Pathfinder Defender
Pathfinder Defender.publicNotes:
Shadows that spend long amounts of time on the Netherworld and absorb its magic become greater shadows.

The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

action->Light Vulnerability.name: Light Vulnerability
action->Light Vulnerability.description: Attacks against the Pathfinder defender are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).

action->Shadow Spawn.name: Shadow Spawn
action->Shadow Spawn.description: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it. This @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.clzHAfegb9Rn6DOe]{Shadow Spawn} doesn't have Steal Shadow. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
action->Slink in Shadows.description: The Pathfinder defender can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

action->Steal Shadow.name: Steal Shadow
action->Steal Shadow.description:
Requirements The Pathfinder defender hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action

Effect The defender pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical hit). This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). The enfeebled value from Steal Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.

Pathfinder Guardian.name: Pathfinder Guardian
Pathfinder Guardian.publicNotes:
Wights are intelligent undead spawned through inescapable cycles of spite. This spite might come from their own malevolent will in life, or can be instilled by necromantic rituals, typically involving the desecration of burial sites. Wights usually haunt burial grounds, catacombs, or other places of the dead. Their hunger is targeted toward the living—those whose pumping hearts and ruddy warmth inspire visceral hatred.

As many types of wights exist as types of people from which they might be created. Hulking brutes, skittering sneaks, and cunning tinkers all make for different wights with different niches to fill. The environment, too, plays a part in determining a wight's special abilities and defenses. Frost wights, for instance, can be found in parts of the world where exposure is a common end and the resentment of being left alone in the wild is a common source of spite. Durable and sustained by void energy, wights can last in harsh environments without decaying the way some lesser undead do.

A single wight can wreak significant havoc if it is compelled to rise from its tomb. Because creatures slain under a wight's curse can become wights as well, all it takes is a single wight and a handful of unlucky graveyard visitors to create a veritable horde of these undead. Thus, canny priests and adventurers know that the best solution to a wight problem is swift and total eradication. Care must be taken, though, to destroy wight spawn before attempting to destroy the parent wight, for spawn without a master gain the ability to create spawn of their own.

action->Grave Weapon.name: Grave Weapon
action->Grave Weapon.description: The wight is bound to a dagger it was buried with.

action->Final Spite.name: Final Spite
action->Final Spite.description:
Trigger The wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. This Strike can inflict corrupting spite, but fueled by spite doesn't apply.

action->Fueled by Spite.name: Fueled by Spite
action->Fueled by Spite.description: Each time a creature loses Hit Points due to a corrupting spite curse the wight inflicted, the wight gains 3 temporary Hit Points.

action->Corrupting Spite.name: Corrupting Spite
action->Corrupting Spite.description:
The wight's unarmed attacks and bound weapons inflict a curse that makes a creature grow weak and spiteful. If a wight inflicts corrupting spite on a creature already afflicted by it, the victim attempts a new save, ignoring the result if it's better than a failure.

A living humanoid that dies while under the curse rises as a wight after [[/gmr 1d4 #Wight Spawn Timer]]{1d4 rounds}, controlled by the wight that killed it. The wight spawn can't inflict corrupting spite and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If its creator dies or after roughly a month of existence, the new wight becomes autonomous and turns into a normal wight

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17];

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and doesn't treat any creatures as allies (1 round)

Stage 3 As stage 2, except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)

Stage 4 As stage 2, except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4} (1 round).

Pathfinder Protector.name: Pathfinder Protector
Pathfinder Protector.publicNotes:
Ghouls stalkers are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
action->Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

action->Ghoul Whispers.name: Ghoul Whispers
action->Ghoul Whispers.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature is within the ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul whispers dark thoughts and vile cravings into the creature's ears. The creature must save against the forbidden cravings curse.

Forbidden Cravings (curse)

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:17|traits:curse]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} until it consumes raw meat (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2

Stage 4 as stage 2 unless the target has consumed raw meat in the past 24 hours, then it takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} until it consumes raw meat;

Stage 5 if the creature has eaten raw meat in the past 24 hours, it dies and rises as a ghoul, if not, it returns to stage 4

action->Swift Stroke.name: Swift Stroke
action->Swift Stroke.description: The ghoul swims up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Pathfinder Sentinel.name: Pathfinder Sentinel
Pathfinder Sentinel.publicNotes: When a creature dies, and for whatever reason its spirit is unable or unwilling to leave the site of its death, that spirit may manifest as a poltergeist: a restless, invisible spirit that is still able to manipulate physical objects. Many poltergeists perished in a way that resulted from or led to extreme emotional trauma.

action->Site Bound.name: Site Bound
action->Site Bound.description: A Pathfinder sentinel is tied to the wreck of the Whippoorwill and can't travel more than 120 feet from it.

action->Natural Invisibility.name: Natural Invisibility
action->Natural Invisibility.description: A poltergeist is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It becomes visible only when it uses Frighten.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When a poltergeist is destroyed, it reforms, fully healed, where it was destroyed after [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days}. A poltergeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Telekinetic Defense.name: Telekinetic Defense
action->Telekinetic Defense.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the poltergeist

Effect The poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Frighten.name: Frighten
action->Frighten.description:
Requirements The poltergeist must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}

Effect The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a failure. On a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

At the start of its next turn, the poltergeist becomes invisible again.

action->Telekinetic Storm.name: Telekinetic Storm
action->Telekinetic Storm.description:
The poltergeist telekinetically throws numerous small objects, such as rocks and pieces of wreckage, either spreading them out among multiple foes or directing them at one target.

  • When this effect is spread out among multiple foes, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike at a -2 penalty against each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet}. These count as one attack for the poltergeist's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
  • When this effect has only one target, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the target, and the damage increases to 3d12. It deals @Damage[1d12[untyped]] damage on a failure, and no damage on a critical failure.

Penumbra.name: Penumbra
Penumbra.publicNotes:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.
Penumbra.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

consumable->Scroll of Chain Lightning (R.name: Scroll of Chain Lightning (Rank 6)
consumable->Scroll of Chain Lightning (R.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TDNlDWbYb58Y55Da]{Chain Lightning}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

The spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack modifier and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when casting from a scroll. If the spell requires a locus, you must have that locus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

backpack->Spacious Pouch (Type III).name: Spacious Pouch (Type III)
backpack->Spacious Pouch (Type III).description:
Though it appears to be a cloth bag decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a spacious pouch opens into a magical space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the spacious pouch itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can Interact with the spacious pouch to stow items in it or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

Capacity 100 Bulk

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vital.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

action->Counterspell.name: Counterspell
action->Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell Penumbra has prepared

Effect Penumbra expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. She loses her spell slot as if she had cast the triggering spell. She then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

action->Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Wi.name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will)
action->Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Wi.description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Lich Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if their soul cage is found and destroyed.

action->Void Shroud.name: Void Shroud
action->Void Shroud.description: 30 feet. Penumbra is surrounded by an aura of death, drawing forth souls to be consumed by her constant hunger. Living creatures in the emanation take a –2 status penalty to saves against fear and death effects. In addition, any creature that starts its turn in the area gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} condition unless it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:30] save.

action->Condition Removal.name: Condition Removal
action->Condition Removal.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Penumbra ends one condition currently affecting her.

action->Drain Soul Cage.name: Drain Soul Cage
action->Drain Soul Cage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Penumbra taps into her soul cage's power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest rank the lich can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells. The lich's soul cage doesn't need to be present for the lich to use this ability.

action->Siphon Life.name: Siphon Life
action->Siphon Life.description: A lich's form draws forth life from those who come into contact with it. When the lich damages a living creature with an unarmed attack, the lich gains 5 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a Fortitude save against the lich's spell DC – 2 or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. If Penumbra is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} at the start of its turn, each creature grabbing or restraining it must succeed at a Fortitude save or become drained 1. If the lich siphons a creature's life again, the drained value increase by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

action->Spell Recharge.name: Spell Recharge
action->Spell Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Penumbra immediately gains an additional use of a spell she has already cast.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Penumbra's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Penumbra (11-12).name: Penumbra (11-12)
Penumbra (11-12).publicNotes:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.
Penumbra (11-12).allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

consumable->Scroll of Chain Lightning (R.name: Scroll of Chain Lightning (Rank 6)
consumable->Scroll of Chain Lightning (R.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TDNlDWbYb58Y55Da]{Chain Lightning}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

The spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack modifier and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when casting from a scroll. If the spell requires a locus, you must have that locus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

backpack->Spacious Pouch (Type III).name: Spacious Pouch (Type III)
backpack->Spacious Pouch (Type III).description:
Though it appears to be a cloth bag decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a spacious pouch opens into a magical space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the spacious pouch itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can Interact with the spacious pouch to stow items in it or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

Capacity 100 Bulk

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vital.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

action->Counterspell.name: Counterspell
action->Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell Penumbra has prepared

Effect Penumbra expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. She loses her spell slot as if she had cast the triggering spell. She then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

action->Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Wi.name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will)
action->Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Wi.description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Lich Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if their soul cage is found and destroyed.

action->Void Shroud.name: Void Shroud
action->Void Shroud.description: 30 feet. Penumbra is surrounded by an aura of death, drawing forth souls to be consumed by her constant hunger. Living creatures in the emanation take a –2 status penalty to saves against fear and death effects. In addition, any creature that starts its turn in the area gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} condition unless it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:34] save.

action->Condition Removal.name: Condition Removal
action->Condition Removal.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Penumbra ends one condition currently affecting her.

action->Drain Soul Cage.name: Drain Soul Cage
action->Drain Soul Cage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Penumbra taps into her soul cage's power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest rank the lich can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells. The lich's soul cage doesn't need to be present for the lich to use this ability.

action->Siphon Life.description: A lich's form draws forth life from those who come into contact with it. When the lich damages a living creature with an unarmed attack, the lich gains 5 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a Fortitude save against the lich's spell DC – 2 or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. If Penumbra is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} at the start of its turn, each creature grabbing or restraining it must succeed at a Fortitude save or become drained 1. If the lich siphons a creature's life again, the drained value increase by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

action->Spell Recharge.name: Spell Recharge
action->Spell Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Penumbra immediately gains an additional use of a spell she has already cast.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Penumbra's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

action->Bursting Pustules.name: Bursting Pustules
action->Bursting Pustules.description:
Trigger The zombie takes piercing damage or damage from a critical hit

Effect The pustules covering the zombie's flesh rupture, covering adjacent creatures with vile fluid. Creatures adjacent to the zombie become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save.

Pitborn Fire Giant Cavalry.name: Pitborn Fire Giant Cavalry
Pitborn Fire Giant Cavalry.publicNotes:
The most militaristic of giants, fire giants focus obsessively on learning combat techniques, mastering the arts of forging weapons and armor, and finding new ways to dominate their enemies. Most fire giant communities are built around elemental rifts, hot springs, or volcanic calderas and cannot be moved easily, inspiring unwavering defense against any intruders. As a result, their social and political structures are grounded firmly in martial hierarchies, with a strict emphasis on following the orders of one's superior.

As soon as a fire giant can walk, they are fitted with their first suit of forged armor. This armor is constantly remolded and replaced as the giant matures. Beyond what they can forge in their volcanic furnaces, fire giants also look to tame dinosaurs, drakes, and hell hounds as tools of war.

Fire giants are usually identified by their powerful stature and bright orange hair that flickers and dances as if aflame. A typical fire giant stands about 14 feet tall, weighs around 7,000 pounds, and lives to be 350 years old.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

action->Intimidating Charge.name: Intimidating Charge
action->Intimidating Charge.description:
The pitborn cavalry commands his mount to Stride twice directly toward a creature. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save. Regardless of the results of the save, the pitborn cavalry makes an axe Strike at the creature.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the giant until the start of the giant's next turn.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} for 1 minute and off-guard to the giant until the start of the giant's next turn.

action->Mounted Combat.name: Mounted Combat
action->Mounted Combat.description: A pitborn fire giant cavalry automatically succeeds at attempts to Command their mounts. They can wield their greataxes one-handed while mounted. While doing so they cannot use their fist or flame Strikes.

Plaguetooth.name: Plaguetooth
Plaguetooth.publicNotes:
Lone fairies usually need several minutes of elbow grease and a sleeping or restrained subject to extract a tooth.

Tooth fairies spawn when a child's tooth (or, less commonly, an entire child) is buried in terrain rife with fey energies. Hatching from the buried teeth like larvae from an egg, tooth fairies build crude pliers from whatever they can find, then go hunting for more teeth—regardless of the owners' willingness.

action->Plaque Burst.name: Plaque Burst
action->Plaque Burst.description: When killed, a tooth fairy bursts into sticky, foul-smelling white dust. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:5] must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Tooth Tug.name: Tooth Tug
action->Tooth Tug.description:
Requirements The tooth fairy's last action was a successful pliers Strike against a creature with teeth

Effect The tooth fairy attempts a @Check[thievery|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC, dealing @Damage[2[bleed]] damage on any result but a critical failure. On a critical success, it also pulls out one of the target's teeth.

If the creature loses a tooth, it takes a –1 status penalty to Charisma-based skill checks and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] to Cast a Spell unless that spell has the subtle trait. These effects last for 1 day, or until the stolen tooth is returned and the target regains at least 1 Hit Point.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4q8Of8NM9DC8kWyK]{Effect: Tooth Tug}

Powerful Ritual Effects.name: Powerful Ritual Effects
Powerful Ritual Effects.descriptionHazard: The effects of Hesla's profane ritual ripple outward through Deskari's Gullet. Physical tremors shake the cavern complex, while magical waves of energy affect those opposed to her actions.
Powerful Ritual Effects.disable: This hazard persists until Hesla's ritual is complete and her demonic forces defeated.
Powerful Ritual Effects.routine: (two actions) The ground shakes, and waves of demonic energy surge through the cavern. Each PC must make a save against tremors and a save against demonic energy. Enemy combatants must only make the Reflex save against tremors; they are immune to the Demonic Energy effects.

action->The Ritual Continues.name: The Ritual Continues
action->The Ritual Continues.description:
Trigger Combat begins within Deskari's Gullet

Effect The Ritual Effects roll initiative. Each combat indicates how often this hazard triggers during that combat.

action->Tremors.name: Tremors
action->Tremors.description: Targets take @Damage[(1d10+4)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save) as rocks fall from the ceiling. On a critical failure, the target falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Demonic Energy.name: Demonic Energy
action->Demonic Energy.description: Targets take @Damage[(1d10+4)[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic] save). On a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Holy creatures treat their save as one degree worse for the purposes of the sickened condition only.

Puddles Ghoul.name: Puddles Ghoul
Puddles Ghoul.publicNotes:
Ghouls stalkers are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

action->Slurp Blood.name: Slurp Blood
action->Slurp Blood.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the Puddles ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul bites the creature, slurping its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the target's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim takes @Damage[(1d6+1)[piercing]] damage and the Puddles ghoul regains @Damage[3[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary HP.

action->Swift Movement.name: Swift Movement
action->Swift Movement.description: The Puddles ghoul jumps up to half its Speed or swims up to half its swim Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Puddles Phantom.name: Puddles Phantom
Puddles Phantom.publicNotes:
Cavaliers and knights who died for their cause make for particularly strongwilled phantoms. Though their motives vary, these phantoms often seek to continue their lifelong missions even in their purgatorial states, and their strong forces of will make them formidable fighters in spite of their incorporeality. A phantom knight might strive to find living followers of their church or order, or seek out other mortals they knew in life as a way of staying grounded and avoiding the corruption of undeath.

The typical trajectory for souls passing to the afterlife is fairly straightforward, according to most theologians. When a mortal dies, their soul enters the River of Souls and eventually reaches the Boneyard, where it is judged by Pharasma. The judged soul moves onto its appropriate domain of final rest—Heaven, Hell, Abaddon, and so forth—where it becomes a shade.

Complications arise, however, when a soul in queue for judgment prematurely departs from the River of Souls and is shunted into the Ethereal Plane. Whether as a result of nefarious interlopers like daemons or hags, malignant planar magic, or even fate, these souls become dislodged from the natural order of life and death and linger in a sort of purgatory. Unlike petitioners, these ethereal phantoms retain memories of their life before death, and unlike spirits such as ghosts, phantoms aren't tinged with the foul influences of undeath—at least, not at first, though the threat of corruption hangs heavy over a phantom's existence. Some eventually succumb to that fate, while others eventually rejoin the River of Souls. Until then, these wandering souls are a kind unto themselves—one without a true home, agenda, or purpose.

Many phantoms have no desire to remain in their strange state of purgatory, either because they seek to continue their journey through the River of Souls or because they fear the corruption of undeath. In order to complete the natural spiritual cycle and become judged so they can continue to the afterlife, a phantom must find a way back into the River of Souls. Such a quest is no easy feat, however—the hazy mists of the Ethereal Plane can befuddle even the most experienced traveler, and numerous predators prowl the realm in search of stray souls to bind or devour.
Puddles Phantom.allSavesBonus: -1 status to all saves vs. death effects

action->Walk the Ethereal Line.name: Walk the Ethereal Line
action->Walk the Ethereal Line.description:
The phantom walks the thin line between the Ethereal Plane and the Universe in order to exist on both planes simultaneously.

They can shift back to solely the Ethereal Plane by using this ability again.

action->-1 Status to All Saves vs. Death.name: -1 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects

action->Susceptible to Death.name: Susceptible to Death
action->Susceptible to Death.description:
Though phantoms aren't alive, neither are they undead, and they are uniquely vulnerable to the effects of death.

A phantom whose Hit Points are reduced to 0 as a result of a death effect (such as from a spell like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Z9OrRXKgAPv6Hn5l]{Execute}) is immediately whisked away to the River of Souls, where their soul resumes the usual path to the afterlife.

action->Phantom Daggers.name: Phantom Daggers
action->Phantom Daggers.description: Each time they make a phantom dagger Strike, a Puddles phantom can choose to deal spirit damage instead of the normal physical damage type. Whichever damage type they choose, the phantom dagger vanishes and a new phantom dagger immediately appears in the phantom's hand.

Puddles Phantom (5-6).publicNotes:
