action->Phantom Daggers.description: Each time they make a phantom dagger Strike, a Puddles phantom can choose to deal spirit damage instead of the normal physical damage type. Whichever damage type they choose, the phantom dagger vanishes and a new phantom dagger immediately appears in the phantom's hand.

Pure Legionnaire.name: Pure Legionnaire
Pure Legionnaire.allSavesBonus: +2 on all saves against divine magic

weapon->Scimitar.name: Scimitar
weapon->Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->+2 Status to All Saves Against D.name: +2 Status to All Saves Against Divine Magic

action->May No Mortal Be Beholden.name: May No Mortal Be Beholden
action->May No Mortal Be Beholden.description: When the Pure Legionnaire rolls a success on a save against an effect or spell from the divine tradition, they get a critical success instead.

action->Smite Divine.name: Smite Divine
action->Smite Divine.description: The scimitars of the Pure Legion have been enchanted specifically to take down divine spellcasters. Melee Strikes against clerics, champions, and other creatures capable of casting divine spells do an additional 2d6 mental damage.

action->Sudden Charge.name: Sudden Charge
action->Sudden Charge.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Pure Legionnaire Strides twice. If they end their movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.

Pusk (PFS 6-00).name: Pusk (PFS 6-00)
Pusk (PFS 6-00).publicNotes:
Among the lowest and least powerful of all demons, the wretched pusks are just as vicious and cruel as their more powerful brethren. They happily vent their frustrations on anything weaker than themselves.

Born from the souls of the slothful, these demons appear vaguely humanoid in appearance with awkward limbs and slack lumps of skin hanging from their frames. Supposedly, a single slothful soul of sufficient depravity and strength can spawn an entire horde of these creatures. However, as weaker demons, their lot in life is to suffer at the hands of more powerful Abyssal predators, and only a tiny number of pusks ever manage to become something more. For this reason, pusks are quite accommodating when summoned by mortals. They're usually content to work under conditions few other fiends would accept, although they'll still gladly turn on even the kindest of masters who show even the slightest hint of weakness.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

action->Sloth.name: Sloth
action->Sloth.description:
When a pusk regains their actions, roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Actions Regained]]{1d4}. The pusk regains that many actions for the turn (to a maximum of 3, or 2 if the pusk is a minion).

Effects like the slowed condition can further reduce their number of actions.

action->Cower.name: Cower
action->Cower.description: The pusk makes itself as small as possible, protecting its vital organs with its limbs. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC but takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls. This lasts until the pusk moves from its current space, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or ends the effect as a free action.

action->Frenzied Slashes.name: Frenzied Slashes
action->Frenzied Slashes.description: The pusk makes three claw Strikes, each at a –2 penalty, all targeting the same creature. The pusk's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it has made all three attacks. The pusk gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} condition until the beginning of its next turn.

action->Vicious Criticals.name: Vicious Criticals
action->Vicious Criticals.description: A pusk makes the most of any weakness it finds. Whenever a pusk scores a critical hit with its claw Strike, the target takes an additional @Damage[1d6[bleed]]{1d6 persistent bleed} damage.

Rain-Soaked Crowd.name: Rain-Soaked Crowd
Rain-Soaked Crowd.descriptionHazard: A crowd of carnival goers are spurred to panic by supernatural rain.
Rain-Soaked Crowd.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:17] (trained) to calm them down, @Check[intimidation|dc:18] (trained) to cow them, @Check[athletics|dc:20] (trained) to force them back

action->Surge Forward.name: Surge Forward
action->Surge Forward.description:
Trigger The PCs fail to overcome a task during the Dreaded Downpour event

Effect The crowd surges forward, dealing @Damage[(2d10+7)[bludgeoning]] damage to each PC. Each affected creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and takes a –1 circumstance penalty to their next skill check to overcome a task during the Dreaded Downpour event.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and takes a –2 circumstance penalty to their next skill check to overcome a task during the Dreaded Downpour event.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.aMmQY3YvufchsXGT]{Effect: Surge Forward}

Rain-Soaked Crowd (5-6).name: Rain-Soaked Crowd (5-6)
Rain-Soaked Crowd (5-6).descriptionHazard: A crowd of carnival goers are spurred to panic by supernatural rain.
Rain-Soaked Crowd (5-6).disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:21] (trained) to calm them down, @Check[intimidation|dc:22] (trained) to cow them, @Check[athletics|dc:24] (trained) to force them back

action->Surge Forward.name: Surge Forward
action->Surge Forward.description:
Trigger The PCs fail to overcome a task during the Dreaded Downpour event

Effect The crowd surges forward, dealing @Damage[(4d8+10)[bludgeoning]] damage to each PC. Each affected creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and takes a –1 circumstance penalty to their next skill check to overcome a task during the Dreaded Downpour event.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and takes a –2 circumstance penalty to their next skill check to overcome a task during the Dreaded Downpour event.

Rasping Cicada.name: Rasping Cicada
Rasping Cicada.publicNotes:
These small insects are a nuisance and danger to small villages within Brevoy, taking over entire forests and blending in with the foliage. Also known as calling beetles, due to their ability to mimic and repeat the voices of their previous victims, crying cicadas wait for passersby to lure into the trees, fascinating their victims with their cries before fluttering their wings to release toxic dust. Once a target is near death, crying cicadas will take flight from the trees and land on the body to feed.

The scale dust of crying cicadas can be turned into an effective ingested poison, but obtaining a cicada and harvesting these scales is so dangerous that most would-be poisoners simply die in the process. Even finding the insects is dangerous enough; crying cicadas' natural stealth and dark coloration make them difficult to locate among the trees of a forest, and following their cries often leads one to fall victim to the very creatures they're hunting.

The longer a colony of crying cicadas stays in a forest, the wider their collection of cries grows. Often, a young colony will be able to replicate only the sounds of small, dying creatures, but larger, more established colonies will have the ability to mimic the sounds of children and dragons.

action->Steal Voice.name: Steal Voice
action->Steal Voice.description:
Requirements An enemy creature has spoken since the rasping cicada's last turn

Effect The rasping cicada learns and mimics the sound of its opponent's voice. It can't make new sentences, but it can choose to repeat select parts of the phrases it has heard. All non-cicada creatures within 30 feet, other than the owner of the stolen voice, must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:15] save to disbelieve the mimicry.

action->Rasping Cicada Poison.name: Rasping Cicada Poison
action->Rasping Cicada Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:15]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage plus slowed 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

action->Cowardly Flight.name: Cowardly Flight
action->Cowardly Flight.description:
Trigger An enemy enters into melee range of Minister Jo

Frequency once per hour

Effect Minister Jo is not a fighter and would prefer to be safely behind his bodyguards. He flees, Striding up to his Speed, and he must end his movement closer to the Appraiser than when he started. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}, he can Reload his sukgung and then fire it backward over his shoulder in a panic, attempting a sukgung Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Expensive Reload.name: Expensive Reload
action->Expensive Reload.description:
Requirements Minister Jo has expensive bolts

Effect Minister Jo supplements his mediocre fighting ability with a variety of cheaply sourced magical items. He Reloads his sukgung with an expensive bolt and activates its magic, imbuing his next sukgung Strike with one of the following effects.

  • Shuffling Bolt (teleportation) If the bolt hits a target, the target and Minister Jo swap places. If the triggering hit was a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round after the teleportation.
  • Snare Bolt If the bolt hits a target, silk webbing wraps around them, imposing a –10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds for [[/gmr 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, or until they [[/act escape dc=25]] against a DC of 25. On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes.
  • Spark Bolt (electricity) The bolt deals an additional @Damage[(2d12[splash])[electricity]] damage.

Reinforced Hot Spring Statue.name: Reinforced Hot Spring Statue
Reinforced Hot Spring Statue.publicNotes:
Giant animated statues' increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Tasks beyond their capabilities typically require a more advanced construct, not an animated object.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.

action->Boil Alive.name: Boil Alive
action->Boil Alive.description: The statue hinges open, revealing boiling water within it, and then plunges a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in. The target takes @Damage[3d10[fire],1d8[persistent,fire]] damage.

action->Geothermally Heated.name: Geothermally Heated
action->Geothermally Heated.description: The statue is magically powered by the same geothermal power that heats the waters in Maecho's hot springs. Dealing 18 cold damage to the statue cools it off, preventing it from using Boil Alive, removing the fire damage from its ranged attacks, and making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for one round, after which the cold water cycles out of the statue and it returns to its usual temperature.

Resolved Captain Pitros Nanaeil.name: Resolved Captain Pitros Nanaeil
Resolved Captain Pitros Nanaeil.allSavesBonus: +2 on all saves against divine magic

weapon->Bloodletting Kukri.name: Bloodletting Kukri
weapon->Bloodletting Kukri.description: This +1 striking kukri has a crimson blade that shimmers eerily in bright light. On a critical hit, the kukri deals 1d8 persistent bleed damage. If the target didn't already have persistent bleed damage when you scored the critical hit, you also gain [[/r 1d8]] temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

weapon->Scimitar.name: Scimitar
weapon->Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

strike-melee->Bloodletting Kukri.name: Bloodletting Kukri
strike-melee->Bloodletting Kukri.description: Plus 1d8 persistent bleed on crit. If the target of the critical hit didn't already have persistent bleed damage, Nanaeil also gains 1d8 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

action->+2 on All Saves Against Divine M.name: +2 on All Saves Against Divine Magic

action->Aura of Command.name: Aura of Command
action->Aura of Command.description: 30 feet. As captain of the Pure Legion, Nanaeil bolsters the lower-level legionnaires under his command, granting them a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and +2 status bonus to their will saves.

action->Dual-Weapon Warrior.name: Dual-Weapon Warrior
action->Dual-Weapon Warrior.description: Pitros Nanaeil is highly trained in the art of wielding two weapons at once, preferring to wield the +1 striking scimitar in his main hand and the bloodletting kukri in his off-hand.

action->May No Mortal Be Beholden.name: May No Mortal Be Beholden
action->May No Mortal Be Beholden.description: When Captain Nanaeil rolls a success on a save against an effect or spell from the divine tradition, they get a critical success instead.

action->Twin Riposte.name: Twin Riposte
action->Twin Riposte.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach critically fails to Strike you.

A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon. Make a melee Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against the triggering opponent.

action->Double Slice.name: Double Slice
action->Double Slice.description: Nanaeil lashes out at his foe with both weapons. He makes two Strikes, one with each melee weapon, each using his current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target. If both attacks hit, combine their damage, then add any other applicable effects from both weapons. Precision damage is added only once. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating his multiple attack penalty.

action->Smite Divine.name: Smite Divine
action->Smite Divine.description: The Pure Legion's scimitars have been enchanted specifically to take down divine spellcasters. Melee Strikes against clerics, champions, and other creatures capable of casting divine spells do an additional 2d6 mental damage.

action->Eye Ray.name: Eye Ray
action->Eye Ray.description:
The retriever makes a ranged eye ray Strike against an enemy within 60 feet. On a hit, the retriever chooses one of the four options listed below. The retriever cannot use the same effect in consecutive rounds. Once the retriever has used all four options, the eye ray Strike can't be used for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Cold The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[cold]] damage
  • Electricity The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[electricity]] damage
  • Fire The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[fire]] damage
  • Petrification The enemy is targeted by a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} using the retriever's innate spell DC (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|traits:earth]).

Riftcarver.name: Riftcarver
Riftcarver.descriptionHazard: Riftcarver is the chthonic artifact weapon of Deskari, the slain demon lord of the locust host and plague of the Worldwound (now known as the Sarkoris Scar). Unfettered from its creator, it now wreaks havoc on the enemies of its current master, Hesla Embersplitter.
Riftcarver.disable: @Check[deception|dc:24] (expert), @Check[Demon Lore|dc:24] (trained), or @Check[religion|dc:24] (expert) to remind Riftcarver that it should not serve an interloper; @Check[intimidation|dc:28] (trained), @Check[nature|dc:28] (trained), or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (trained) to temporarily make Riftcarver's spirit cower; @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th rank, counteract DC 25); three total successes are required to disable the hazard. The first time Riftcarver is taken away from Hesla Embersplitter against her will (via disarm, a spell, or some other method), it also counts as one success. If Hesla Embersplitter is rendered @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or killed, the hazard immediately ends.
Riftcarver.routine: (three actions) Riftcarver lives up to its name, using all three of its actions to carve a new rift in a random direction (rolling [[/gmr 1d8]] to determine that direction). Hesla Embersplitter is immune to the effects of these rifts while wielding Riftcarver.

action->Infectious Memory.name: Infectious Memory
action->Infectious Memory.description:
Trigger An enemy of Hesla Embersplitter rolls for initiative

Effect Riftcarver calls out with thousands of voices to infest the minds of the righteous. Any creature within 60 feet with the holy trait must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). Riftcarver then rolls initiative.

action->Carve Rift.name: Carve Rift
action->Carve Rift.description: A line of acid slices through creatures and terrain alike, creating a rift that is 20 feet high, 100 feet long, and 1 inch thick. This rift provides cover. The rift deals @Damage[5d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature that is in its space when it is first created, that attempts to pass through it, or that ends its turn inside the rift, with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save. A creature that succeeds at this save when the chasm is created is pushed to the nearest space on the side of its choice. Creatures trying to move through the rift fail to do so if they critically fail their save, ending their movement next to the rift.

Riftcarver (11-12).name: Riftcarver (11-12)
Riftcarver (11-12).descriptionHazard: Riftcarver is the chthonic artifact weapon of Deskari, the slain demon lord of the locust host and plague of the Worldwound (now known as the Sarkoris Scar). Unfettered from its creator, it now wreaks havoc on the enemies of its current master, Hesla Embersplitter.

The first time Riftcarver is taken away from Hesla Embersplitter against her will (via disarm, a spell, or some other method), it also counts as one success. If Hesla Embersplitter is rendered @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or killed, the hazard immediately ends.
Riftcarver (11-12).routine: (three actions) Riftcarver lives up to its name, using all three of its actions to carve a new rift in a random direction (rolling [[/gmr 1d8]] to determine that direction). Hesla Embersplitter is immune to the effects of these rifts while wielding Riftcarver.

action->Infectious Memory.name: Infectious Memory
action->Infectious Memory.description:
Trigger An enemy of Hesla Embersplitter rolls for initiative

Effect Riftcarver calls out with thousands of voices to infest the minds of the righteous. Any creature within 60 feet with the holy trait must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:33|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). Riftcarver then rolls initiative.

action->Carve Rift.name: Carve Rift
action->Carve Rift.description: A line of acid slices through creatures and terrain alike, creating a rift that is 20 feet high, 100 feet long, and 1 inch thick. This rift provides cover. The rift deals @Damage[6d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature that is in its space when it is first created, that attempts to pass through it, or that ends its turn inside the rift, with a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save. A creature that succeeds at this save when the chasm is created is pushed to the nearest space on the side of its choice. Creatures trying to move through the rift fail to do so if they critically fail their save, ending their movement next to the rift.

Rimesnap.name: Rimesnap
Rimesnap.publicNotes:
"True" twigjacks, as they consider themselves, are found in wild forests alongside the fey they idolize.

Maladjusted forest denizens, twigjacks form from the cruel and prankish combination of fey and the very woods in which they reside. A twigjack's body is made up of prickly brambles woven with vines. Shaggy, mossy growth, not unlike hair, tops a twigjack's head. Its mouth is just a canyon of splintered and broken sticks bisecting its face. Leaves and sprigs of new growth randomly sprout from the creature's body. Many dense forests on Golarion have at least a handful of twigjacks living in the undergrowth.

While truculent and violent, twigjacks care deeply for what they consider to be their forests. These creatures harass outsiders who delve deep into their wooded domains, forcing back even the most determined explorers, foresters, and travelers, especially when those intruders cut roads through the forest. However, they are not terribly territorial when it comes to other forest creatures. When sylvan creatures, especially fey, rally against an outside threat, twigjacks in the area eagerly arrive to fight, even if they were not invited.

action->Bramble Jump.name: Bramble Jump
action->Bramble Jump.description:
Requirements Rimesnap is in undergrowth

Effect Rimesnap scrambles into the undergrowth and instantly teleports to a square of undergrowth within 60 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Pine Spray.name: Pine Spray
action->Pine Spray.description: Rimesnap sprays a volley of frozen pine needles from their body in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], dealing @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[cold]|options:area-damage]{1d6 piercing and 1d6 cold} damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save). Rimesnap can't use Pine spray again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Pine spray]]{1d4 rounds}.

Ritual Effects.name: Ritual Effects
Ritual Effects.descriptionHazard: The effects of Hesla's profane ritual ripple outward through Deskari's Gullet. Physical tremors shake the cavern complex, while magical waves of energy affect those opposed to her actions.
Ritual Effects.disable: This hazard persists until Hesla's ritual is complete and her demonic forces defeated.
Ritual Effects.routine: (two actions) The ground shakes, and waves of demonic energy surge through the cavern. Each PC must make a save against tremors and a save against demonic energy. Enemy combatants must only make the Reflex save against tremors; they are immune to the Demonic Energy effects.

action->The Ritual Continues.name: The Ritual Continues
action->The Ritual Continues.description:
Trigger Combat begins within Deskari's Gullet

Effect The Ritual Effects roll initiative. Each combat indicates how often this hazard triggers during that combat.

action->Tremors.name: Tremors
action->Tremors.description: Targets take @Damage[(1d8+4)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save) as rocks fall from the ceiling. On a critical failure, the target falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Demonic Energy.name: Demonic Energy
action->Demonic Energy.description: Targets take @Damage[(1d8+4)[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save). On a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Holy creatures treat their save as one degree worse for the purposes of the sickened condition only.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Serpent Dagger.name: Serpent Dagger
weapon->Serpent Dagger.description:
The serrated blade of this +1 striking dagger has a greenish tinge, and the hilt is sculpted to look like the head of a serpent about to strike.

When you critically succeed at an attack roll with the serpent dagger, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. This is a poison effect.

In addition, you can activate the dagger to poison a creature with a more potent poison.

Activate—Drip Poison F (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Trigger You damage a creature with the serpent dagger

Effect You poison the creature you hit with dagger venom.

Dagger Venom (poison)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Tether Pull.name: Tether Pull
action->Tether Pull.description:
Trigger Rowan has thrown her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ZvIEJCY60fHqzl6r]{Serpent Dagger} at a target

Frequency once per turn

Effect After the attack's result is resolved, Rowan yanks on the cord attached to the weapon's hilt, returning it to her hand. If she throws the weapon to a distance of 20 feet or beyond, this ability becomes 1-action and gains the manipulate trait.

action->Flash Attack.name: Flash Attack
action->Flash Attack.description: Rowan's strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures who are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to her, or who are within reach of at least one of her allies.

action->Mirror Step.name: Mirror Step
action->Mirror Step.description:
Requirements Rowan is within 30 feet of one of the circular mirrors in the southern two rooms of the laboratory

Effect Rowan uses her connection to the aiudara fragments to translocate. She Strides once into one of the circular mirrors, teleporting to any other such mirror of her choice. When she does this, she leaves behind a mirrored image of herself until the start of her next turn. This image acts as an ally for all purposes, but has an AC of 0, 1 HP, and cannot take actions.

action->Eye Ray.name: Eye Ray
action->Eye Ray.description:
The retriever makes a ranged eye ray Strike against an enemy within 60 feet. On a hit, the retriever chooses one of the four options listed below. The retriever cannot use the same effect in consecutive rounds. Once the retriever has used all four options, the eye ray Strike can't be used for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Cold The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[cold]] damage
  • Electricity The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[electricity]] damage
  • Fire The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[fire]] damage
  • Petrification The enemy is targeted by a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} using the retriever's innate spell DC (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|traits:earth]).

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 5).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 5).description: The automatic greeter has Hardness. Once the automatic greeter is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 15.

Sailor's Warning (1-2).name: Sailor's Warning (1-2)
Sailor's Warning (1-2).descriptionHazard: An illusory cyclops in oracular robes cries out a warning, but then dissolves into a violent phantasmal cyclops, which calls out for the Blind Formless Chaos That Lies Behind the Stars to accept his sacrifice. It then plunges an obsidian athame into a creature's chest, summoning a foul entity.
Sailor's Warning (1-2).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:14] (trained) to repair Chamenaiti's magic, @Check[religion|dc:17] or @Check[occultism|dc:17] (trained) to offset the prayer, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st rank; counteract DC 14) to counteract the warning
Sailor's Warning (1-2).routine: a Rubbery crimson tentacles appear from a rip in the air and grasp at all creatures in the area, dealing @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save).

action->Blood Sacrifice.name: Blood Sacrifice
action->Blood Sacrifice.description:
Trigger Sailing Mission 5 begins;

Effect The trap makes an athame Strike against a random creature, and then rolls initiative.

Sailor's Warning (3-4).name: Sailor's Warning (3-4)
Sailor's Warning (3-4).descriptionHazard: An illusory cyclops in oracular robes cries out a warning, but then dissolves into a violent phantasmal cyclops, which calls out for the Blind Formless Chaos That Lies Behind the Stars to accept his sacrifice. It then plunges an obsidian athame into a creature's chest, summoning a foul entity.
Sailor's Warning (3-4).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:18] (trained) to repair Chamenaiti's magic, @Check[religion|dc:20] or @Check[occultism|dc:20] (trained) to offset the prayer, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18) to counteract the warning
