action->Blood Sacrifice.name: Blood Sacrifice
action->Blood Sacrifice.description:
Trigger Sailing Mission 5 begins;

Effect The trap makes an athame Strike against a random creature, and then rolls initiative.

Sailor's Warning (5-6).name: Sailor's Warning (5-6)
Sailor's Warning (5-6).descriptionHazard: An illusory cyclops in oracular robes cries out a warning, but then dissolves into a violent phantasmal cyclops, which calls out for the Blind Formless Chaos That Lies Behind the Stars to accept his sacrifice. It then plunges an obsidian athame into a creature's chest, summoning a foul entity.
Sailor's Warning (5-6).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:21] (trained) to repair Chamenaiti's magic, @Check[religion|dc:23] or @Check[occultism|dc:23] (trained) to offset the prayer, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 21) to counteract the warning
Sailor's Warning (5-6).routine: a Rubbery crimson tentacles appear from a rip in the air and grasp at all creatures in the area, dealing @Damage[(1d6+3)[bludgeoning],(1d6+3)[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic] save).

action->Blood Sacrifice.name: Blood Sacrifice
action->Blood Sacrifice.description:
Trigger Sailing Mission 5 begins;

Effect The trap makes an athame Strike against a random creature, and then rolls initiative.

Sailor's Warning (7-8).name: Sailor's Warning (7-8)
Sailor's Warning (7-8).descriptionHazard: An illusory cyclops in oracular robes cries out a warning, but then dissolves into a violent phantasmal cyclops, which calls out for the Blind Formless Chaos That Lies Behind the Stars to accept his sacrifice. It then plunges an obsidian athame into a creature's chest, summoning a foul entity.
Sailor's Warning (7-8).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:25] (trained) to repair Chamenaiti's magic, @Check[religion|dc:27] or @Check[occultism|dc:27] (trained) to offset the prayer, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 25) to counteract the warning
Sailor's Warning (7-8).routine: a Rubbery crimson tentacles appear from a rip in the air and grasp at all creatures in the area, dealing @Damage[(2d8)[bludgeoning],(2d8)[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save).

action->Blood Sacrifice.name: Blood Sacrifice
action->Blood Sacrifice.description:
Trigger Sailing Mission 5 begins;

Effect The trap makes an athame Strike against a random creature, and then rolls initiative.

Sargassum Bud Pile.name: Sargassum Bud Pile
Sargassum Bud Pile.descriptionHazard: Sargassum heaps that have only started to grow have no intelligence, but are incredibly tenacious and can reflexively grab onto nearby prey. They obtain nutrients by drowning prey in the water they grow in.
Sargassum Bud Pile.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:32] (expert) to rip the reflexive tendrils off the bud or @Check[thievery|dc:32] (expert) to trigger the tendrils beforehand and keep them occupied.
Sargassum Bud Pile.reset: 1 hour if the bud pile has something in its grasps. 1 round if the bud pile has nothing in its grasps.

action->Tendril Entanglement.name: Tendril Entanglement
action->Tendril Entanglement.description:
Trigger a creature moves into a square adjacent to the bud pile or into the square the bud pile occupies

Effect The sargassum bud pile whips out numerous tendrils, attempting to grab the creature. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The target dodges the tendril and is unaffected.

Success A couple of tendrils latch on to the target. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. The target can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} by attempting an Athletics or Acrobatics skill check of DC 28.

Failure Several tendrils grab the target. The target becomes grabbed and must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the target cannot breathe in water, they begin to suffocate. The DC to Escape increases to 30.

Critical Failure As failure, except the DC to Escape increases to 35.

action->Thundering Hooves.name: Thundering Hooves
action->Thundering Hooves.description: A Sarkorian red bison's charge shakes the earth. The bison Strides twice and can move through the spaces of creatures at least one size smaller. Each creature whose square the bison enters must takes @Damage[(2d6+9)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). A creature that critically fails this save takes double damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Scouring Pool.name: Scouring Pool
Scouring Pool.descriptionHazard: The swirling water in this pool entices anyone who can see or hear it to wander into its depths, drowning its victims.
Scouring Pool.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:27] to scratch out the runes creating the effect, @Check[occultism|dc:23] (expert) or @Check[Demon Lore|dc:23] (expert) to determine the password that identifies the party as believers, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd-rank; counteract DC 25); two total successes are required to deactivate the pool.
Scouring Pool.routine:
(1 action; mental) The cleansing pool uses its first action to try and compel all creatures within 5 feet to enter into the pool. Creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23|traits:mental] save.

Critical Success The creature is immune to the pool's routine for 1 minute.

Success No effect.

Failure The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} condition and attempts to enter the pool.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature must also use all of their actions on their next turn to try and pull one of their allies into the pool with them.
Scouring Pool.stealth: (expert) to notice the enticing effects of the pool

action->Echoing Spring.name: Echoing Spring
action->Echoing Spring.description:
Trigger a creature within 10 feet can see or hear the cleansing pool

Effect each creature within range must succeed a @Check[will|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, using all of their available actions to move toward and into the pool. The hazard then rolls initiative.

action->Drown the Nonbelievers.name: Drown the Nonbelievers
action->Drown the Nonbelievers.description:
Trigger a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} creature enters the pool

Effect the waters rush up to encircle the creature, which must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or begin drowning.

armor->Cultist Garb (Functions as Leathe.name: Cultist Garb (Functions as Leather Armor)
armor->Cultist Garb (Functions as Leathe.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Fanatical Frenzy.name: Fanatical Frenzy
action->Fanatical Frenzy.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a –2 penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is fatigued.

action->Stench of Decay.name: Stench of Decay
action->Stench of Decay.description: The necromancer emits a scent of putrid rot in a 5-foot emanation. Anyone that enters or begins its turn in the aura that is not a member of the Cult of the Screaming Grub is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

action->Undead, Arise!.name: Undead, Arise!
action->Undead, Arise!.description:
The necromancer summons two Medium undead entities in different empty squares up to 30 feet away. These undead entities can take the form of zombies, skeletons, or ghosts, chosen by the necromancer. The entities block movement as though they were creatures and can be attacked. Each entity has 1 Hit Point and the same AC and saves as the necromancer. They can't take actions of their own and deteriorate if the necromancer is reduced to 0 Hit Points. The necromancer can have up to four undead entities at any given time. If they call another, the oldest undead entity deteriorates.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pfs-season-6-bestiary.Actor.DclMSxfKDPrsc48z]{Screaming Grub Undead}

action->Undead, Attack!.name: Undead, Attack!
action->Undead, Attack!.description:
Requirements The necromancer has at least one undead entity active

Effect The necromancer commands all their undead entities to attack. Each entity can Stride up to 20 feet into an empty square and make a Strike. The Strike has a +15 attack modifier and deals 2d12 bludgeoning damage (or spirit damage if the entity is a spirit). The Strike has the magical trait, and no multiple attack penalty applies to it.

action->Wave of Death.name: Wave of Death
action->Wave of Death.description:
Requirements The necromancer isn't drained and has at least one undead entity active

Effect The necromancer overloads their undead entities with void energy, causing all of them to explode. Each entity is destroyed, dealing @Damage[4d10[void]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] with a @Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save. A creature in more than one explosion is damaged only once. The necromancer becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

armor->Cultist Garb (Functions as Leathe.name: Cultist Garb (Functions as Leather Armor)
armor->Cultist Garb (Functions as Leathe.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Fanatical Frenzy.name: Fanatical Frenzy
action->Fanatical Frenzy.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a –2 penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is fatigued.

action->Blades of Shade.name: Blades of Shade
action->Blades of Shade.description: Shadow Lesolethe causes the shadows cast by those around her to transform into a mesh of blades which erupt upwards at her foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Enemy creatures in the area take @Damage[4d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).

action->Boiling Darkness.name: Boiling Darkness
action->Boiling Darkness.description: Shadow Lesolethe utters a scream which causes shadows to churn and boil. Each living enemy within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to Boiling Darkness for 1 minute.

Shadowpact Goliath Spider.name: Shadowpact Goliath Spider
Shadowpact Goliath Spider.publicNotes:
Goliath spiders dwell in the deepest jungles, where they build webs as big as temples and feast on prey as large as hippopotami.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

action->Web Sense.name: Web Sense
action->Web Sense.description:
The goliath spider has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]

action->Spring Upon Prey.name: Spring Upon Prey
action->Spring Upon Prey.description:
Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled.

Trigger A creature touches the goliath spider's web while the spider is on it.

Effect The goliath spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.

action->Descend on a Web.name: Descend on a Web
action->Descend on a Web.description:
The goliath spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

A creature that successfully Strikes the web (AC 20, Hardness 5, 20 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.

action->Goliath Spider Venom.name: Goliath Spider Venom
action->Goliath Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}

action->Hazard Immunity.name: Hazard Immunity
action->Hazard Immunity.description: The shadowpact goliath spider never triggers the reactions of hazards in its own lair and is immune to the negative consequences of damaging area effects created by hazards in its lair (so if a PC set off a hazard that released a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} inside its lair, it would not take damage from the fireball even if it was within the fireball's area).

action->Web Tether.name: Web Tether
action->Web Tether.description:
A creature hit by the spider's web Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and tethered to the spider, preventing it from moving farther away from the spider.

The spider can have one creature tethered at a time. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} the web is 30. The tether can be severed with a Strike (AC 20, Hardness 5, HP 20), but this doesn't free the restrained creature.

Shadowpact Shadow.name: Shadowpact Shadow
Shadowpact Shadow.publicNotes:
Shadows that spend long amounts of time on the Netherworld and absorb its magic become greater shadows.

The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

action->Light Vulnerability.name: Light Vulnerability
action->Light Vulnerability.description: Attacks against the shadow are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).

action->Deadly Striker.name: Deadly Striker
action->Deadly Striker.description: The shadowpact shadow deals an additional 1d6 precision damage on their next Strike whenever they use an action to Stride 10 or more feet.

action->Greater Shadow Spawn.name: Greater Shadow Spawn
action->Greater Shadow Spawn.description: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Shadow, it becomes a greater shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it, using these statistics without Deadly Striker, Steal Shadow, or Unimpeded. This shadow spawn is incurably @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous greater shadow, gaining Steal Shadow and losing the clumsy condition. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
action->Slink in Shadows.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

action->Steal Shadow.name: Steal Shadow
action->Steal Shadow.description:
Requirements The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action

Effect The shadow pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical hit). This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). The enfeebled value from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.

action->Unimpeded.name: Unimpeded
action->Unimpeded.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The shadowpact shadow automatically ends one effect that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed.

Shadowpact Statue.name: Shadowpact Statue
Shadowpact Statue.publicNotes:
Animated statues are often used to guard crypts, small shrines, or areas in government buildings where they can be positioned amid normal statues to hide their true nature until an intruder arouses their ire. Many less scrupulous adventurers, fueled by paranoia that statues will animate and attack, smash any statues they encounter, ruining harmless, ancient relics.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: Like normal objects, a shadowpact statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a shadowpact statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 22.

action->Brazier.name: Brazier
action->Brazier.description: The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise within reach. Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue. Dealing @Damage[15[cold]] damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal fire damage.

action->Burn Alive.name: Burn Alive
action->Burn Alive.description: The statue grinds a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes @Damage[3d8[fire]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage.

action->Mythic Ferocity.name: Mythic Ferocity
action->Mythic Ferocity.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The shadowpact statue is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 3}

Trigger The shadowpact statue is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The shadowpact statue avoids being knocked out and remains at half its maximum HP, but its wounded value increases by 1.

Shadowpact Stone Bulwark.name: Shadowpact Stone Bulwark
Shadowpact Stone Bulwark.publicNotes: Stone bulwarks are slow and steady constructs typically carved from marble or granite. They're often made to serve as works of art when at rest, so some magical crafters employ master sculptors to ensure their constructs make beautiful statues. Older stone bulwarks might be weathered, with scuffed or cracked surfaces or missing noses and digits, but this weathering is largely cosmetic and doesn't adversely impact the bulwark's functionality.

action->Statuary Aura.name: Statuary Aura
action->Statuary Aura.description:
20 feet.

Rocks of marble magically arise from the ground in the aura. They protect the bulwark's allies, giving each of them standard @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Cover}. These stones can be used for Throw Rock.

This aura automatically activates at the start of the stone bulwark's first turn in combat and deactivates at the end of combat.

action->Binding Stone.name: Binding Stone
action->Binding Stone.description: Any creature hit by the stone bulwark's fist or rock Strike is affected by a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind} spell.

action->Inexorable March.name: Inexorable March
action->Inexorable March.description: The stone bulwark Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise it is damaged as if hit by the construct's fist.

action->Mythic Ferocity.name: Mythic Ferocity
action->Mythic Ferocity.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The stone bulwark is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 3}

Trigger The stone bulwark is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The stone bulwark avoids being knocked out and remains at half its maximum HP, but its wounded value increases by 1.

Shadowpact Tarantula.name: Shadowpact Tarantula
Shadowpact Tarantula.publicNotes:
Tarantulas are ambush predators, but will attack prey in the open.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

action->Giant Tarantula Venom.name: Giant Tarantula Venom
action->Giant Tarantula Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 8 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 4 2d6 poison damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

action->Hair Barrage.name: Hair Barrage
action->Hair Barrage.description: The tarantula flicks its legs, flinging spiky hairs in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. This deals @Damage[4d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save.

action->Hazard Immunity.name: Hazard Immunity
action->Hazard Immunity.description: The shadowpact tarantula never triggers the reactions of hazards in its own lair and is immune to the negative consequences of damaging area effects created by hazards in its lair (so if a PC set off a hazard that released a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} inside its lair, it would not take damage from the fireball even if it was within the fireball's area).

Shadowpact Vampire.name: Shadowpact Vampire
Shadowpact Vampire.publicNotes:
Vampire masterminds are evil wizards who control entire cabals of the undead and instill fear in the hearts of mortals far and wide.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Shadowpact Vampire.hpDetails: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, void healing

action->Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
action->Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

action->Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
action->Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

action->Mist Escape.name: Mist Escape
action->Mist Escape.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. They can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

They automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if they reaches their coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

action->Vampire Vulnerabilities.name: Vampire Vulnerabilities
action->Vampire Vulnerabilities.description:
All vampires possess the following vulnerabilities. Shadowpact vampires lack a typical vampire's vulnerability to sunlight.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures with strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless they're transported while they hide within their coffin, nor can they enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions—a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome their compulsion just as they do their revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a deity with a holy sanctification option. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so, and it remains brandished for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of their revulsion, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of their revulsion until they end an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of their revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents them from healing above 0 HP, even in their coffin. Staking a vampire requires 3 actions and works only if the vampire is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if they're in their coffin, the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with holy water while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

  • Giant Bat
    • Senses echolocation 40 feet,
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet,
    • Melee fangs +19 Damage 2d8+9 piercing

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Deadly Striker.name: Deadly Striker
action->Deadly Striker.description: The shadowpact vampire deals an additional 1d6 precision damage on their next Strike whenever they use an action to Stride 10 or more feet.

action->Dominate.name: Dominate
action->Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait (@Check[will|dc:]). The save DC uses the high spell DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The vampire mastermind hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The vampire expends the power stored in their signet ring. This gives the vampire the ability to cast one prepared spell they had already previously cast today without spending a spell slot. The vampire must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

action->Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
action->Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[10[healing]]{10 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drained value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt the vampire mastermind's spellcasting action, the vampire attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. If the vampire succeeds, their action isn't disrupted.

action->Turn to Mist.name: Turn to Mist
action->Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

action->Unimpeded.name: Unimpeded
action->Unimpeded.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The shadowpact vampire automatically ends one effect that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed.

Shambling Plague Zombie.name: Shambling Plague Zombie
Shambling Plague Zombie.publicNotes:
Plague zombies are infested with horrible contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Zombie Rot.name: Zombie Rot
action->Zombie Rot.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately

Shard-Empowered Levaloch.name: Shard-Empowered Levaloch
Shard-Empowered Levaloch.publicNotes:
Fearsome giants of jagged iron, levalochs serve in the armies of Hell as potent warriors and tenacious hunters-creatures of absolute discipline endlessly obedient to diabolical tyrants.

There are countless legions of lawful fiends in the nine layers of Hell, warring against the celestial planes and scouring the Material Plane for souls to corrupt.
Shard-Empowered Levaloch.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Hellstrider.name: Hellstrider
action->Hellstrider.description:
A levaloch ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. They take no damage from caltrops or from damaging terrain that deals physical, acid, or cold damage.

A levaloch can move through liquids up to 5 feet deep at their full Speed.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Phalanx Fighter.name: Phalanx Fighter
action->Phalanx Fighter.description:
All devils of equal or lower level adjacent to a levaloch gain a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC as the levaloch shields them from harm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.KjWPSJonzrZ8jv7X]{Effect: Phalanx Fighter}

action->Stable Stance.name: Stable Stance
action->Stable Stance.description: A levaloch gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude DC against being Shoved and to other saving throws to resist being moved against their will.

action->Barbed Net.name: Barbed Net
action->Barbed Net.description:
When a levaloch hits a creature with their barbed net, the net wraps around the target, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. If the Strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}.

When a creature [[/act escape dc=23]]{Escapes}, or if the Strike misses, the net crumbles into rust.

Each time a creature attempts to Escape, it takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage from the net's barbs, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HafP5vrdGdoqoFMo]{Effect: Barbed Net}

action->Forge Warshard Weapon.name: Forge Warshard Weapon
action->Forge Warshard Weapon.description: A levaloch recalls their warshard-infused iron back to create a new +1 striking trident or barbed net. A creatures on the line between the weapon and the levaloch must make a basic @Check[reflex|dc:23] save against @Damage[7d8[piercing]] damage. The levaloch's previous trident crumbles to rust. When the levaloch is destroyed, any tridents or barbed nets they created crumble to rust.

action->Merciless Thrust.name: Merciless Thrust
action->Merciless Thrust.description: When a levaloch hits a creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} conditions with a melee trident Strike, the Strike deals an additional [[/r 2d6]] damage.

Shard-Empowered Vordine.name: Shard-Empowered Vordine
Shard-Empowered Vordine.publicNotes:
The vast city of Dis trains endless legions of vordines to guard the upper layers of Hell and march across the planes at the archdevils' orders. Although quick to bend their knees to higher-ranking devils and even mortals favored by Asmodeus, vordines are relentlessly cruel to orts and other devils they can call their subordinates.

Although higher ranks in the infernal military are held by more powerful devils, like the nessari who serve as generals, a labyrinthine structure gives each vordine a rank and certain responsibilities. Some vordines are responsible for the battlefield command of squads, while others relay orders from above or are set to handling specific administrative tasks for their unit. The greatest gift one can offer a vordine is an increased rank to lord over other vordines.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.
Shard-Empowered Vordine.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Reactive Shield Arm.name: Reactive Shield Arm
action->Reactive Shield Arm.description:
Trigger A creature successfully Strikes the vordine

Effect The vordine immediately grows a warshard shield out of its arm, gaining +2 AC against the triggering Strike. This shield then functions as a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4k99nOJudmeNnBTF]{Shielded Arm} spell would.

action->Burning Hoofprints.name: Burning Hoofprints
action->Burning Hoofprints.description: The vordine Strides, trailing hoofprints in each square they exit. The hoofprints burn for 1 minute. A creature on the ground that enters a square with burning hoofprints or begins its turn in one takes @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage.

action->Trident of Dis.name: Trident of Dis
action->Trident of Dis.description: The vordine makes a trident Strike, increasing their reach to 10 feet for that Strike. If there is an unholy ally between the vordine and their target, that creature's energy causes the Strike to deal an additional 1d6 spirit damage.

action->Warshard Healing.name: Warshard Healing
action->Warshard Healing.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The vordine draws upon the power of the warshard to bolster its health. It gains fast healing 5 for 1 minute.

action->Pirate Training.name: Pirate Training
action->Pirate Training.description: Sharkskin ignores the usual penalties for using a bludgeoning or slashing melee weapon in water. In addition, xe can hold xir breath for 175 rounds before suffocating.

action->Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
action->Deny Advantage.description: Sharkskin isn't off-guard to creatures of 7th level or lower that are hidden, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.

action->Triangular Teeth.name: Triangular Teeth
action->Triangular Teeth.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Sharkskin would be hit by an attack against xir AC

Effect Xe gains a +1 circumstance bonus to xir AC against the attack, or a +2 circumstance bonus if the attack is in water or has the amphibious, aquatic, or water trait. Whether the attack hits or misses, xe gains a +2 status bonus to damage with the next Strike xe makes against the attacker before the end of xir next turn.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The creature's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are off-guard to Sharkskin.

action->Twin Feint.name: Twin Feint
action->Twin Feint.description: Sharkskin makes one Strike with xir +1 striking fearsome scimitar and then one with xir +1 striking underwater scimitar. If xe hits with the first attack, xir target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the second attack.

action->You're Next.name: You're Next
action->You're Next.description:
Trigger Sharkskin reduces an enemy to 0 hit points

Effect Sharkskin attempts an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize options=youre-next]] a single creature xe can see with a +2 circumstance bonus.

Shredder Tyrannosaurus.name: Shredder Tyrannosaurus
Shredder Tyrannosaurus.publicNotes:
Widely regarded as the king of the dinosaurs, the tyrannosaurus is a massive predator with a wide mouth filled with viciously sharp teeth. Some tribes of giants have even trained tyrannosauruses as mounts or beasts of war.

Remnants from the world's primeval era, these enormous reptilian animals still exist in large numbers in remote wildernesses or underground in magical Darklands caverns. Lizardfolk, orcs, giants, and other humanoids who live near dinosaurs use the animals as mounts, guards, or hunting beasts. Occasionally, rich nobles will collect dinosaurs to display them in menageries, which almost inevitably leads to cast-offs being nursed back to health by druids and other champions of nature. When dinosaurs establish themselves in regions outside their normal habitats, it's often the result of a large collection being released.

action->Fling.name: Fling
action->Fling.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the tyrannosaurus's jaws

Effect The tyrannosaurus flings the creature into the air up to 10 feet up from its mouth and 20 feet away. The creature falls 25 feet (assuming the tyrannosaurus flings it as high as it can) and takes falling damage accordingly. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save.

action->Pin Prey.name: Pin Prey
action->Pin Prey.description:
Trigger The tyrannosaurus critically hits a Large or smaller foe with its foot

Effect The creature struck by the foot is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and held in place. As long as the tyrannosaurus doesn't move from its position, the pinned creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

A tyrannosaurus gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack a creature it has pinned in this manner but can only Swallow Whole if that creature is grabbed with its jaws.

action->Gang Up.name: Gang Up
action->Gang Up.description: Silver Devil delinquents benefit from flanking a creature as long as at least two other Silver Devil delinquents are adjacent to that creature.

armor->Leather Jacket.name: Leather Jacket
armor->Leather Jacket.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Gang Up.name: Gang Up
action->Gang Up.description: Silver Devil hooligans benefit from flanking a creature as long as at least two other Silver Devil hooligans are adjacent to that creature.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: A Silver Devil hooligan deals 1d6 additional damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} opponent.

Singe (1-2).name: Singe (1-2)
Singe (1-2).descriptionHazard: Singe's spirit lingers in the Whippoorwill's crow's nest, where it calls out warnings and shoots intruders.
Singe (1-2).disable: @Check[pathfinder-society-lore|dc:17] (trained) to persuade Singe that you are Pathfinders or @Check[religion|dc:17](trained) to perform rites to lay Singe to rest; two total successes are required to disable the haunt
Singe (1-2).reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.
Singe (1-2).routine: d Singe uses its first action(s) to make a long gun Strike against a random creature in the area. It uses its final action for Lookout's Warning. If the PCs successfully use Pathfinder Society Lore to Disable the haunt, Singe loses an action to make a long gun Strike.

action->Repel Boarders!.name: Repel Boarders!
action->Repel Boarders!.description:
Trigger One or more creatures steps onto the Whippoorwill's wreckage

Effect Singe makes a long gun Strike against a random creature in the area, uses Lookout's Warning, and then rolls initiative.

action->Lookout's Warning.name: Lookout's Warning
action->Lookout's Warning.description:
Singe lets out one of the following cries, in order (repeating from the top, if necessary). Everyone in the haunt's area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:17] save. On a success, the creature is unaffected; on a critical success, it also gains a +2 circumstance bonus on its next save vs. Lookout's Warning. Other effects depend on the specific cry below.

  • Thar She Blows: "Captain, look! A huge whale! It's coming toward us—fast!" On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round, looking for the whale; on a critical failure it's fascinated for 1 minute, and the condition doesn't end if Singe makes a Strike on an ally or uses Lookout's Warning.
  • No Quarter: "It's coming around again! It's relentless! Brace for impact!" On a failure, the creature is tossed off balance; it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. On a critical failure, it's also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
  • Shark Bait: "Captain, it's hopeless! It's going to destroy the ship!" On a failure, a sense of doom fills the creature, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. On a critical failure, the fear is overwhelming, and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
  • Going Down with the Ship: "Get below, captain, and secure the Forked Key! I'll try to give you time!" On a failure, the creature must spend one action putting an item it is holding away; if it is not holding anything, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for one action. On a critical failure, it must spend three actions in a combination of putting away any items it is holding and fleeing.

Singe (3-4).name: Singe (3-4)
Singe (3-4).descriptionHazard: Singe's spirit lingers in the Whippoorwill's crow's nest, where it calls out warnings and shoots intruders.
Singe (3-4).disable: @Check[pathfinder-society-lore|dc:20] (trained) to persuade Singe that you are Pathfinders or @Check[religion|dc:20](trained) to perform rites to lay Singe to rest; two total successes are required to disable the haunt
Singe (3-4).reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.
Singe (3-4).routine: d Singe uses its first action(s) to make a long gun Strike against a random creature in the area. It uses its final action for Lookout's Warning. If the PCs successfully use Pathfinder Society Lore to Disable the haunt, Singe loses an action to make a long gun Strike.

On a critical failure, it must spend three actions in a combination of putting away any items it is holding and fleeing.

Singe (5-6).name: Singe (5-6)
Singe (5-6).descriptionHazard: Singe's spirit lingers in the Whippoorwill's crow's nest, where it calls out warnings and shoots intruders.
