On a critical failure, it must spend three actions in a combination of putting away any items it is holding and fleeing.

Singe (7-8).name: Singe (7-8)
Singe (7-8).descriptionHazard: Singe's spirit lingers in the Whippoorwill's crow's nest, where it calls out warnings and shoots intruders.
Singe (7-8).disable: @Check[pathfinder-society-lore|dc:27] (trained) to persuade Singe that you are Pathfinders or @Check[religion|dc:27](trained) to perform rites to lay Singe to rest; two total successes are required to disable the haunt
Singe (7-8).reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.
Singe (7-8).routine: d Singe uses its first action(s) to make a long gun Strike against a random creature in the area. It uses its final action for Lookout's Warning. If the PCs successfully use Pathfinder Society Lore to Disable the haunt, Singe loses an action to make a long gun Strike.

action->Repel Boarders!.name: Repel Boarders!
action->Repel Boarders!.description:
Trigger One or more creatures steps onto the Whippoorwill's wreckage

Effect Singe makes a long gun Strike against a random creature in the area, uses Lookout's Warning, and then rolls initiative.

action->Lookout's Warning.name: Lookout's Warning
action->Lookout's Warning.description:
Singe lets out one of the following cries, in order (repeating from the top, if necessary). Everyone in the haunt's area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save. On a success, the creature is unaffected; on a critical success, it also gains a +2 circumstance bonus on its next save vs. Lookout's Warning. Other effects depend on the specific cry below.

  • Thar She Blows: "Captain, look! A huge whale! It's coming toward us—fast!" On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round, looking for the whale; on a critical failure it's fascinated for 1 minute, and the condition doesn't end if Singe makes a Strike on an ally or uses Lookout's Warning.
  • No Quarter: "It's coming around again! It's relentless! Brace for impact!" On a failure, the creature is tossed off balance; it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. On a critical failure, it's also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
  • Shark Bait: "Captain, it's hopeless! It's going to destroy the ship!" On a failure, a sense of doom fills the creature, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. On a critical failure, the fear is overwhelming, and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
  • Going Down with the Ship: "Get below, captain, and secure the Forked Key! I'll try to give you time!" On a failure, the creature must spend one action putting an item it is holding away; if it is not holding anything, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for one action. On a critical failure, it must spend three actions in a combination of putting away any items it is holding and fleeing.

Soaring Nilith.name: Soaring Nilith
Soaring Nilith.publicNotes:
The sleek, dark niliths resemble hairless, emaciated tree sloths. These creatures are intensely dangerous and fearsome, with glowing red eyes, wicked claws, and mouths full of needlelike teeth. Niliths feed off the emotions, fears, and flesh of the living, and folktales posit that those who have nightmares of these creatures are fated to one day be eaten by them. Niliths draw intense joy from tormenting sapient creatures, often focusing their predations on the pious and the just, from whom they draw forth their most basic fears and worst thoughts and revel in their victims' subsequent terror. More often than not, these despicable manipulators wish to drive their victims into madness and even to suicide. Most niliths lack the patience to spend too much time fully tearing down an individual, and when a nilith tires of its current plaything and becomes bored with its particular thoughts and fears, it murders the quarry before feeding on its flesh and moving onto the next victim.

Niliths are actually extensions of much deadlier creatures that dwell in a distant dimension beyond dreams—in a way, niliths are little more than remote feeding machines for the unknown alien entities to which they are connected. Scholars and dimensional travelers have attempted to uncover the exact mechanisms of this mysterious connection, but they have yet to decipher the truth. Indeed, many who investigate the nature of a nilith's bond are driven to madness before getting anywhere close. The odd connection to otherworldly beings might help explain the longevity of these creatures, as it is believed that niliths can live for thousands of years.

Thankfully for others, niliths are solitary creatures that hate the company of their own kind, likely because these harbingers of nightmares have no wish to taste the horrors they bring to others.

action->Mind Crush.name: Mind Crush
action->Mind Crush.description:
Requirements The nilith has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The nilith reaches into the mind of the grabbed creature and implants disjointed images of the victim's worst fears and nightmares. The grabbed creature takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:31|basic] save. On a critical failure, the target is also affected as though by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Never Mind}, and it must attempt a second Will save against that effect.

Soggy Zombie Hulk.name: Soggy Zombie Hulk
Soggy Zombie Hulk.publicNotes:
These towering horrors rise from monstrous, gigantic corpses.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently slowed 1 and can't use reactions.

action->Corpse Throwing.name: Corpse Throwing
action->Corpse Throwing.description: A soggy zombie hulk can throw Medium or smaller corpses at foes. They can also throw Medium or smaller zombies for this purpose, who take just as much damage as the target they hit. A zombie that survives being thrown falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Moldy Meat.name: Moldy Meat
action->Moldy Meat.description: A creature hit by the soggy zombie hulk's hunk of wet meat or squelchy corpse Strike must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} on a failure (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that critically succeeds becomes temporarily immune for 1 hour.

action->Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
action->Wide Swing.description: The zombie hulk makes two hunk of wet meat Strikes against different targets within its reach.

Somewhat Haunted Hollows.name: Somewhat Haunted Hollows
Somewhat Haunted Hollows.descriptionHazard: The spirits of innumerable dryads and peaceful wood elementals, ripped from their bodies as they were turned into furniture, writhe and seethe, lashing out at both living and undead alike.
Somewhat Haunted Hollows.disable:
@Check[diplomacy|dc:14] (trained), @Check[nature|dc:14] (trained), or @Check[religion|dc:14] (trained) to set the spirits to rest or @Check[deception|dc:17], @Check[intimidation|dc:17], or @Check[occultism|dc:17] to convince the spirits that their eternal rest is coming soon.

A PC may make a Strike against AC 13 to destroy a single table or chair in the room, this functions as a successful check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} another PC attempting to disable the haunt; two total successes are required to disable the haunt. If all of the tables and chairs are destroyed, the haunt is temporarily disabled until dawn of the next day.
Somewhat Haunted Hollows.routine: (two actions) The Haunted Hollows haunt uses table flip or chair toss Strikes at different creatures in the area, favoring those who are trying to disable the haunt first, but otherwise choosing randomly. The table flip Strikes originate with any table in the room, destroying the table in the process. The chair toss Strikes originate with any chair or bar stool in the room, destroying that object in the process. If the haunt is not disabled, these objects reform and return to their original positions at dawn of the next day.

action->Warped Wood.name: Warped Wood
action->Warped Wood.description:
Trigger Any living or undead creatures approach within 30 feet of the haunt's locus (the center of the open balcony) inside the tavern

Effect The haunt makes a table flip Strike with a reach of 20 feet against a random creature in the area, and then rolls initiative.

action->Arcane Secrets.name: Arcane Secrets
action->Arcane Secrets.description:
Frequency once per round

Sotroz applies their arcane knowledge to a problem in a unique way, allowing them to roll any skill check using Arcana, even if they are untrained.

action->Ritual Sacrifice.name: Ritual Sacrifice
action->Ritual Sacrifice.description:
1 to 3

Requirements Sotroz is within 30 feet of a bonded cage that has a living small or tiny animal inside of it

Effect Sotroz steals the life-force of the trapped animal, killing it instantly and gaining one of the following abilities depending on the number of actions spent.

  • Gate Jump 1 Sotroz teleports to a space within any ritual circle in their sanctum.
  • Transmute Death 2 Sotroz casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Jmxru8zMdYMRuO5n]{Vision of Death} on a living target within 60 feet of their current location.
  • Life Steal 3 Sotroz casts a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.N1Z1oLPdBxaSgrEE]{Vampiric Feast} on a living target within 30 feet of their current location.

action->Cybernetics.name: Cybernetics
action->Cybernetics.description: The cybernetics of a cybernetic zombie can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=19]] check. A zombie's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A cybernetic zombie with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions (including self-destruct).

action->Self Destruct.name: Self Destruct
action->Self Destruct.description:
A cybernetic zombie must use this reaction unless its cybernetics are disabled

Trigger The cybernetic zombie is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The zombie's damaged cybernetics explode, dealing @Damage[(3d8+2)[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10-foot radius} (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). This ability destroys any technological items on the zombie.

Sparking Oozeshardling Node.name: Sparking Oozeshardling Node
Sparking Oozeshardling Node.descriptionHazard: A lump of bluish ooze shot through with what look like tiny silver shavings of metal. Once it has been activated, it glows with arcs of electricity that leap out at nearby targets.
Sparking Oozeshardling Node.disable: Two successful @Check[arcana|dc:23] or @Check[occultism|dc:23] (trained) checks on the oozeshardling to disperse its power, or @Check[acrobatics|dc:25] or @Check[thievery|dc:25] (expert) to remove the flecks of empowering warshard from within the oozeshardling. A failed Acrobatics or Thievery check to disable an oozeshardling results in the creature attempting the check taking @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage (@Damage[2d6[acid]] on a critical failure).
Sparking Oozeshardling Node.reset: The oozeshardling node collapses and melds back into the oozeshard after 1 minute, or disappears entirely if the oozeshard is slain.
Sparking Oozeshardling Node.routine: (3 actions) The oozeshardling uses its first action to make an electric spark Strike against one random non-ooze creature within range, its second action is used to move straight in a random cardinal direction (roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Direction]] to determine the direction), and its third action to make a second electric spark Strike against a different random non-ooze creature within range. The oozeshardling doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Sparking Oozeshardling Node.stealth: (trained) (or –10 and no minimum proficiency if the oozeshardling node's electric pulse reaction has been triggered)

action->Electric Pulse.name: Electric Pulse
action->Electric Pulse.description:
Trigger A creature enters a space within 10 feet of the sparking oozeshardling or the sparking oozeshardling is created by the divine oozeshard's Spawn Oozeshardling Node ability

Effect The sparking oozeshardling unleashes a shocking blast that deals @Damage[5d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around it (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

Sparking Plague Zombie.name: Sparking Plague Zombie
Sparking Plague Zombie.publicNotes:
Plague zombies are infested with horrible contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Short Circuit.name: Short Circuit
action->Short Circuit.description: The sparking zombie's broken implanted tech crackles with electricity. A creature that hits the zombie with an unarmed Strike takes @Damage[5[electricity]] damage.

action->Zombie Rot.name: Zombie Rot
action->Zombie Rot.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately.

Sparking Zombie Brute.name: Sparking Zombie Brute
Sparking Zombie Brute.publicNotes:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Short Circuit.name: Short Circuit
action->Short Circuit.description: The sparking zombie brute has been implanted with tech components that have malfunctioned and are crackling with electricity. A creature that hits the sparking zombie brute with an unarmed Strike takes @Damage[5[electricity]] damage.

Spiders' Hunting Pit.name: Spiders' Hunting Pit
Spiders' Hunting Pit.descriptionHazard: Loose debris covers a patch of what appears as solid ground in a 10 feet by 5 feet area. It's actually covering thin webbing strung over a 20 foot pit.
Spiders' Hunting Pit.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18] (trained) to deconstruct the webbing or @Check[acrobatics|dc:20] to pull the webbing apart without getting trapped or hit by rocks.

action->Pitfall.name: Pitfall
action->Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature that isn't a spider walks onto the webbing

Effect The triggering creature falls in, taking @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save from rocks tumbling into the pit.

action->Site Bound.name: Site Bound
action->Site Bound.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: The spirit hound returns with the Caretaker.

action->Frightful Moan.name: Frightful Moan
action->Frightful Moan.description: The spirit hound howls, forcing each living creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to attempt a @Check[will|dc:15|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, the creature is temporarily immune to this hound's frightful moan for 1 minute.

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: The spirit hound's Strikes deal 1d4 extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of its allies.

Sticky Webbing.name: Sticky Webbing
Sticky Webbing.descriptionHazard: Fine, sticky threads of spiders' silk are strung across their lair.
Sticky Webbing.disable: @Check[survival|dc:15] or @Check[thievery|dc:15] to carefully remove the strands.

action->Capturing Strands.name: Capturing Strands
action->Capturing Strands.description:
Trigger A creature that isn't a spider moves into the sticky webbing

Effect The sticky webbing covers the triggering creature's body. The triggering creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:19] save or is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until a 2 maneuver is performed to clean off the sticky webbing.

Sudden Drop.name: Sudden Drop
Sudden Drop.descriptionHazard: A portion of Manaket's sewer system is under construction and has been left covered by only a few planks of wood since the Godsrain. After two weeks of wear, they're ready to collapse.
Sudden Drop.disable: If all the PCs succeed on a Perception check against the Stealth DC to spot the hazard, they're able to detour around the weakened boards without triggering it. There's not enough time for PCs who succeed on this check to warn PCs who fail.

action->Break Through.name: Break Through
action->Break Through.description:
Trigger One or more PCs fail to spot the hazard and step onto the weakened boards

Effect The boards give way, dropping the PCs 5 feet into the open septic tank. The PCs can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}; those who fail and fall into the tank become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and cannot reduce this condition until after the Ambush! in Kassi's lab.

Triggering this hazard also accrues 1 AP for the party.

Tempestuous Koi Egg.name: Tempestuous Koi Egg
Tempestuous Koi Egg.descriptionHazard: A raging storm covers the mountain lake as spring water levitates from the lake to fall back down in a driving spiral of steaming rain. In the depths of the storm, barely visible, is a tiny koi egg surrounded by three bands of water.
Tempestuous Koi Egg.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:29], @Check[religion|dc:29], @Check[nature|dc:29], or @Check[occultism|dc:29] to purify the magic corrupting the ascension ritual, or @Check[diplomacy|dc:32] or @Check[performance|dc:32] to soothe the spirit within the koi egg and give it the strength to fight off the corruption itself; four total successes are required to purify the ritual, each of the first three successes purifying one ring of water and the final one halting the ritual itself. If the cursed comb has not been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check merely halts the ritual; if the cursed comb has been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check completes the ascension ritual.
Tempestuous Koi Egg.reset: The turbulent koi egg can attempt to hatch again, restarting the ascension ritual, after 1000 years of Xalreonshin's care.
Tempestuous Koi Egg.routine: (1 action) Torrential water descends from the sky, taking the shape of a dragon that smashes into one creature within 60 feet of the egg. The dragon always targets the creature that is closest to the egg, dealing @Damage[2d12[bludgeoning],2d12[fire]]{2d12 bludgeoning damage and 2d12 fire} damage in a spray of boiling water (@Check[fortitude|dc:28] save). Creatures that fail the save are pushed 10 feet away. Creatures that have the earth trait, are carrying an item with the earth trait, or are otherwise strongly tied to elemental earth (such as an earth elemental sorcerer or kineticist) get the result one degree of success better than the outcome of their save, as the power of elemental earth overcomes water.

action->Immune to All Damage (Until Fina.name: Immune to All Damage (Until Final Ring is Purified)

action->Raise the Storm.name: Raise the Storm
action->Raise the Storm.description:
Trigger Xalreonshin rolls initiative, three rounds pass after the PCs begin speaking with Xalreonshin, or a creature other than Xalreonshin comes within 40 feet of the egg

Effect The turbulent koi egg churns the lake surface, ejecting water into the sky. A 1-mile-radius area centered on the egg becomes filled with heavy rain and strong wind imposing a -2 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and requiring flying creatures to [[/act maneuver-in-flight dc=24]].

action->Site Bound.name: Site Bound
action->Site Bound.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When defeated, The Caretaker returns in 1 hour, unless he is released with a @Check[religion|dc:22] check or convinced that the PCs are friendly with a @Check[diplomacy|dc:16] check.

action->Inhabit Object.name: Inhabit Object
action->Inhabit Object.description: The Caretaker possess an object of size Large or smaller within 20 feet, making it an animated object (maximum level 1). If the target object is being held by a creature, the bearer can attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save to prevent the possession. The possession ends when the object is destroyed or the Caretaker leaves it. At this point, the Caretaker reappears in the object's square and can't Inhabit an Object again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Inhabit an Object]]{1d4 rounds}.

The Elite Appraiser.name: The Elite Appraiser
The Elite Appraiser.publicNotes:
Neither human nor beast yet resembling both, yeongno (yeong-no) are creatures that once were denizens of heaven but were cast out, down to the mortal Universe, due to their own greed. Yeongno claim to have once been celestial dragons and wear elongated dragon masks with full-body wraps decorated with scale patterns in honor of this claim—though no one has been able to confirm the veracity of this belief. As they wander, they hold a willow pipe in their mouths, producing a distinct "bibi" sound that often heralds their appearance.

Despite their reputation as monsters who eat people, yeongno are welcomed by the poor and oppressed, who see the creatures as wise and just. Yeongno believe that by eating 100 wealthy individuals who abuse their wealth or who accumulated their wealth by underhanded or exploitative means, they can atone for their own greed, allowing them to ascend back into heaven. A corrupt and greedy individual can escape their fate of being eaten by a yeongno by giving away all of their wealth and agreeing to be transformed into a pig for one year. If the person can endure one year living as a pig in the care of a household they once harmed, the yeongno will spare them.
The Elite Appraiser.privateNotes:
Glutton's Redemption

Yeongno eat the corrupt and wealthy as a symbolic means of consuming their own greed. While yeongno aspire to ascend from their current existence, they also actively sabotage other creatures hoping to do the same. They feel particularly threatened by imugi, whom the yeongno believe would take their spots in heaven.

action->Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet.name: Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet
action->Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet.description: The yeongno can detect the presence, location, and approximate value of gold within 120 feet.

action->Fortune's Favor.name: Fortune's Favor
action->Fortune's Favor.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect A target creature within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:25] save or gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis}, being polymorphed into a pig whose girth is determined by the target's wealth. After 24 hours, the target can end this effect using a Dismiss action, at which point the yeongno becomes aware that the effect has ended. A yeongno can use Fortune's Favor only if no targets are currently under its effects.

action->Money is Pain.name: Money is Pain
action->Money is Pain.description:
Requirements The target is carrying at least 100 gp worth of precious metals

Effect The yeongno crushes a creature it can see with the weight of their wealth. Apparitions of gold coins approximating the wealth of the target materialize and pummel the target from all sides. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[3d6[persistent,mental]] damage and is slowed 1 as long as the damage continues. The effect immediately ends if they're carrying less than 100 gp worth of precious metals.

Critical Failure As failure, except any flat checks to remove the persistent damage automatically fail.

The Heartwood Rots.name: The Heartwood Rots
The Heartwood Rots.publicNotes:
Vampires use their servitor pawns for infiltration and reconnaissance.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
The Heartwood Rots.hpDetails: coffin restoration, fast healing 5, void healing

action->Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
action->Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

action->Rotten Burst.name: Rotten Burst
action->Rotten Burst.description: When The Heartwood Rots dies, a burst of primal void energy explodes from her body, restoring @Damage[2d8[healing,void]]{2d8} Hit Points to each undead fungi or plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] and killing all natural plants, though merely causing discomfort to creatures with the plant trait. This area is filled with rotten vegetation, becoming difficult terrain.

action->Vampire Vulnerabilities.name: Vampire Vulnerabilities
action->Vampire Vulnerabilities.description:
All vampires possess the following vulnerabilities.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures with strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless they're transported while they hide within their coffin, nor can they enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions—a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome their compulsion just as they do their revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a deity with a holy sanctification option. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so, and it remains brandished for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of their revulsion, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of their revulsion until they end an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of their revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents them from healing above 0 HP, even in their coffin. Staking a vampire requires 3 actions and works only if the vampire is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if they're in their coffin, the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with holy water while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends their turn in sunlight, and the condition ends when they're no longer in sunlight. If the vampire loses all their actions in this way, they're destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors

action->Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
action->Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains @Damage[5[healing]]{5 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drained value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The Heartwood Rots deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Locust Horde.name: Locust Horde
action->Locust Horde.description: Once the Husk of Deskari has been reduced to 160 hp the surviving locusts retreat inside the Husk rather than surrounding it. At this point the Disgorge Swarm aura ceases to function, the Husk loses its weakness to splash effects and area of effect attacks, and any creature still taking persistent damage from this effect automatically succeeds on their next flat check to remove it.

action->Cacophony.name: Cacophony
action->Cacophony.description: The droning buzz of locusts fills the air and mingles with the rasping, screeching sounds of the Husk's carapace plates grinding as it moves. Any creature that begins its turn or moves within 60 feet of the Husk of Deskari must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. After attempting the save a creature is immune to the effects of cacophony for 1 minute. On a critical failure, a creature is only immune for 1 round.

action->Disgorge Swarm.name: Disgorge Swarm
action->Disgorge Swarm.description:
Millions of fiendish locusts swarm out of the Husk of Deskari, surrounding it in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. The emanation moves with the Husk and remains until removed by Locust Horde. Any creature that enters or begins its turn in the emanation must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:36|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save, with effects based on the results of the save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for one minute.

action->Swarmsense.name: Swarmsense
action->Swarmsense.description: The Husk of Deskari can see through the eyes of each insect in the swarms infesting its body or those created by its breath weapon. This grants the Husk of Deskari All-Around Vision.

action->Locust Horde.name: Locust Horde
action->Locust Horde.description: Once the Husk of Deskari has been reduced to 200 hp the surviving locusts retreat inside the Husk rather than surrounding it. At this point the Disgorge Swarm aura ceases to function, the Husk loses its weakness to splash effects and area of effect attacks, and any creature still taking persistent damage from this effect automatically succeeds on their next flat check to remove it.

action->Cacophony.name: Cacophony
action->Cacophony.description: The droning buzz of locusts fills the air and mingles with the rasping, screeching sounds of the Husk's carapace plates grinding as it moves. Any creature that begins its turn or moves within 60 feet of the Husk of Deskari must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. After attempting the save a creature is immune to the effects of cacophony for 1 minute. On a critical failure, a creature is only immune for 1 round.

action->Disgorge Swarm.description:

Any creature that enters or begins its turn in the emanation must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:37|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save, with effects based on the results of the save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for one minute.

action->Swarmsense.name: Swarmsense
action->Swarmsense.description: The Husk of Deskari can see through the eyes of each insect in the swarms infesting its body or those created by its breath weapon. This grants the Husk of Deskari All-Around Vision.

Thorns of the Rose Pit.name: Thorns of the Rose Pit
Thorns of the Rose Pit.descriptionHazard: Decorated smooth-hewn flagstone flooring gives way along hidden seams to a 20-foot square, 25-foot-deep pit festooned with spikes and blades of petrified wood in the darkness below.
Thorns of the Rose Pit.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20] (trained) to disable the trap door mechanism
Thorns of the Rose Pit.reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trap door must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.
Thorns of the Rose Pit.stealth: (or 0 if the trap door is disabled or broken) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}

action->Pitfall.name: Pitfall
action->Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trap door

Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes falling damage (typically @Damage[10[bludgeoning]] damage). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

When creatures fall into the pit, the petrified wood spikes along the floor grow to attempt to plunge into the triggering creature.

Thorns of the Rose Pit (5-6).name: Thorns of the Rose Pit (5-6)
Thorns of the Rose Pit (5-6).descriptionHazard: Decorated smooth-hewn flagstone flooring gives way along hidden seams to a 20-foot square, 25-foot-deep pit festooned with spikes and blades of petrified wood in the darkness below.
Thorns of the Rose Pit (5-6).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:22] (trained) to disable the trap door mechanism
Thorns of the Rose Pit (5-6).reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trap door must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.
Thorns of the Rose Pit (5-6).stealth: (or 0 if the trap door is disabled or broken) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}

action->Pitfall.name: Pitfall
action->Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trap door

Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes falling damage (typically @Damage[10[bludgeoning]] damage). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

When creatures fall into the pit, the petrified wood spikes along the floor grow to attempt to plunge into the triggering creature.

Tired Dockhand.name: Tired Dockhand
Tired Dockhand.publicNotes:
Working to load and unload cargo from ships, dockhands are considered unruly, but many stay focused and work hard until the job is done.

Society is built upon the backs of laborers.

armor->Work Clothes (Functions as Leathe.name: Work Clothes (Functions as Leather Armor)
armor->Work Clothes (Functions as Leathe.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Whiskey.name: Whiskey
consumable->Whiskey.description:
Alcohol is a common substance available in stunning variety. The Price of a dose of alcohol depends on the specific beverage. You can't recover from the sickened condition from alcohol while affected.

If you fail a saving throw against alcohol other than initial saves, the affliction's stage doesn't increase; the only way to increase the stage of alcohol's affliction is to consume more alcohol.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:12]

Onset 10 minutes

Stage 1 +1 item bonus to saving throws against fear (10 minutes)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, +1 item bonus to saving throws against fear effects (10 minutes)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, off-guard, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (10 minutes)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (10 minutes)

Stage 5 clumsy 2, sickened 2, and stupefied 2 (10 minutes)

Stage 6 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (8 hours)

Stage 7 death

action->Heft Crate.name: Heft Crate
action->Heft Crate.description:
Requirements The dockhand is adjacent to a crate

Effect The dockhand picks up a crate and heaves it up to 15 feet. Upon landing, the crate breaks open in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5]. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:13|basic|options:area-effect] save, and the area is difficult terrain until cleared.

action->Swig.name: Swig
action->Swig.description: The dockhand Interacts to either draw a bottle of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.UMAXLDpI6YLSfYX1]{Alcohol} or pick up a nearby unattended bottle of alcohol, then drinks the whole thing. For 1 minute, the dockhand gains a +2 item bonus to melee damage rolls and saving throws against fear but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

Tough Puddles Ghoul.name: Tough Puddles Ghoul
Tough Puddles Ghoul.publicNotes:
Ghouls stalkers are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

action->Slurp Blood.name: Slurp Blood
action->Slurp Blood.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the tough Puddles ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul bites the creature, slurping its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the target's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim takes @Damage[(1d8+3)[piercing]] damage and the tough Puddles ghoul regains @Damage[4[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary HP.

action->Swift Movement.name: Swift Movement
action->Swift Movement.description: The Puddles ghoul jumps up to half its Speed or swims up to half its swim Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Trained Triceratops.name: Trained Triceratops
Trained Triceratops.publicNotes:
Triceratopses are muscular quadrupeds with powerful short legs, thick necks, and heads crowned by a wide, bony frill. Though they bear three large horns, they use these bony protrusions only to defend themselves or fight for dominance. Short-tempered and obstinate, triceratopses are unlikely to back down from a fight unless they are hopelessly outmatched, and the creatures are known to fight to the death for no apparent reason beyond stubbornness. Triceratopses often serve as mounts for humanoids, particularly giants, who can comfortably ride behind the dinosaurs' protective bone frills. A triceratops is 30 feet long and weighs as much as 10 tons.

Remnants from the world's primeval era, these enormous reptilian animals still exist in large numbers in remote wildernesses or underground in magical Darklands caverns. Lizardfolk, orcs, giants, and other humanoids who live near dinosaurs use the animals as mounts, guards, or hunting beasts. Occasionally, rich nobles will collect dinosaurs to display them in menageries, which almost inevitably leads to cast-offs being nursed back to health by druids and other champions of nature. When dinosaurs establish themselves in regions outside their normal habitats, it's often the result of a large collection being released.

action->Frill Defense.name: Frill Defense
action->Frill Defense.description:
Trigger The rider is targeted with an attack.

Requirements A creature must be mounted on the triceratops.

Effect The triceratops intercepts the attack with its bony frill. The rider gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.enrTKgEzu2quCj0z]{Effect: Frill Defense}

action->Lumbering Charge.name: Lumbering Charge
action->Lumbering Charge.description: The triceratops Strides up to 10 feet and then makes a Strike.

action->Vicious Gore.name: Vicious Gore
action->Vicious Gore.description: A triceratops deals 2d6 extra persistent bleed damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} targets it hits with its horns.

Treacherous Scree.name: Treacherous Scree
Treacherous Scree.descriptionHazard: The footing on this sloped ground appears to be stable at first glance, but the tiny rocks that cover it are loosely packed and prone to slipping.

action->Rockslide.name: Rockslide
action->Rockslide.description:
Trigger A creature steps on the unstable ground

Effect Rocks tumble and slip beneath its feet. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save as they tumble against the rocks, which deal @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in its space.

Failure The creature takes full damage, falls prone in its space, and tumbles down to the bottom of the slope.

Critical Failure As failure, but double damage.

Turbulent Koi Egg.name: Turbulent Koi Egg
Turbulent Koi Egg.descriptionHazard: A raging storm covers the mountain lake as spring water levitates from the lake to fall back down in a driving spiral of steaming rain. In the depths of the storm, barely visible, is a tiny koi egg surrounded by three bands of water.
Turbulent Koi Egg.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:27], @Check[religion|dc:27], @Check[nature|dc:27], or @Check[occultism|dc:27] to purify the magic corrupting the ascension ritual, or @Check[diplomacy|dc:30] or @Check[performance|dc:30] to soothe the spirit within the koi egg and give it the strength to fight off the corruption itself; four total successes are required to purify the ritual, each of the first three successes purifying one ring of water and the final one halting the ritual itself. If the cursed comb has not been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check merely halts the ritual; if the cursed comb has been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check completes the ascension ritual.
Turbulent Koi Egg.reset: The turbulent koi egg can attempt to hatch again, restarting the ascension ritual, after 1000 years of Xalreonshin's care.
Turbulent Koi Egg.routine: (1 action) Torrential water descends from the sky, taking the shape of a dragon that smashes into one creature within 60 feet of the egg. The dragon always targets the creature that is closest to the egg, dealing @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning],2d10[fire]]{2d10 bludgeoning damage and 2d10 fire} damage in a spray of boiling water (@Check[fortitude|dc:26] save). Creatures that fail the save are pushed 10 feet away. Creatures that have the earth trait, are carrying an item with the earth trait, or are otherwise strongly tied to elemental earth (such as an earth elemental sorcerer or kineticist) get the result one degree of success better than the outcome of their save, as the power of elemental earth overcomes water.

action->Immune to All Damage (Until Fina.name: Immune to All Damage (Until Final Ring is Purified)

action->Raise the Storm.name: Raise the Storm
action->Raise the Storm.description:
Trigger Xalreonshin rolls initiative, three rounds pass after the PCs begin speaking with Xalreonshin, or a creature other than Xalreonshin comes within 40 feet of the egg

Effect The turbulent koi egg churns the lake surface, ejecting water into the sky. A 1-mile-radius area centered on the egg becomes filled with heavy rain and strong wind imposing a -2 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and requiring flying creatures to [[/act maneuver-in-flight dc=22]].

Typhoon Koi Egg.descriptionHazard: A raging storm covers the mountain lake as spring water levitates from the lake to fall back down in a driving spiral of steaming rain. In the depths of the storm, barely visible, is a tiny koi egg surrounded by three bands of water.

If the cursed comb has not been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check merely halts the ritual; if the cursed comb has been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check completes the ascension ritual.

The dragon always targets the creature that is closest to the egg, dealing @Damage[(2d12+2)[bludgeoning],2d12[fire]]{2d12+2 bludgeoning damage and 2d12 fire} damage in a spray of boiling water (@Check[fortitude|dc:28] save). Creatures that fail the save are pushed 10 feet away. Creatures that have the earth trait, are carrying an item with the earth trait, or are otherwise strongly tied to elemental earth (such as an earth elemental sorcerer or kineticist) get the result one degree of success better than the outcome of their save, as the power of elemental earth overcomes water.

action->Face Me!.name: Face Me!
action->Face Me!.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet deals damage to Matriarch Szvetneera

Effect The Ulfen bodyguard lets out a threating bellow at whoever injured their ward. They then attempt a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} against the triggering creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to the check.

action->Back Away!.name: Back Away!
action->Back Away!.description:
The Ulfen bodyguard attacks the target, pushing them back and away from their charge. The bodyguard makes a Strike against the creature, then attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} their target. Depending on the outcome of their Strike, there may be additional effects.

Critical Success The Ulfen bodyguard gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their attempt to Shove.

Success The Ulfen bodyguard gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their attempt to Shove.

Failure There is no effect.

Critical Failure The Ulfen bodyguard is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of their next turn.

action->Face Me!.name: Face Me!
action->Face Me!.description:

Success The Ulfen witchguard gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their attempt to Shove.
